The person in this position will assist in providing data extraction, quality control, descriptive statistical analysis, data visualization and communication support for student information data in support of academic planning and institutional reporting. Using SQL, create queries of student data from appropriate enterprise student information systems
Working fluently and independently in Excel, perform data quality control, join data sets with vlookup, and develop reports with pivot tables
Perform various data quality functions for data from multiple systems such as profile, cleanse, validate, and audit to ensure data quality and integrity
Create Tableau workbooks, dashboards, Excel reports, and summary tables (suitable for PowerPoint and Adobe PDF) to support academic planning decisions
Combine and analyze data from five or more different sources.
Lead and participate in projects that require advanced data and business analysis skills, including best in practice methodologies and modeling
Working both independently and in a team, provide strategic and tactical, data based, solutions and recommendations to senior leadership
Perform other work-related duties as assigned

Certificate or degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics or related quantitative field
Experience with SQL, Tableau, Banner, Slate, and Starfish, or the desire to learn
Proven sophisticated Microsoft Excel Skills
Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively
Excellent verbal, written, and data visualization communication skills

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics or related quantitative field

The Role: Data Research Analyst

The Location: New York

Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 10

The Team: The Global Data Management (GDM) team within the Global Index Management & Production Group (IMPG)

The Impact:
IMPG has intensive operational processes to manage and validate both internal and external market data, allowing analysts to act on those events in a timely and informed manner. Accuracy and timing are two keys to the success of daily data management and index

The GDM Data Research Analyst is responsible for the acquisition, management and quality of a variety of data items used for the production and maintenance of S&P Dow Jones-branded indices.

The successful candidate would be expected to carry out tasks associated with the management of data used for the production and maintenance of indices.

Additionally, the Data Associate is responsible for a wide range of data points across global markets and is responsible for ensuring quality, accuracy and timely delivery of these data points to internal stakeholders and external clients.

What’s in it for you:
The role is a part of the GDM team, which is central to SPDJI’s overall vision and mission to onboard and manage all kinds of data requirements for the development and maintenance of S&P Dow Jones branded indices. The group works closely with other departmental groups (Index Managers, Market Managers, Index Calculation & Distribution, Data Operations and Solutions) and across the firm (Technology, Product Management, Research & Development, etc) to implement the IMPG agenda and benefit from the substantial resources and expertise available within the SPDJI organization.

As a member of the GDM team, you will work collaboratively with a wide range of data points, indices and other products across global markets. You must be able to analyze and implement complex data processes and calculation methodology and resolve issues that may arise.

Responsibilities:
The successful candidate would be a member of the GDM team based in New York and will help capture, quality screen and present data sets in time for their delivery to end clients or use in the further calculation or rebalancing of indices;

Develop a detailed understanding of the way each data set is used in the production and maintenance of S&P Dow Jones Indices;

Calculation and maintenance of all underlying data (including but not limited to ESG data ) used for S&P and Dow Jones branded indices, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of index data to clients and end users;

Work with a global team of index managers, data and IT specialists, and vendors to support research into companies’ climate risk profile based on various financial and climate-related indicators;

Conduct an efficient data quality assurance (QA) process including assessing results, compiling and reporting QA findings;

Provide support in implementation, testing, and documentation of new models;

Contribute to process improvements to ensure consistent data quality and efficiency;

Address internal/client queries pertaining to a company’s climate risk profile;

Contribute to working committees, projects, or perform other tasks as deemed necessary by the business.

Liaise with data vendors (S&P Global Sustainable1 and Trucost in particular) to understand data structure and definitions, incorporating this knowledge into our data management processes

Producing documentation and specifications for the logic used in rules and intermediate storage solutions, working with technology teams to ensure all requirements are clear and ready to be migrated to permanent IT solutions, where appropriate, collaborate with business analysts (DOS) on user testing, documenting results as appropriate

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in sustainability, statistics, or finance-related degrees

Familiarity with climate models, including carbon metrics, would be an advantage

Proficient in MS office. Experience with SQL/Python would be an advantage

Minimum of 3 years of professional experience with financial data, particularly ESG data and Company Fundamentals

Prior experience in production processes requiring strict adherence to SLA’s, delivery timelines and quality

In addition, we are looking for someone who can demonstrate…

Analytical skills and has strong attention to details

Self-starter with good problem-solving skills

Fast learner and strong logical thinker (out of the box)

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Anticipate problems and opportunities, and adapt to new challenges

Ability to work with multiple stakeholders in a collaborative global team environment

Must be able to accomplish assignments/tasks with little or no supervision

Must be self-motivated, goal-oriented, and be able to display excellent customer service skills

S&P Dow Jones Indices

At S&P Dow Jones Indices, our role can be described in one word: essential. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average®. More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world; with over 1,000,000 indices, S&P Dow Jones Indices defines the way people measure and trade the markets. We provide essential intelligence that helps investors identify and capitalize on global opportunities.

S&P Dow Jones Indices is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spdji.com .

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $ 55,900 and $127,700. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

Octane is a Fintech company whose mission is to connect people with their passions. The transaction process for large purchases such as powersports, RVs, boats, and home improvements is slow and frustrating, but Octane is changing that through automated underwriting, innovative credit products, and financing through our in-house lender Roadrunner Financial. Octane reaches millions of enthusiasts through editorial brands like Cycle World and Cycle Volta and helps consumers buy their favorite products with instant, frictionless financing on Octane.co. Octane is revolutionizing lending in under-served verticals that account for tens of billions of dollars in annual transactions.

Octane is gaining traction quickly with customers, as evidenced by growth in originations through our platform of more than $1B since inception. Octane works with more than 3,500 merchants in the USA and offers promotional financing with low rates for more than 40 OEM brands. Because we're the platform and the lender, we have both high growth and positive unit economics - rare for a fintech. We have raised more than $192M in capital from leading investors, including Valar Ventures, IA Ventures, Contour Venture Partners, Third Prime, Progressive Insurance and Citi Ventures and our lending securities are rated AA by Standard & Poor's.

What We Need

We are looking for a data analyst who is excited to help our business teams make forward-thinking decisions. You will work on extracting insights from various databases across our company and ensuring our datasets tell an accurate story. As a successful candidate in this role, you are excited to tackle a variety of different business problems by working alongside our data engineers to make sure internal teams, such as our capital markets and credit strategy teams, have their data requirements met. You will assist in the development of business-critical dashboards, third-party reports, and queries and with investigations for data quality issues. You are meticulous, have a keen sense for data integrity, and are not afraid to tackle problems using technical solutions.

What You'll Do

Perform business-critical SQL queries to test new data pipelines and provide the product, finance, and risk teams with evidence to support key decisions and major company-wide initiatives
Assist with the automation of the creation, data validation, and distribution of mission critical reports across the company
Lead data quality and issue investigations and collaborate with stakeholders across the company to fix them
Champion a data-driven, test-and-learn culture with your knack for telling stories with data and developing accurate internal and third-party reporting and dashboards
Work closely with our data engineering team to discover opportunities for improvements in our pipelines and develop solutions to automate existing data transfer processes

Who You Are

A Bachelor's Degree with at least 1-2 years of experience working at a finance or technology company in an analytical function.
You are proficient at writing SQL. Python experience is a plus.
You can speak to and are comfortable with working in multiple types of databases and SQL dialects.
You are familiar with cloud-based data environments. Experience leveraging Amazon Web Services (AWS) technologies for data-related initiatives is a plus.
You have the ability to recognize data patterns and understand when a particular field or table is not in line with business expectations.
You have top-tier written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Benefits

Robust Health Care Plans (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Up to 5 weeks PTO (self-managed)
Generous Parental Leave
Retirement Plan (401k) with Company contribution
Educational Assistance/Tuition Reimbursement up to $3K/year
Powersports Safety Benefit: reimbursement of up to $500/year for the purchase of any powersports safety equipment
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Short Term / Long Term Disability & Life insurance
Team Activities (remotely)
Monthly company gift

Join a small, dynamic team that's raising the bar for health center analytics.
Relevant’s mission is to support community health centers in their drive to improve patient health. We do this by providing smart, friendly analytics software, along with hands-on support and consulting to help health centers tackle all kinds of data challenges.
Health centers love working with us, and our data analysts are a key reason why. They lead implementations of our platform, often helping to resolve organization-wide pain points around data and reporting along the way. After implementation, they act as a resource for the health center’s internal data team, helping them solve hard problems, sharing knowledge and best practices, and building up their internal capacity.
This job is both technical and people-oriented. We have the capacity to provide mentorship for our next data analyst, so if this sounds exciting to you but you don't meet every qualification listed below, please don't hesitate to apply anyway, and let us know why you think we'd be a good fit.
Main responsibilities
Lead new health center implementations. Conduct stakeholder meetings, collect requirements, map EMR data points, write lots of SQL, and get folks excited about collaborating with Relevant!
Provide analytics support to our health centers. Ensure that our platform is being used as effectively as possible to improve patient outcomes and health center operations. Provide support for health center data initiatives; build reports and data visualizations as required; lead regular stakeholder meetings.
Become an expert user of our platform. Test new features, provide training for health center data analysts, and propose improvements and new features based on user feedback.
Preferred qualifications
One or more year's experience extracting and cleaning data from electronic health record systems, or other similarly messy and complex production systems.
Ability to write complex SQL queries. We’re looking for comfort with concepts like subqueries, temp tables, and window functions, or the desire and aptitude to learn.
Excel wizardry. For example, we'd love for you to know everything there is to know about Pivot Tables.
Familiarity with a BI platform such as Tableau, Qlik, Cognos, Crystal.
Familiarity and interest in the landscape of healthcare quality improvement and population health management.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Some experience with scripting languages such as Python or Ruby, or a desire and aptitude to learn.
Be nice, and value collaboration.
Working at Relevant
Join a small team of people (currently, there are 18 of us) who love what we do and continually strive to delight our customers.
Help us build a company culture that's friendly, respectful, and encourages continual learning.
Competitive salary, excellent benefits (we pay 100% of employee healthcare premiums), 401(k) with employer contribution, generous vacation policy, and a general emphasis on happiness and sanity.
When we're not experiencing a pandemic, our office space in downtown Manhattan is provided by WeWork, with the attendant nice amenities: social spaces, lots of natural light, reasonably good coffee and espresso.
How to Apply
Send an email to jobs@relevant.healthcare with the subject line "Health Center Data Analyst." When responding, include a resume and a note in the body of the email explaining your interest in the position. Please also include the phrase "potato zebra" in your note, so that we know you read this.
We're committed to building a diverse company. Applicants who identify with groups that are under-represented in the technology industry are strongly encouraged to apply.

Strength Through Diversity
The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity, equity and inclusion are drivers for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Affinity Solutions develops and delivers data-led intelligence platform solutions that use granular purchase signals from nearly 100,000 credit and debit cards, matched to third-party datasets, to help brand marketers, agencies, media organizations, and other enterprises deliver high impact experiences and results that provably grow their businesses and enrich consumers’ lives. Building on our foundation of innovative loyalty solutions for Financial Institutions and precision marketing for Retailers we’ve redefined data-driven consumer insights and marketing to make it highly personalized, engaging, and effective.
Business/Data Analyst
Affinity Solutions is seeking a smart, curious, technically savvy candidate to join our cutting-edge data science team. We hire the best and brightest and give them the opportunity to work on industry-leading technologies.
The Data Science team at AFS build models and machine learning algorithms that power all our ad-tech/mar-tech products at scale, develop methodology and tools to precisely and effectively measure market campaign effects, and research in-house and public data sources for consumer spend behavior insights.
In this role, you'll be focusing on the area of the consumer/retailer market insights. However, you'll also have the opportunity to come up with new ideas and solutions that will lead to improvement of our ability to target the right audience, derive insights and provide better measurement methodology for marketing campaigns.
Duties and Responsibilities
Provide analytical/statistical analysis and execution support to clients and internal stakeholders on insights hypothesis development, test and measurement design, insights discovery and reporting.
Research, identify, compile and report anecdotal or systematic public and third party data sources (For example, Census business survey, MRTS, E-commerce data, National payment trends, consumer spend, retail store opening and closing data and retailer M&A etc.) to facilitate market and sales insights fact check and analysis.
Develop strategy and provide analytical/statistical support for external data source evaluation, for modeling products and the third-party data QA.
Assisting development and improvement of the company’s data balancing and paneling capabilities to support various use cases.
Provide support to other analytical/statistical support for business initiatives as needed.
Mine large consumer datasets in the cloud environment to support ad hoc business and statistical analysis,
Develop and improve automation capabilities to enable customized delivery of the analytical products to clients,
Communicate the methodologies and the results to the management, clients and non-technical stakeholders.
Basic Qualifications
Advanced degree in Statistics/Computer Science/Behavioral Economics or other fields that requires advanced training in data analytics.
Being able to creatively apply statistical/ML concepts and reasoning to provide DS and analytical solutions to business problems.
Familiarity with data manipulation concept and techniques such as imputing, cleansing and visualization.
Excellent command of one or more ML/statistical tools, preferably Python or R or knowledge of a cloud based ML tool such as Sagemaker.
Experience and comfortable working in the Cloud environment and familiar with one of the database technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL and at ease with SQL queries,
Entrepreneurial, highly self-motivated, collaborative, keen attention to detail, willingness and capable learn quickly, and ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Being flexible to accept different task assignments and able to work on a tight time schedule.
Great communication skills (verbal, written and presentation)

Preferred Qualifications
Experience or exposure to large consumer and/or demographic data sets.
Prior experience in retail market space and consumer behavior analysis
Familiar with one of the visualization tools, such as tableau.

In this role, you will be a core member of a lean, close-knit product team that is analyzing and building new ways to improve subscriber engagement for MDLinx.com. 2+ years of business analysis, data analysis, or data warehousing experience
1+ years of dashboard development and data visualization and experience using an analytics tool suite. Tableau experience is preferred.
1+ years of digital analytics and website traffic reporting – Experience using Google Analytics required.
Strong SQL knowledge is required. Data manipulation/ETL experience is also preferred.
Experience with programming languages (ex: R, Python)
Knowledge of the internet landscape, including a comprehension of display advertising and web metrics (clicks, views, users, visits, etc.)

Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams.

Job Summary:
Data Analysts in the Disney Streaming Engagement & Retention Analytics team are the analytics partner for the organization's Growth Marketing team. They support Disney’s streaming services through measurement, analysis, and insight generation. These analysts focus on helping our subscribers get the most value out of our services, and improving business results through the combination of statistical rigor, data analysis, and fast paced execution with an emphasis on driving actionable business recommendations.

Responsibilities:
Goaling and KPIs: Work “full-stack” to define KPIs and goal metrics with XFN stakeholders, forecast outcomes, and measure pacing against those targets.
Business Performance Reporting, Visualization, and Regression Management: Be the primary partner for cross-functional stakeholders to understand engagement and retention on the platform. When engagement is ahead or behind expectations, dig in to drive meaningful, actionable insights that help the business performance improve or double-down on success.
ETL & Metric Design: Own metric design and creation by defining business requirements, framework & optimization, and long term data scalability.
Deep-Dive Analysis: Analyze user behavior to identify patterns, uncover opportunities, and create a shared understanding of how our subscribers are engaging with the platform & content.
Forecasting, and Opportunity Sizing: Both to set goals and help evaluate potential opportunities, this role will be tasked with forecasting and opportunity sizing. This will help business stakeholders evaluate trade-offs in different approaches, and create targets for driving business performance.
Partnership: Partner closely with business stakeholders to identify and unlock opportunities, and with other data teams to improve platform capabilities around data modeling, testing platforms, data visualization, and data architecture.
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of analytical experience.
4+ years work experience using SQL and Python/R or other statistical programming languages.
Familiarity with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Chartio, etc.
Understanding of statistics concepts (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression analysis).
Ability to think strategically, analyze and interpret market and consumer information.
Strong communication skills, as well as written and verbal presentation skills.
Degree in an analytical field.

Job Description:
The ESG data landscape is rapidly changing, with new data becoming available every day – from existing providers, new providers, internal sources and open source. ESG exposure and impact reporting are becoming table stakes in wealth management, as they are essential for both client acquisition and retention. In addition demand for custom scenarios (e.g. institutional portfolio construction), client consultation and the need for tool development to enable client and advisor access to ESG insights are growing rapidly
Bank of America is committed to leadership in Sustainable and Impact Investing. Our Chief Investment Office is expanding its ESG data analytics capabilities to support multiple use cases. This is a unique opportunity to support the development of metrics for use across client and advisor tools, diligence of sustainable strategies. As part of the Chief Investment Office, the Data Analyst will provide be responsible for evaluation of metrics and other data across multiple 3rd party data providers. As new ESG data points and sources become available, they will evaluate and recommend integration points and use cases. They will be a resource to field support on advisor and client questions, and to portfolio construction.
Core responsibilities include but not limited to:
Data analysis for client sustainable diagnostic and reporting capability
Analysis of data sources, datasets and metrics, for incorporation in to proprietary methodology and diagnostic tools
Analysis of data inputs and development of future tool integration (e.g. advisor tool integration / Portfolio Construction)
Providing subject matter expertise for client materials, including presentations and reports, as well as answering advisor and client ESG data questions
Serving as a cross line of business representative with regards to ESG data development, consistency and use cases
Qualifications:
The ideal candidate has an analytical mindset; an entrepreneurial, collaborative disposition; and a commitment to advancing social and environmental outcomes. Desired qualifications and experience level include:
3-5+ years' relateable analytical experience
Experience or educational credentials with focus on sustainability data broadly and ESG metrics, understanding how sustainability metrics are calculated, how underlying data is gathered, which data points are relevant in various contexts

Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Market Intelligence Analyst to join our Medical Cost and Market Intelligence team.

Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a relentless focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.

About the role:

Oscar's Medical Cost and Market Intelligence team is focused on identifying, designing and leading initiatives that maximize the value that we get from every dollar that we spend on medical costs.

The Market Intelligence Analyst partners closely with our Regional P&L teams to identify and manage medical cost drivers across all levers Oscar has available, including network, utilization management, member engagement and unit cost improvement. This work will not only lead to reduced medical waste, but to more affordable and higher-quality health care for the members Oscar serves.

You will report into the Director, Medical Cost Management. This is a remote / work-from-home role. You must reside in one of the following states: Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, or Washington. Note, this list of states is subject to change.

Responsibilities:

Analyze medical claims and competitive market data to support Regional P&L teams in making better informed, data-driven decisions
Use data to tell a story that our network and clinical teams will be able to understand, including packaging and presenting findings in a clear, concise and compelling manner
Oversee the creation and maintenance of essential operational and analytical dashboards, and update and enhance them as our user's needs evolve
Create models and tools that produce relevant insights to identify and eliminate inefficient healthcare, and improve profitability
Collaborate with Data Science, Finance, Actuarial and Clinical to identify actions to achieve medical cost improvements

Requirements:

1+ years of technical experience using analytical tools and writing analytical reports
Demonstrated ability to navigate ambiguity to desired outcomes, work with large datasets and distill analyses into relevant insights with a structured and systematic thought process
Proficiency in SQL, R, or Python to query, manipulate and analyze data
Strong Google Sheets and/or Excel skills
Experience in Healthcare, Finance or Insurance industry

Bonus points:

Demonstrated experience in analysis and reporting
Experience developing dashboards and working with Looker, or other business intelligence/data visualization tools
Exposure to healthcare contract negotiations, risk adjustment, ACA marketplace, quality of care, and/or population health experience

Life at Oscar:

At Oscar, being an Equal Opportunity Employer means more than upholding discrimination-free hiring practices. It means that we cultivate an environment where people can be their most authentic selves and find both belonging and support. We're on a mission to change health care - an experience made whole by our unique backgrounds and perspectives.

We aim to make health care affordable and accessible for all, and apply this same vision to our perks and benefits, including: medical benefits, generous paid-time off, paid parental leave, retirement plans, company social events, stocked kitchens, wellness programs, and volunteer opportunities.

Data Analyst Job Description:
Tesla is seeking a motivated, experienced, and knowledgeable Data Analyst to lead and support the cycle count program. The primary objective of this position is to ensure inventory balances are always maintained accurately in all affected systems. The Data Analyst also works cross-functionally with Finance on cycle count results, inventory discrepancies and root cause / countermeasure activities. In addition, the Data Analyst works side by side with Material Handling leaders and Process Engineering to identify process gaps related to inventory discrepancies and drives process level-up activities. A key component of this function is to do data analysis, identify and recognize inventory discrepancies and drive solutions to achieve inventory accuracy daily.
Responsibilities:
Perform audits to ensure cycle count program accuracy and sustainability
Help ensure overall inventory integrity within the department
Create/prepare monthly, quarterly, and/or annual metrics for cycle counting and inventory accuracy
Provide clear and concise reporting to Finance and to Senior Management
Problem solve and coordinate efforts with process engineering to ensure in-process inventory accuracy
Support physical inventories as well as internal/external parts audits
Support material handling teams in proper inventory practices to maintain accuracy as needed
Work with cross functional teams to ensure IC practices are being followed and lead/support continuous improvement
Work closely with Finance to ensure corporate compliance and fiscal deadlines are met
Document and manage standard work instructions for cycle count and inventory adjustment process
Interpret data, analyze results, and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize the effectiveness and efficiency
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Uses data patterns and trends to root cause operational gaps and inefficiency, develop solutions in collaboration with operations teams.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities.
Identify, create, and maintain dashboards that are simple and easy to interpret to track and report out on key metrics
Requirements:
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Basic knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI, etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (Python, XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks) and interactive dashboards.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, or related field. Preferred

dv01 is lifting the curtain on the largest financial market in the world: structured finance. The $16+ trillion market is the backbone of everyday activities that empower financial freedom, from consolidating credit card debt and refinancing student loans, to buying a home and starting a small business.

dv01's data analytics platform brings unparalleled transparency into investment performance and risk for lenders and Wall Street investors in structured products. As a data-first company, we wrangle critical loan data and build modern analytical tools that enable strategic decision-making for responsible lending. In a nutshell, we're helping prevent a repeat of the 2008 global financial crisis by offering the data and tools required to make smarter, data-driven decisions resulting in a safer world for all of us.

More than 400 of the largest financial institutions use dv01 for our coverage of over 75 million loans spanning mortgages, personal loans, auto, buy-now-pay-later programs, small business, and student loans. dv01 continues to expand coverage of new markets, adding loans monthly, and developing new technologies for the structured products universe.

To get a better idea of what a year at dv01 looks like, check out our 2020 Year in Review page here: https://dv01.co/year-in-review/2020/ If that looks like fun to you, get in touch because we'd love to hear from you.

You Will:

Be on the cutting edge of structured finance and technology. You will be a critical piece in dv01's robust expansion into the capital markets and structured finance space, combining your knowledge with our state-of-the-art technologies.
Expand your structured finance knowledge. You will gain exposure to many facets of the ABS and RMBS spaces, combining information from a variety of sources (loan-level transaction data, deal documents, trustee reporting, etc.) that all flow into dv01's wide range of client offerings.
Enhance your technical skills. You will work closely with engineering teams at dv01 to develop and productize solutions, both for our customers and internally. If you're not already aware of the world that exists outside of Excel for data analysis, you'll become familiar with it very quickly.
Be customer facing. You will directly communicate with contacts at hedge funds, banks, and asset originators, providing valuable reporting and analytics services to assist with their internal processes.

You Are:

Knowledgeable with financial concepts and data. You have experience working with financial data. Experience working with loan-level servicing data and securitizations is preferable, but not required.
Unafraid of large datasets. You are proficient with Excel. You are comfortable either knowing or learning R to perform ad-hoc data analysis, with a desire and ability to grow quickly on the technical front.
Able to separate the financial wheat from the chaff. You are able to identify key metrics and transactional details on financial statements, investor reports, and securitization trustee reports and are not afraid to get your hands dirty by diving into loan-level data.
A focused, detail-oriented, multi-tasker. You love the intricate details of a thorough analysis, but also stay aware of the bigger picture while operating across multiple threads of work. You're able to communicate your findings and opinions internally, as well as with clients.

BENEFITS & PERKS:

Highly collaborative culture (weekly town hall meetings, virtual cross-team coffee hour)
Almost 100% paid benefits (medical/dental/vision)
401K
Continuous learning (prototype/hackathon day, brunch & learns, Scala overviews)
Weekly $100 lunch allowance
Free premium Equinox membership or $1,500 Annual Fitness Fund
$1,000 Learning & Development Fund
In-house personal and performance development coach
Unlimited PTO
Company virtual events (Happy hours, game nights, team qi gong, book club, etc.)

JOB DESCRIPTION
Who We Are:
Saks is a world-renowned luxury ecommerce destination. The company’s unique approach combines a focus on the digital customer experience with a strong connection to a network of extraordinary stores that extends that seamless experience into the real world. On its website and mobile app, Saks offers an unparalleled selection of curated merchandise across fashion for women and men, beauty, jewelry, home décor and more. In addition to the shopping experience, customers come to Saks for inspiring editorial content, access to digital stylists, lifestyle experiences and other world-class services. The company is currently in the midst of a dramatic expansion, driven by significant enhancements to its platforms and technical offerings, with the goal of becoming the preeminent international destination for luxury.

What This Position Is All About:
As the Data Analyst supporting Marketplace and Competitive Intelligence initiatives, you will act as an expert translator between data and business strategy and process. This role will offer you the opportunity to learn about a broad swath of Saks direct operations and be an expert in the data and insights supporting these initiatives. You’ll work directly with the Manager of Competitive Intelligence and Marketplace Analytics and data teams to build and maintain dynamic and actionable dashboards and ad hoc reporting using visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau. You will be an important link between business users, vendors, technology, and other contributors and the point of contact for these solutions with the goal of quick resolution, deep dives, root cause analysis and process improvement. You employ strong curiosity and healthy skepticism as it pertains to data, always striving to be one step ahead of data-driven strategy and insights. You’re innovative, hardworking, and team-oriented.

Who You Are:
Some one with keen attention to detail and high accountability and precision.
A proactive self-starter and very solution-oriented. You are always seeking ways to add efficiency and improvement.
A natural problem solver, both creative and analytical in approach.

You Also Have:
3+ years business intelligence, enterprise reporting, or data analysis experience in a business environment, influencing decision-making with data.
Professional expertise using SQL for data manipulation, investigation, transformation, and analysis.
Familiarity with data warehousing tools such as Snowflake
Expertise in BI visualization tools like Looker & Tableau, including data modeling, administration, dashboard design and row level security
Proven excellence and passion for using data to help solve complex questions
Educational or professional experience with heavy analytical focus
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets knowledge.
Effective and clear verbal and written communication skills
Passionate about data technology with a strong desire to learn and adapt in a high-growth, fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with retail and wholesale KPIs and terminology
Experience taking part in white boarding solutions, and opportunities for team discussion rather than working in isolation.
An understanding of agile, lean, and workflow principles

As The Data Analyst, You Will:
Document, communicate and test data requirements to data partners for modeling in Tableau/Looker
Support and execute Ad hoc reporting & analysis
Recommend and collaborate to execute necessary data optimizations and enhancements
Mockup and design dashboards/visualizations for cross-functional alignment
Develop, demonstrate, and perform initial testing of dashboard visualizations
Perform application user acceptance training and iteration
Test and communicate through upstream data model changes and ensure business continuity.
Perform end user training and support of data and applications.
Maintain documentation related to datasets and structures to establish common data language.

Your Life and Career at Saks:
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance.
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount.
Thank you for your interest with Saks. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Develops and promotes relationships with both client and project teams.
Business Analysis and Support Services (BASS) is a global team that operates in North America, Ireland, Poland and Germany. The team supports the different platforms and product lines within the Alternative Investment Services division. The main disciplines within the team are system support, project management and business analysis. The team supports Real Estate, Single manager, Private Equity and Fund of Funds. The team works with their counterparts across the globe in supporting the applications through troubleshooting user support issues, and testing enhancements for the systems and writing business requirements. Training is provided by WebEx’s or by user experts visits.
Key Responsibilities:
Subject Matter Expert on the Investran platform; understand how the system is configured and be the first point of contact to provide "technical" advice and support to accounting and investor services users, escalating complex issues to the Investran technology team on behalf of service delivery team.
Support Fund Accountants with the setup and design of Accounting Automation rules and with use of various Accounting and General Ledger Consolidation Methods such as Full Consolidation, Equity Method / Pickup, Minority Interest, NCI, etc.
Support Fund Accountants with the setup, automation and tracking of various Cash and Income transactions that impact Investor Ledger, Capital Balances and related Cash Flows.

Support the Client Servicing New business team. This will incorporate participation in project planning, assisting in the system set ups and user testing where applicable.
Working with new and existing users to implement system developments and enhancements helping to deliver training to new and existing users on the new systems platform.
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 6-8 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Minimum Qual Requirements

(1) A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, including or supplemented by twenty-four (24) semester credits in computer science or a related computer field and two (2) years of satisfactory full-time software experience in designing, programming, debugging, maintaining, implementing, and enhancing computer software applications, systems programming, systems analysis and design, data communication software, or database design and programming, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or

(2) A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and six (6) years of full-time satisfactory software experience as described in “1" above, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or

(3) A satisfactory combination of education and experience that is equivalent to (1) or (2) above. College education may be substituted for up to two years of the required experience in (2) above on the basis that sixty (60) semester credits from an accredited college is equated to one year of experience. A masters degree in computer science or a related computer field may be substituted for one year of the required experience in (1) or (2) above. However, all candidates must have a four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, plus at least one (1) year of satisfactory full-time software experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project.

NOTE: In order to have your experience accepted as Project Leader or Major Contributor experience, you must explain in detail how your experience qualifies you as a project leader or as a major contributor. requirements.

OUR MISSION

Calibrate's mission is to change the way the world treats weight. We're defining a new category in metabolic health that mirrors what the research shows—that weight reflects our biology, not our willpower. Our program was designed by world leaders in obesity and nutrition science to improve metabolic health and drive long-term weight loss that's impactful, realistic, and sustainable.

Obesity is America's underlying pandemic and largest category of chronic disease, and Calibrate is closing the gap in care for 175mm adults in a $600bn market where we spend millions of dollars each year and do not lose millions of pounds.

To bring Calibrate to everyone who needs it, we're building the first telemedicine business within the healthcare ecosystem, aligning incentives for consumers, doctors, insurers, and pharmaceutical companies. We've built a proprietary Vertical Pharmacy Engine to connect our members to the most efficient path to insurance coverage, paving the way for a new model of chronic disease care.

Calibrate's first product, the One-Year Metabolic Reset, brings decades of clinical research directly to consumers through a virtual program combining FDA-approved prescription medication with intensive lifestyle intervention. The 52-week structured program includes biweekly 1:1 video coaching and curriculum that spans classes, recipes, workouts, and more. A purpose-built app enables daily tracking of food, energy level, weight, and bi-weekly goals and helps members interact with their Coaching and Medical teams, while a members' group and events calendar create additional opportunities to tap into the Calibrate community.

Calibrate's recently launched Masters Program keeps members engaged and supported in their metabolic health beyond their first year with the same evidence-based approach that defines Calibrate's One-Year Metabolic Reset, at a lower cost. The result is a program that sustains and builds on members' results with improved whole-body health that enables them to embrace a new day-to-day.
ABOUT THE ROLE

We're looking for an experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about numbers, manipulating data and ultimately changing the way the world treats weight. This analyst will report into the Data Analytics team, but will work closely with all teams across the company, analyzing data that relate to clinical efficacy, user experience, product impact, and financial success.

Our Ideal candidate has 3+ years of experience in analytical roles, and has owned data and insights in early-stage startups. You should be comfortable as an individual contributor as well as a great collaborator with excellent communication skills and a genuine interest in analytics. You are curious, a self-starter and willing to work with minimum guidance in a fast-paced environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform regular as well as ad-hoc analyses around key business questions pertaining to all aspects of the business
Help establish the KPIs for each team across the business and set up regular reporting cadence for operating and financial metrics
Build and maintain reports and dashboards around the key metrics, and set up key stakeholders across the business to access and leverage the reports for day-to-day decision making
Work cross-functionally to surface actionable insights for improving our experience end-to-end; communicate these insights clearly to partners across the organization
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to guarantee data integrity and readiness

BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE

Proficient with SQL (any dialect)
Experience contributing to building reporting, charts, data visualizations with Business Intelligence Tools (ex. Mode Analytics, Looker, Tableau)
Strong knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets for data manipulation
Experience with reading and writing in Python not required, but a big plus
Ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical audiences, as well as translate operational questions into comprehensive queries and data reports
Strong ability to work cross-functionally and manage stakeholder relationships amongst different departments
Comfortable with Git (or any other versioning tool) and Pull Requests
Not required but pluses: comfort with predictive modeling techniques, basic experience around Data Engineering concepts

ABOUT OUR TEAM

Calibrate launched Summer 2020, and in 18 months has raised $127.6mm in funding from leading healthcare and consumer investors, including Founders Fund, Tiger Global, Forerunner Ventures, Threshold Ventures, Optum Ventures, and Redesign Health. Our team helped build businesses at the intersection of technology, consumer, and healthcare, including Athenahealth, Capsule, Flatiron Health, Harry's, One Medical, Galileo, PillPack, Rent the Runway, and more. Our Clinical Advisors include Donna Ryan, the past President of the World Obesity Federation, and Darriush Mozafarrian, cardiologist and Dean at the Tufts Friedman School of Nutrition Science and Policy.

Calibrate is committed to bringing together people from different backgrounds and perspectives to deliver real results for our members.

BENEFITS

At Calibrate, we're committed to our vision of putting our members and our teammates in control of their health. Some of our benefits include:

Competitive salary with opportunity for equity in an early stage, high growth business
Generous paid time off
Calibrate-funded health benefits (medical, dental, vision) - starting at zero cost to you
One Medical membership and Teladoc virtual care
Fertility, gynecology, and wellness services through Kindbody
Therapy on your time with a free year of Talkspace membership
Health advocacy and assistance services through Health Advocate
Commuter benefits, ClassPass memberships, and gym memberships for post-pandemic life
NYC-based with opportunities to be fully remote
Competitive Paid Parental Leave for parents

OUR VALUES

We're in it together: We have an audacious mission, and we're building a lot of things for the first time — from the first DTC pharma business within the healthcare ecosystem to the data infrastructure for providing real-world evidence in the largest category of chronic disease. It takes superpowers to build something simple and intuitive within the complex healthcare market, so we identify and work as a team from our individual points of strength. Not everyone has to be good at everything, but we know that when we harness what we're each great at, we're unstoppable.

Small wins create big wins: We ground every experience in optimism, recognizing and celebrating successes along the way. We break projects down into smaller components. And we focus on where we have momentum. We always plan for larger goals with the knowledge that our plans will evolve as we achieve smaller milestones.

You're in control: While we're headquartered in New York, we don't let location stand in the way of the best talent — and from coaches to engineers, many of us are fully remote. Our business is multi-faceted, so each Calibrater is hired to be an expert in their piece of it — in control of their own initiatives, in control of their own impact, and in control of driving their own (real) results.

Real results matter: We're obsessed with outcomes because when our members win, we win, and the data proves that we've built the best metabolic health program on the market. We're purposeful, optimistic, and relentlessly confident that we can solve the biggest medical issue of the 21st century.

Calibrate recruits, employs, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law and as a matter of our company values.

ABOUT US:

Founded in 1955, the Albert Einstein College of Medicine (Einstein) is one of the nation's premier institutions for medical education, basic research and clinical investigation. A full-time faculty of some 2,000 conducts research, teaches, and delivers health care in every major biomedical specialty. The college has some 730 medical students, 193 Ph.D. students, 106 MD/Ph.D. students and 275 postdoctoral fellows.
Einstein's major strength, in addition to training physicians and scientists, is its science. During fiscal year 2015, the faculty's consistently high level of scientific achievement resulted in the awarding of more than 150 million in peer-reviewed grants from the National Institutes of Health (NIH).
Einstein is part of Montefiore Medicine Academic Health System, an integrated academic delivery system comprising seven campuses, including 8 hospitals, a multi-county ambulatory network, a new state-of-the art "hospital without beds", a skilled nursing facility, school of nursing, home health agency, and the state's first freestanding emergency department. As the University Hospital for the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Montefiore is a premier academic health system, employing Einstein's clinical faculty and training Einstein's medical students, over 1,300 residents, 420 allied health students, and 1,600 nursing students annually.
We have also been recognized by Forbes as one of the country's best midsize employers in 2019. Forbes ranked Einstein in the top overall nationally among midsize employers. Einstein ranked 3rd within the education category in New York State and 9th nationally among all midsize education employers.
The Albert Einstein College of Medicine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Einstein seeks candidates whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence, and the communities we serve.

positionName: Data Analyst, Bureau of Sexually Transmitted Infections
description:
**HIRING RATE: $64,140 (FLAT RATE -ANNUAL SALARY)

The Bureau of Sexually Transmitted Disease Infections (BSTI) has the mission of improving the sexual health of all New Yorkers. To achieve this, the Bureau provides direct clinical services to people seeking sexual health care, and services to sex partners; monitors disease trends; provides education and training to providers and community groups, conducts research and develop policies to improve sexual health and wellness. The BSTI operates 8 Sexual Health Clinics throughout New York City. BSTI has a grant funded opening for a Data Analyst to work with data from the STI clinic electronic medical record (EMR) system.


DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:


Under the direction of the Director of Research and Evaluation, the Data Analyst will:

Perform database queries and analyses of STI EMR data as needed by Bureau staff to: monitor the quantity and quality of clinic activities and service utilization.

Evaluate existing clinic-based protocols, policies and procedures.

Respond to data requests, and produce routine and ad hoc data reports;

Maintain and update coding conventions for analytic datasets;

Maintain and assist in developing EMR documentation needed for analysis (data dictionaries/code book, etc).
Minimum Qual Requirements

1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.

To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:

1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or

2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or

3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.


NOTE:

Probationary Period

Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.
Preferred Skills

Knowledge and experience with SAS (or comparable analytic software package), and substantial experience working with relational databases and producing data reports; experience with SQL query language is desirable, but not required. Applicants should have experience with data manipulation, data analysis, and production of data tables/reports. It would be advantageous for the applicant to have experience with automating reports in SAS. The applicant should have strong oral and written communication skills, attention to detail, proven ability to work well collaboratively, and the ability to handle multiple and diverse assignments with a short timeline.
Additional Information

**IMPORTANT NOTES TO ALL CANDIDATES:

Please note: If you are called for an interview you will be required to bring to your interview copies of original documentation, such as:
A document that establishes identity for employment eligibility, such as: A Valid U.S. Passport, Permanent Resident Card/Green Card, or Driver’s license.

Proof of Education according to the education requirements of the civil service title.

Current Resume

Proof of Address/NYC Residency dated within the last 60 days, such as: Recent Utility Bill (i.e. Telephone, Cable, Mobile Phone)

Additional documentation may be required to evaluate your qualification as outlined in this posting’s “Minimum Qualification Requirements” section. Examples of additional documentation may be, but not limited to: college transcript, experience verification or professional trade licenses.

If after your interview you are the selected candidate you will be contacted to schedule an on-boarding appointment. By the time of this appointment you will be asked to produce the originals of the above documents along with your original Social Security card.

Our mission

We're making Africa the first cashless continent.

In 2017, nearly 60% of adults in sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reason—the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.

We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In November 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. In 2019, we expanded to Cote d'Ivoire. Now, we have millions of users and are growing fast. Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent. And that's where you come in....
How you'll help us achieve it

We're looking for a Business Analyst who's a self-starter and excels at producing visually compelling analytical content, particularly someone who can be resourceful with irregular data.

Wave is experiencing high-volume growth as we expand our operations from four to eleven countries in East and West Africa. Recruitment is a critical component of this growth, so we're looking for a business analyst who can pair with our recruitment leads to identify and develop metrics specific to their team while also building a strategic overview of the team's work as a whole alongside Wave's Head of Talent.

In this role, you'll:

Work within our Head of Talent and four Recruitment Leads to develop and hone their data collection, analysis, and presentation
Navigate large sets of data and derive meaning to deliver insights to stakeholders
Develop new models and methods for evaluating existing data or correlating new to existing data sources for intuitive reporting solutions
Advise the recruiting team on their data gathering and cleaning
Build a visually compelling dashboard that offers strategic insights into the recruiting team's work
Interpret and evaluate research data and develop compelling story-telling, analyses, and projections for strategic decision-making
Requirements
Fluent in English
Bachelor's degree
3-5 years in a similar position
1+ year's experience using Looker to build data visualizations
2+ years experience with data visualization tools or platforms (e.g. Dashboards, Tableau, etc.)
2+ years experience using a language for statistical computing in data mining and extraction (R, Python, Stata, SQL, etc.).
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, advanced modeling, creating charts/graphs)
Demonstrate a strong competency in statistics
Key details
Location: Remote
You can work remotely from anywhere (between UTC -5 and +3) with reliable Internet access.
Every two to four months, our remote team meets in Africa for a one-week retreat. (Wave covers all costs.)
Salary: Our salaries are competitive and calculated using a transparent formula.
Major benefits:
Subsidized health insurance for you and your dependents and retirement contributions (both vary from country to country)
26 weeks fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance
Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
$10,000 annual charitable donation matching
You might be a good fit if you.
Communicate effectively and often, both in writing and in-person, to the point of over-communication
Enjoy networking and meeting new people and thrive at building new relationships
Dive into new challenges and enjoy identifying creative solutions - hiring for every role at Wave is unique!
Are incredibly curious about how pieces fit together and use this learning to build optimal solutions
Adept at independently navigating complex relationships
Are extremely adaptable and excel in multi-cultural and fast-paced environments
Process-driven and can implement structure where there is little or none
Exceptionally organized and pay close attention to detail
Are a "can-doer" and thrive on executing objectives
Think from first principles about how things should work
Think about culture and process from the user's perspective (in this case, our candidates)
Our team
We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, Côte D'Ivoire, Mali and Uganda, plus remote team members spread across the world. We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your own projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We're backed by world-class investors including Sequoia, Stripe, Founders Fund, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and the cofounders of PayPal.
How to apply

Fill out the form below, and upload a resume plus a cover letter, both written in English, describing your interest in Wave and the role. We review applications on a rolling basis.

Wave is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

The Flatiron School is seeking a Data Analyst to get in on the ground level of its growing data team and help maintain an analysis-friendly data ecosystem and create high-impact analytics. You will work among other data analysts and data engineers in collaboration with business stakeholders to supply the entire organization with invaluable, data-backed insights. Accomplishing this will require a deep understanding of the organization's business operations and corresponding datasets as well as mastering many different technologies and systems. We will be looking to your experience and skill as a data analyst to guide our team's practices and at the same time having flexible options for your growth as a data professional.

Responsibilities:

Work with a team of analysts and engineers to develop new data and analytic capabilities for the company
Assemble and maintain tidy datasets trusted and relied upon by every member of the organization for mission critical decision making
Generate, maintain, and automate reporting for internal teams and/or external clients
Work with business leaders to identify challenges that can be solved with data to improve the business and student experience
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
️Share data in a digestible way through presentations, dashboards, and reports
️Develop insights and recommend business strategy based on data
️Define best practices and new processes to collect, manage, and analyze data

2+ years of SQL experience with relational databases (we use Redshift)
2+ years of experience working in an analytical capacity managing data, developing insights, and communicating results through visualizations and/or reports
Proven stakeholder management experience - including managing multiple cross-functional partners simultaneously
Presentation and communication experience extracting insights from technical datasets to varied audiences including high-level management
Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans
Intuition and curiosity to troubleshoot data

Data visualization and dashboarding tools like Looker and Tableau
Infrastructural data technologies such as Airflow
Data analysis software like R or Python
AWS cloud services: EC2, S3, RDS, Redshift
Version control (we use Git)
Information security and compliance

Expected Compensation Range:

$60K - $75K

Who you are

A champion for data-driven decision making
A data processing guru with expertise in manipulation of large datasets

A college graduate with 1-3 years of experience supporting critical data processes and performing statistical analysis
A do-gooder who is committed to the mission and core values of Democracy Prep and has an interest in the education landscape

The dentsu Automation COE’s mission is to elevate our people’s potential by integrating automation and AI into everything we do. Our AI Powered Process Mining Program supports this mission by leveraging advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) capabilities to streamline process discovery across observation cycles. The outputs from these observation cycles enable technology and operations teams to take the appropriate actions to augment and elevate ways of working. These outputs are intended to create transparency into business operations and identify opportunities for process improvement including automation use cases.
This position will report into our Process Data Scientist and work closely with that role to deliver unprecedented insights into our business operations by analyzing, visualizing, and articulating patterns, trends, and anomalies within our terabytes upon terabytes of observed data by utilizing specialized platform and tools. It’s easy to get lost in this volume of data and the Process Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that business stakeholders are able to get the optimal value and insights from our process data ocean.
This is an excellent role for the right person looking to enter the world of applied data science. A successful candidate will have a passion for identifying and clearly articulating insights found from complex data sets through the lens of business operations.
Responsibilities:
Design mines with the goal to discover and isolate processes based on cycle focus
Translating cycle focus into mining strategy
Learn & lead sustainable mining design to ensure continuous value creation
Analyses specialize & productivity applications and detail main functions
Support applications classifications by querying on scale to find signals from database
Test new mining approaches to identify unique pattens
Maintain current KPIs and discover more to assess cycle success and team’s performance
Explore and test new features (front and back end) released or prerelease by vendors
Discover unclaimed applications observed and document relationships from cycles
Document screen signatures in relationship of unique screens within applications
Ensure members are on boarded and offboarded with the cycle stages with the goal to maximize data captured
Analyze groups and clusters to connect commonality and differences between them
Work with IT on SCCM related tasks to support deployment and rollback
Work with media platform teams and vendor providers as needed
Managing standard end to end process mining observation cycles
Brokering information between technical data science team and business operations stakeholders
Executing process mining queries given desired outputs and parameters provided by business operations stakeholders
Maintaining and creating visualization interfaces so that business stakeholders can easily understand insights and help refine desired process mining outputs
Managing Process Definition Document library and identifying trends/discrepancies between Process Definition Documents (PDDs)
Partnering with Automation Solution Architects to understand automation use cases and refine process mining runs to generate refined PDDs
Ensuring that PDDs are entered into the appropriate use case pipelines for actioning by the right teams (BPO, Automation, Point Software, Offshoring, etc.)
Classifying and indexing previously unencountered digital entities including but not limited to application and screen signatures
Additional AI Powered Process Mining Program support as needed
#LI-WO1

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Mathematics
1-2 years of data analysis experience or coursework
Proficient in SQL , Python (a plus)
Proficient in data visualization platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, or Kibana

Comprehensive healthcare plans
FTO and family leave
401K

Research and analyze market awareness and perception of DailyPay and its competitors. Segment and report insights to advise stakeholders across the company.

Own the relationship with the Data Scientists to ensure the reporting needs of the team are covered and be the data champion within the team sharing upcoming changes in metrics and targets and how that impacts our results/plans.
Work in statistical programs, predictive analytics tools and other data-driven resources such as Tableau, Amplitude and Metabase.
Manage ad-hoc data requests from Marketing stakeholders

2+ years of experience
Familiarity with the goals of marketing and has experience working with marketing and/or media teams
SQL, databases, and database querying languages
Statistical analysis software: Tableau, Amplitude, Metabase
Data mining
Data visualization
Effective communication skills: Work with cross-functional stakeholders and present complex ideas in a non-technical way
Attention to detail
Programming skills a plus
Occasional need to work outside of normal business hours as required to support customers may be required
What We Offer:
Competitive compensation
Opportunity for equity ownership
Exceptional health, vision, and dental care
Employee Resource Groups

Unlimited books from Amazon
