positionName: Business Analyst | Strategy Consulting | United States 2022
description:
Business Analyst, Delta Partners - New York City, San Francisco, Denver

Brief Description


This job is for you if you're an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company - and an industry - where you'll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience.


Description

This job is for you if you're an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company - and an industry - where you'll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience. You'll also have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills that make you the ideal team player. The nature of the role means that analysts travel frequently, so you'll need to be ready to jet-set across the globe.


Here's what an ordinary day could look like:
Business Analysts will typically perform the following tasks and responsibilities:

Work in a project module with support and guidance from senior team members
Facilitate in producing reliable and accurate research for client projects and proposals
Conduct analysis of quantitative and qualitative data
Summarize main ideas and findings from work through written, graphical or oral presentations
Help facilitate discussions within project teams
Increase proficiency in unfamiliar TMT topics
Supports senior team members in the development of intellectual capital
Our Benefits


Apart from the well-structured career path and excellent team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:


Competitive salary and bonus plans
Generous paid holidays, time off and parental leave
Full package of benefits plans
Company matched 401K
Annual paid volunteer hours
Corporate matching for charitable donations
Potential for flexible working arrangements
Free snacks and drinks
Upscale offices close to public transportation
Pet insurance


About FTI Consulting


What makes us unique? With more than 6,250 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.


FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognized as a Best Firm to Work For by Consulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes . For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter ( @FTIConsulting ), Facebook and LinkedIn .


FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.


#LI-TS1

About
Macy’s is proudly America’s Department Store. For more than 160 years, Macy’s has served generations at every stage of their lives. Customers come to us for fashion, value and celebration.
Macy’s Merchandising curates the best national and private brands to support our customer’s self-expression from off-price to luxury. Merchandising ensures Macy's is the premier fashion authority using a high acumen for products and trends as well as strong relationships with vendors in the marketplace. Our team maximizes sales and gross margin for each product category by identifying, procuring, and assorting the products that our customers demand.
Do you have an eye for products and trends? Join Macy’s Merchandising and create connections that surprise and delight our customers at every turn.
Job Overview
The Reporting Analyst provides support to the Merchant and Store Organization and is a member of a team of colleagues in the Merchant Operations Division. The primary role of the Reporting Analyst is to provide analytical support for merchant and store operations by providing timely and accurate execution of routine reports with efficiency & automation. In addition, the Reporting Analyst will assist in automating routine activities for other Macy's colleagues.
When new reports are requested, the Reporting Analyst is responsible for conducting research and soliciting feedback to gain an understanding of incoming requests to create meaningful and actionable reports. The Reporting Analyst will reach out to the merchant when necessary in order to ensure that their needs are properly met. The Reporting Analyst should be able to thoroughly analyze the request in order to find solutions to unique problems. The Reporting Analyst will learn advanced reporting systems acquired by Macy's and determine the company benefits of this system for current and future projects and make recommendations.

Essential Functions
Gathering & assisting in prioritizing and documenting report requirements
Complete meeting agendas and documenting key decisions, action items, report risks and issues management
Provide report testing support
Collaborates with the Implementation team and supports training efforts, including the development of best practice materials and on-site delivery to the end-users if needed
Provides post-implementation support, including supporting the resolution of defects and actual “in-field” use of the ad hoc reports
Regular, dependable attendance & punctuality.
Look for process improvement and inefficiencies whenever possible.

Communication Skills:
Strong listening, written, verbal, and presentation communications skills. Is comfortable reaching out when needed.
Willing to speak up to present ideas for improving processes and reducing inefficiencies.

Reasoning Ability:
Ability to prioritize, set, and meet realistic deadlines for projects.
Is able to operate in areas of uncertainty and ambiguity.
Ability to learn and grasp new concepts and tools quickly.
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills.

Other Skills:
Bachelors Degree
1+ year of Retail Merchandising or Support experience preferred
Strong knowledge of SQL programming. Experience in Google Cloud is a benefit.
Outstanding data structuring skills and proficient in relational database management, maintenance, and design, specifically in Tableau, PowerBI, Excel or equivalent preferred.
Detail-oriented with an affinity for systems knowledge and ad-hoc problem-solving.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Patient - does not frustrate easily.
Ability to relate to merchants, resulting in establishing credibility & trust.
Strong follow-up, organization skills, and detail-oriented.
Ability to learn and grasp new concepts quickly.
Positive attitude, and willingness to collaborate with colleagues.
Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and Company needs.

The Barstool Sports data analytics team is seeking a Looker-experienced Data Analyst to help derive internal business intelligence reporting & development in an effort to create, improve and maintain ad hoc & automated reporting and dashboards.
As a data analyst, you will help our core data analytics team deliver actionable data to end users within the company to guide decisions and derive actionable insight. An ideal candidate would be humble, curious, and proactive in looking for new solutions and in learning new skills.
What You'll Do
Create, improve, and maintain reports within Looker to help other departments unearth insights, find new ways of evaluating performance, and identify trends in the business.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards to best support self-service business intelligence to users
Synthesize large volumes of data and complex concepts into clear accessible learnings
Analyze and explore data to assess the performance of ongoing programs (e.g., marketing initiatives, A/B tests) and to identify new insights and opportunities.
Work with complex datasets across our rich and varied platforms to perform analysisUse data to discover business insights, uncover new opportunities, provide recommendations and influence decisions.
Promote a data-driven organization and empower teams with actionable data and with automated and intuitive KPI dashboards.
Develop strong cross-functional partnerships across the company (Engineering, Product, Finance, Marketing, Content, etc)
What You Have
Proficiency with SQL and experience with industry leading business intelligence tools, such as Looker. For Looker you must be able to configure the entire pipeline - create Views / Models / Explores. Experience with LookML.
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Demonstrated ability to present data visually and effectively
Ability and eagerness to learn new technical information quickly
Experience with managing data warehouses, as well as the ETL/ELT work flow.
Excel power user with excellent quantitative and data skills
Proven track record of performing comprehensive analyses independently
Bonus Point: Experience with one or more programming languages such as Python or R
Bonus Point: Experience in statistical analysis of data (educational background in advanced statistical methods is a plus)

location: 1211 Avenue Of The Americas, New York, NY 10036
description:
We are looking for a Target Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team to analyze and improve the quality of the corporate target data reported to CDP and understand progress made against those targets. The Data Analytic team works to improve the usability of the data disclosed to CDP, developing and applying robust and transparent methods for data cleaning and modelling. Your mission: help us further our mission by working to improve the usability and impact of the climate action data disclosed to CDP.

Who you are
You are a skilled, enthusiastic, and ambitious data analyst who is passionate about using data to drive companies, investors, and governments to build a thriving economy that works for people and planet
You have at least one year of data analysis experience using R and/or Python
You have data visualization skills using Power BI or similar tools
You have experience with SQL
You have strong statistical, data-wrangling, and problem-solving skills
You have strong project management and planning skills
You have good verbal and written communication skills in English, especially for technical writing and documentation
You are curious, resilient, and inspired to take action to solve the complex and dynamic challenges of a changing world
Your day-to-day
You will work primarily to clean, analyze, and improve the quality of corporate target data reported to CDP
You will supporting key projects related to climate action and progress tracking for colleagues, investors, NGOs and other data consumers
You will maintain and further develop robust progress tracking methodologies to assess a variety of corporate and subnational climate actions
You will improve the performance and efficiency of scripts based in R and Python to improve data outputs and analyses
You will engage with stakeholders from different CDP teams and other external organizations to gather data requirements and develop data product
You will communicate and document data cleaning and processing steps, while providing general support for data users
Bonus points
You have multiple years of experience using R and/or Python for analysis and data mining
You have familiarity working with survey/questionnaire-based data
You have familiarity with GitHub, SQL, and Azure DevOps
You have a good understanding of sustainability data and GHG accounting methods, especially the GHG Protocol
You have knowledge of the financial system and capital markets
You have background knowledge of the UNFCCC and the Paris Agreement
You have an awareness of environmental issues, particularly as they relate to our core themes of Climate Change, Deforestation and Water Security
The perks!
Generous PTO. Tackling the world’s biggest environmental challenges is no easy feat – we offer a generous 20 days of annual leave to keep our employees energized.
Paid holidays. We recognize 15 paid holidays, including winter break, and pay homage to our diversity by offering one additional floating holiday of your choice for religious or cultural celebrations, per year.
Health and wellness. We strive to ensure the health and wellbeing of our staff –employees receive excellent health, dental and vision benefits and paid sick leave.
Learning and career growth. We are committed to the growth and development of each individual team member. We offer continuous learning opportunities and training, and we even provide employees with an annual budget for personal development.
Future planning: We know it is important to plan for the future. We provide our employees with both a non-contributory 401K, and an optional additional contributory 401K. We also offer life insurance.
Commuter benefits: We know commuting can be a pain – we offer commuter benefits and a Citibike membership to employees to make life a little easier.
Fun. We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves (too) seriously. We regularly take time out for fun and festivities, from all-staff retreats, to happy hours, to summer outings and an end-of-year holiday celebration!
Join us!
Are you interested in joining our mission? Please apply!
To apply. Email your CV and a cover letter detailing why you’re a strong fit for the role to: recruitment.usa@cdp.net with “Target Data Analyst” in the subject line. Please apply before October 3, 2021.
Before you apply: We’ll only use the information you provide to process your application. For more details on how we use your information, see our applicants privacy notice. By emailing us your resume and cover letter, you are permitting CDP to use the information you have provided for recruitment purposes.
Compensation. We offer a competitive NGO salary. The salary range for the Target Data Analyst role is $47,000 to $56,000.
The fine print. We love and value our global employees. For this role, all interested applicants must be eligible to work legally in the U.S.
CDP North America is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of justice, equity, diversity, inclusion and accessibility both within our workplace and across our larger organizational impact. Candidates of color and/or from marginalized backgrounds are highly encouraged to apply for this role.

As part of the Financial Reporting Quality Assurance Organization (FRQA) within Corporate Controllership, this role is responsible from bringing and managing data under governance for Finance.
Finance Data Governance (FDG) team is leading the effort of defining the future roadmap for data governance within Finance and ensure ensuring that trusted information is used for critical processes, decision making, and accounting across various finance processes.
As a Finance Data Governance analyst, you will be part of a growing team of data management professionals focused on providing world-class data management and data governance solutions. You will partner closely with Finance Technology transformation team, Enterprise Data Management, Controllership, Risk, and other teams to drive data governance and data quality within Finance.
The Finance Data Governance analyst is a collaborator, a well-organized, action-oriented team player with strong time management skills, confident in presenting, facilitating, and building a network of strong relationships across our organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Finance Data Governance in compliance with the Enterprise Data Governance Policy ensuring the appropriate accountability model and processes for data asset management, metadata management, data quality, and issue resolution.
Produce data quality scorecards, dashboards, analytical reports, and attestation packages for all processes in scope.
Perform root-cause-analysis of data quality issues and assist in remediation of Audit and Regulatory feedback.
Support strategic improvements to data assessment process and making necessary enhancements to data analytical and data quality tools.
Continuing to support our current Regulatory Reporting needs via existing platforms working with our upstream data providers, downstream business partners, as well as technologies.
2-3 years of experience in Finance and Controllership strongly preferred.
Strong relationship skills and communication is essential as this analyst will partner with multiple groups e.g., Business process owners, Technologies, and Enterprise Data Governance.
Self-motivated and proactive, ability to manage multiple assignments and projects concurrently.
Strong excel and other technical skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to collect business requirements and use them to guide implementation of a technical solution.
Prior experience with implementation of data governance and data quality programs is preferred.
Familiarity with Agile or SAFE project methodologies.

positionName: Clients & Markets Data Analyst – New York, Washington DC, Chicago or Los Angeles
description:
Posted on October 22, 2021

Working closely with members of the US Clients & Markets team and coordinating with the Finance, Practice Management, Pricing and Reference Services teams, this role is integral to compiling and executing actionable intelligence to inform business and client decisions. Company Overview:

At Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK), we’re not only changing the way we treat cancer, but also the way the world thinks about it. By working together and pushing forward with innovation and discovery, we’re driving excellence and improving outcomes. We’re treating cancer, one patient at a time. Join us and make a difference every day.
MSK requires all new hires, volunteers, and vendors who come onsite to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination. This is based on the COVID-19 vaccines’ high level of protection and our shared responsibility in protecting our patients.
Job Description:

The Operational Excellence Department (OpEx) is seeking a Senior Process Engineering Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will design and execute new analyses aimed at improving decision-making for hospital leadership to drive performance improvement, operational excellence, and deliver on strategic goals. Apply now to join our team!
We Are:
OpEx partners with key collaborators to identify projects and initiatives that deliver the ideal end-to-end, experience to every patient and family through innovation, teamwork, and continuous improvement. We specialize in process engineering, project management, change management, and analytics to drive operational improvements to make excellence in patient care easier.
Project examples:
You will:
Gather information and data from disparate teams, groups, sources, and systems to obtain vital details and complete analysis to support projects
Meet with hospital leadership and project sponsors to understand business needs and context for data requirements
Present results of analysis performed to a wide variety of differing audiences, translating technical and detailed data into action plans and/or recommendations
Support team members in assigned projects and take the lead role on projects as needed
Initiate and maintain a continual dialogue with leadership regarding analysis, scope, timeline and build project dashboards to simplify conclusions around complex data sets.
Reviews and discusses operational and clinical processes to supplement and contextualize data analyses.
You are:
Passionate about analytics and its power to transform operations and clinical care
Excited to work across the enterprise and work across many departments.
Adept at learning quickly, applying insights from past efforts to new situations
Comfortable working with data and able to generate and effectively translate insights to all levels of the organization
You have:
4+ years of relevant data analysis, data science, or operations research experience
Strong proficiency using SQL to query large relational databases and knowledge of either Python or R
Familiarity and experience with Tableau
Phenomenal communication and storytelling capabilities
Benefits
Competitive compensation packages | Sick Time |Generous Vacation+ 12 holidays to recharge & refuel| Internal Career Mobility & Performance Consulting | Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA & Dependent Care|403b Retirement Savings Plan Match|Tuition Reimbursement |Parental Leave & Adoption Assistance |Commuter Spending Account |Fitness Discounts &Wellness Program | Resource Networks| Life Insurance & Disability | Remote Flexibility
We believe in communication, openness, and thinking beyond your 8-hour day @ MSK. It’s important to us that you have a sense of impact, community, and work/life balance to be and feel your best.

knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable

competent, cooperative, and timely manner. The Job Description will be reviewed periodically for
accuracy and/or adjusted according to business necessity. The salary is $85,000/year

KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

funded programs.

 Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Windows, Excel, PowerPoint, and electronic
communications tools: internet and email
 Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing
 Highly organized, motivated self-starter
 Excellent time management skills.

Senior Data Analyst

We Are Seeking:

 A hands-on senior data analyst at the Global Intelligence team, to deliver on a series of domestic and international projects core to the marketing and communications objectives of our clients.

The position will directly report to the EVP of Applied Data Science, and will support teams across all North American practice areas and lead Weber Shandwick's most complex International analytics work.

What You Will Be Doing:

Bridge the gap between business SMEs, business analysts, and data scientists to design overall solutions to solve business problems (may be done in conjunction with a Business Analyst)
Build data pipelines and deploy data integration solutions for new data sources
Significant analysis of large volumes of text-based data from social listening platforms
Develop scripts to enable Natural Language Processing (NLP) solutions to support analysis
Build, Train and test machine learning models for descriptive and predictive analyses
Use client's, or our own, standard data analysis and data integration tools and technologies to operationalize the solution
Ability to deploy solutions to "the cloud" and schedule/automate ETL jobs for continued processing
Mentor and train the junior members by conducting code reviews and lead the study sessions

 What We Are Looking For:

Self-starter with excellent communication and project management skills – this role will require navigating ambiguous tasks, working with a wide range of stakeholders, designing and carrying out feasibility tests.

Advanced degree with major in STEM or other quantitative field
Ability to manipulate and leverage large scale data with scripting language such as python
Ability to build ETL data pipelines for API integrations
Strong capacity to translate data and research into strategic insights and recommendations
Experience building cloud based solutions
3 years of full-time experience in data science or analytics related field; at least 1-2 years of experience managing multiple projects

Data and Reporting Analyst
Acture Solutions of Westchester, NY is looking to hire a full-time Data and Reporting Analyst. Do you want to work on the cutting edge of IT innovation and further your career within an inventive and collaborative culture? Would you like to work for a people-first company that treats each employee with incredible respect? Are you seeking to grow your IT skillset in a supportive environment? If so, please read on!
This Data and Reporting Analyst position earns top-of-industry pay of $75,000 - $85,000/year, depending on experience, technical knowledge, and industry certifications. We also offer a selection of 100%-employer-sponsored health care plans, a generous retirement plan, unlimited paid time off (PTO), and employer-sponsored continuing education. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, apply today!
ABOUT ACTURE SOLUTIONS
Delivering technology solutions since 1984, we are a rapidly growing managed services provider that provides digital transformation services to a diverse customer base. Our services encompass networking, data center, cybersecurity, physical security, and collaboration tools that help businesses, schools, medical centers, and governments deliver services digitally. We grew up servicing the needs of large school districts across New York State. As a result, our team acquired the skills necessary to work across a large diversity of environments with highly sensitive data security. With a decades-long legacy of helping customers work smarter and drive results, we are focused on delivering positive outcomes and customer satisfaction. We treat everyone as a family, from customers to employees.
We have a performance-driven culture with a growth mindset. Our employees are constantly challenged in their work and are encouraged to make mistakes and learn from those mistakes. We sincerely believe in the power of our team-centric approach. As long as the job is getting done, strong contributors enjoy significant amounts of freedom in their work. We trust our employees to determine the hours and location for work that best suits them. And, time off is encouraged. We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity.
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A DATA AND REPORTING ANALYST
As a Data and Reporting Analyst, you play an essential role in maintaining the respect we have earned within the industry. Since people are our product, you are expected to power our future growth. You are the lifeblood of the talent pool for our data organization from training junior talent to responding to customer needs the Data and Reporting Analyst is a leader within the team. With an exceptional focus on our customer's needs, you are the first point of contact for end-users experiencing issues with data problems. You save the day for them with your clear, level-headed, and friendly support.

QUALIFICATIONS FOR A DATA AND REPORTING ANALYST
5-7 years of experience in data analysis and reporting or other information management responsibilities
Experienced administering Student Management / Learning Management systems, such as Infinite Campus, PowerSchool, Canvas, Schoology (or experience with similar software)
Experienced MS SQL programmer including scripts, stored procedures, views. Familiar with MS SQL Server tools including SQL Management Console, Query Analyzer, SSIS, creating packages, BCP, SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services)
Experienced with Crystal Reports including creating reports and publishing with MS IIS and Visual Studio to make reports available to users
Experienced with Microsoft Office, including good excel skills. Some experience with MS IIS, Visual Studio
Familiar working with file formats for transferring data between systems, including excel, csv, and various text file formats
Exceptional customer service skills
Are you an active listener with the ability to explain technical information in layman's terms? Do you have a positive attitude? Will you consistently work hard for the team? Do you have intellectual curiosity and a desire to continuously improve? Can you think on your feet? Are you organized and able to effectively prioritize multiple tasks? Do you take the time to help and mentor fellow teammates? Are you a creative thinker who is always looking for ways to improve processes? Can you move from one task to another efficiently? If so, you might just be perfect for this Data and Reporting Analyst position!
WORK SCHEDULE
This full-time Data and Reporting Analyst position typically works Monday - Friday, 7:30 AM - 4:00 PM with a 30-minute lunch break.

The Data Specialist is responsible for streamlining and implementing operational efficiencies across the agency’s service-delivery operations and independently interpreting, developing, managing, improving, and streamlining performance via analytical dashboards, budget projections, and operational reporting systems. The Data Analyst will aggregate, analyze, and use his/her judgement to interpret data derived from program databases, staff process flows, and best-practice research to inform the construction of analytical and operational tools, as well as train program staff in their use, and identify management tasks that are more efficiently done centrally by the Data Analyst. The goal of the Data Analyst will be to facilitate and meaningfully impact a culture change in programs from manual, inefficient practices to a streamlined, data-driven environment, and maintain this new culture through continued performance analytics.
Essential Functions:
Flow program operations to understand what data should be tracked, analyzed, and reported on.
Research and interpret best practices for program operations and management in order to understand how efficiencies may be created, then implement those efficiencies.
Independently develop weekly performance analytics, dashboards, and operational reporting.
In an effort to create program efficiencies, the data analyst will identify key program management tasks that the data analyst can assume responsibility via the use of data analytics.
Analyze new and existing database platforms and develop a method and mechanism to mine data from those databases for use in operational analytics.
Various ad-hoc analytics for senior management.
Work closely with program directors to train them on data-driven decision making.
Understand the financial structure of the agency, particularly which programs are able to turn a surplus, and continually assess the financial and operational needs through various methods of data collection and data analysis that you develop.
Exercise discretion and judgement when identifying and correcting operational issues, and address/train the program directors.
Budget construction and management throughout fiscal year, including the development of financial analytics to be reported to programs.
Communicate with programs about performance indicators and fiscal issues with the level of complexity that program staff are able to understand. This level of complexity is up to the discretion of the data analyst as per his/her expertise in understanding data and how to interpret data for the given program.
Advise senior management on issues such as program performance and fiscal matters by making educated and intellectual interpretations of programmatic data. Senior management will base key strategic decisions on the interpretations provided by the data analyst.
Develop budget vs. actual, labor distribution, and other financial reports in order to communicate with programs in an effort to make the communication between programs and the finance department more effective and efficient.
Develop a full dashboard and analytical package for the contract billing portion of the finance department through process flows and independent research.
Independently develop trend analysis based on observations in programs in an effort to address deficiencies and create efficiencies.
Work with team to streamline agency data systems, including exploring ways to improve the Electronic Health Record.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications Required
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
One year experience as a Data Analyst, or equivalent experience.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, preferably with an understanding of logic-based problem solving.
Ability to translate complicated technical concepts into user-friendly language when dealing with healthcare staff.
High level of Excel competency; VLOOKUP, IndexMatch, Countifs ordering, Pivot Tables, calculation time awareness, macro creation, database creation, etc. (You will be tested on Excel ability in interview).
Ability to effectively visualize data in reports for all levels of staff from clinicians to board members.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Ability to be primarily responsible for the inception, development, maintenance, and eventual transition of projects.
Ability to multi-task and work on multiple reports at a time, usually due to time limitations while pulling data from the Electronic Health Record.
Qualifications Preferred:
Experience with Electronic Health Records, specifically Anasazi.
Experience with GIS systems.
Experience with developing SQL code to extract data.
Familiarity with Behavioral and Mental Health programs in New York City, specifically Article 31 Mental Health Clinics.
Experience with writing and presenting analytical reports to agency board and senior management.

positionName: Senior Business Analyst (Clinical Business Analyst Level III), Data & Analytics *2 Positions*
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for the delivery of reporting and analytics services offered through the Clinical Excellence Core. The overall goal of the Sr. Business Analyst is to offer facilitate the development and enhancement of data reporting assets such as dashboards, reports and supporting services to help them plan, perform, monitor and improve their work. The role will include digging deep into complex data, and coming up with specific and defined measures, metrics, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to support dashboard and reporting initiatives.
General tasks and responsibilities will include:
Serve as the primary point of contact to executive sponsors for dashboard and reporting needs
Work with dashboard/report sponsors to gather requirements, document business processes and workflows, and explore potential solutions with the service delivery teams
Document clear and concise requirements ensuring descriptions are complete, consistent, feasible, traceable, and verifiable to support the completion of data related projects
Support business and technology teams to ensure key deliverables are met in an accurate timely manner
Analyze and interpret business requirements into functional requirements and specifications that can be easily translated into technical requirements.
Develop scope of works with service delivery teams
Work with the service delivery team to develop a proof of concept and validate with customers
Verify that the solution meets the business, compliance and technical requirements prior to publication.
Minimum Qualifications

1. A Masters Degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and two years of experience serving as a lead in soliciting, defining, and managing requirements for internally and externally developed software in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
2. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university and five years of experience as described above; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one year.

Department Preferences

EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:
Bachelor’s degree or higher
KNOWLEDGEABLE IN:
Knowledgeable in health-related topics, EPIC & Tableau systems, SQL, Agile/Scrum
YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:
5+ years of business analyst experience, project manager, product manager, portfolio manager
PREFERRED SKILLS:
Strong interpersonal skills with the demonstrated ability to work with all levels within the organization
Analytical decision-making and problem-solving skills
Presents well with strong written and oral communication skills necessary to articulate complex themes in a simple manner
Interpret business challenges, identifies improvement opportunities and recommends best practices
Able to recognize situations that may have cross-functional impact on the success of a project
How To Apply

Please be advised that proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required prior to hire.
If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

THE ROLE:

We are looking for a Enterprise Data Analyst to join the Enterprise Data team! You will be leading the lifecycle of Analytics dashboards, including business requirements gathering, functional specification write-ups, prototyping, development, quality testing, user acceptance testing, roll-out and post-launch improvement implementation. As a Data Analyst, you have a demonstrated ability to craft engaging and interactive business insights dashboards using Tableau and possesses the knowledge and experience on data visualization standard methodologies, with a focus on improving user interaction and user experience.

Job Responsibilities:

Use tools (Ex, Tableau) and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats

Experience with a variety of graphing and visualization techniques
Have the confidence to work multi-functionally with various groups including business partners and technical personnel
Must have excellent verbal communications skills and documentation skills to maintain workflows and dashboard functionality.
Hands on with Tableau Desktop (dashboard creation, report authoring and troubleshooting, data source management).

Basic Job Requirements:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in computer science.
5+ years crafting and developing business intelligence dashboards using any BI tools
5+ years of Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
5+ years of experience using any ETL tools
5+ years of experience using any data quality tools
5+ years of experience using SQL

Working knowledge of Alteryx a plus
knowledge of data related UI development and design of relational databases

Proactive, a self-starter that actively engages with the team and client
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Solution oriented, automated and production worthy results

Peloton uses technology + design to connect the world through fitness, empowering people to be the best version of themselves anywhere, anytime. We have reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform. Seamlessly combining hardware, software, and streaming technology, we create digital fitness and wellness content and products that Members love. "Together We Go Far" means that we are greater than the sum of our parts, stronger collectively when each one of us is at our best. This work has no endpoint; it is the constant work of running an organization that strives to reach its full potential. Want to work at the forefront of a fast-growing and award winning FinTech company? With an incredible team and partners looking for innovative results, we're rapidly growing and continue to add new asset classes to our offerings. We are on the lookout for smart and collaborative talent to join our team. As a cloud-based company, we are currently operating in a flexible and hybrid work model.

Job Description
We're looking for a Data Analyst to own, develop and evangelize data-driven thinking and analysis across the organization. You will sit in the data team and be the primary point-of-contact for all analytical needs at SIMON. Ideal candidates will not only analyze data and respond to client requests but will most importantly turn insights into action. As a result, candidates should be able to understand complex business problems, scope projects, identify operational bottlenecks, optimize workflows, and communicate their findings across all levels of the organization.


How You Will Fulfill Your Potential

Develop dashboards for various business teams, charting key metrics and extracting data-driven insights
Write ad hoc scripts in Python and SQL which extract, transform, validate, and aggregate data
Serve as the primary point-of-contact for all business teams (including answering technical questions, serving client requests, troubleshooting suspect data, and spearheading new analyses)
Grow data insights into concrete execution plans by scoping requirements, feasibility, cost-benefit, governance, dependencies, telemetry, and adoption
Evangelize best practices, data-oriented thinking, knowledge sharing, and workflow optimization
Construct data-driven experiments, evaluate statistical models, and regularly present your findings to department heads


What We're Looking For

Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business, Mathematics, Statistics or a related technical field
2 or more years of experience in an analytical role on cross-functional teams, with a preference for consulting, finance or early-stage companies
Excellent writing, communication and presentation skills
Expert knowledge of SQL
Very good knowledge of Python
Good knowledge of a business intelligence tool (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, QuickSight), Microsoft Excel, and basic statistics
Good knowledge of finance and business (e.g. capital markets, financial securities, derivative instruments)
Exceptional ability to understand client needs, scope projects, develop detail-oriented execution plans, and communicate results
An entrepreneurial hunger to own problems from start-to-finish, manage projects, overcome operational bottlenecks, and execute effectively


Preferred Qualifications

Application, database or systems programming knowledge (e.g. OOP, AWS, data modeling, networking concepts, bash)
Machine learning experience or interest

We offer a competitive salary and benefits, the chance to work with a curated team of top-notch, highly creative talent, and a fun and agile work environment with many perks in New York City's Hudson Yards district, but are operating remotely through at least summer 2021.

About SIMON
SIMON Markets is an award-winning fintech company that is committed to transforming the digital experience for financial professionals, enabling them to better serve their clients. SIMON's intelligent and innovative platform delivers an end-to-end digital suite of tools to over 100,000 financial professionals, who serve $5 trillion in client assets, empowering them with on-demand education, an intuitive marketplace, real-time analytics, and lifecycle management.
With a focus on reshaping the advisor experience, SIMON is setting new industry standards, simplifying the complex, and delivering structured investment, annuity, and defined outcome ETF solutions to investment professionals, centralized within one unique ecosystem.
Originally incubated within Goldman Sachs, SIMON launched as an independently operating company in December 2018 under the shared ownership and direction of seven leading financial institutions—Barclays, Credit Suisse, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, J.P. Morgan, Prudential, and Wells Fargo. Growth equity firm WestCap became an investor in 2021. The company is headquartered in New York, NY, with an additional location in Birmingham, AL.
No matter which part of the team you join, there is something interesting to work on. Our front-end team is building out our web and mobile presence using React, Redux, and Webpack along with some very sophisticated data visualizations. Our back-end team is using Scala, Akka, Postgres and other open-source technologies to build a micro-services architecture that can scale to handle our ambitious roadmap. Our quantitative engineering team is researching and building novel financial strategies to widen our competitive advantage. Our dev-ops team is creating a development and production environment with Docker and Kubernetes to keep us nimble. Product Management sits in the middle of it all to make it happen.

Bread, a division of Alliance Data, is a technology-driven payments company that partners with merchants and partners to personalize payment options for their customers. Bread integrates directly with merchants on their ecommerce site and gives them a single platform that lets them offer more ways to pay over time. Are you passionate about facilitating data-driven decisions? Do you enjoy tackling challenges at the intersection of business knowledge, data infrastructure, and statistical modeling? Are you looking for an entry-level role that will allow you to hone your analytical skills while architecting your career alongside a team of data professionals? The Analytics team at Bread sits within a rapidly expanding data vertical and works cross-functionally with stakeholders across Product, Finance, Engineering, and Operations to ensure that we are making the best data-backed decisions we possibly can.

Your role at Bread:

Business Intelligence and Data Visualization: Using Looker, you'll work closely with our business teams to define new key performance indicators (KPIs) and build out dashboards to communicate results to internal stakeholders.
A/B Testing: You'll work with our product teams to design, set-up, monitor, and assess changes to our platform via A/B testing, analyzing the conversion effects across the funnel. You'll be a part of the process from start to finish, from brainstorming new ways to improve conversion and profitability to calculating the final results to inform the roll-out decision.
Statistical Analysis and Research: The product space you'll be working in has a lot of opportunities for research. You'll spend time working on understanding user behavior from offline and digital engagement with our product to trends in customer repayment rates. You'll help answer ad-hoc questions and add to our knowledge base, in addition, to conducting analysis on product performance to provide "actionable" insights that drive decision-making for our product team.
Data Modeling and Data Warehousing: As we add new features to our platform or start tracking new data points, you'll work with the engineering team to incorporate these new data points into our data infrastructure and load them into our data warehouse.
Learning and Teaching: As our team grows, we'll continue to contribute to a company-wide data-first culture and team-wide culture of continuous learning and improvement. You'll be asked to share discoveries, refine our problem discovery process, and shape our processes and infrastructure.

 Must Have:

1-2 years of experience in analytical roles
Bachelor's degree: Statistics, Finance, Economics, Math, Computer Sciences, or other relevant experience.
Fluency in SQL and evidenced experience with at least one functional programming language, especially Python or R
Experience working on cross-functional teams
Knowledge of statistics, i.e. confidence intervals, linear regression, and hypothesis testing
Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences

Nice to Have:

Experience in engineering (software engineering, data engineering) roles
Experience with any technologies in our analytics stack: Snowflake, PostgreSQL, DBT, Databricks and/or Spark, Airflow, Python, Github, Looker, and Docker
Knowledge about financial services or web applications
Familiarity with survey data, software, and methods
Familiarity with an agile working environment

FUNCTION:

evaluating customer behavior and the profitability of the customer portfolio to generate

actionable insights that support critical business decisions.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

evolving our strategic and ad hoc analytics capabilities.

relating to the creation or expansion of new or existing services.

Develop creative approaches and methodologies to answer critical business questions, evaluate

new product and service opportunities, and assess market potential.

Provide actionable and insightful recommendations from data mining, segmentation, customer

profiling and quantitative analyses with the goals of: identifying acquisition, cross-sell, up-sell,

and retention opportunities.

Evaluate opportunities to improve customer profitability, targeting efficacy, offer appeal,

channel preference, product and service bundling, customer loyalty, etc.

Participate in strategic marketing decisions relating to customer needs, preferences, behaviors

and segmentation, as well as advertising, direct marketing, and digital marketing efforts.

Interpret results of analyses, translate insights into actionable recommendations, present the

insights and recommendations to senior management and work closely with business partners to

integrate and operationalize the recommendations in the business strategies, plans and tactics.

Understand and adhere to the Company’s risk and regulatory standards, policies and controls in

accordance with the Company’s Risk Appetite. Identify risk-related issues needing escalation to

management.

Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the M&T Bank brand.

Maintain M&T internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and

external audit points together with any issues raised by external regulators as applicable.

Complete other related duties as assigned.

NATURE AND SCOPE:

This position is a member of our on-shore analytics team , which conducts quantitative and

statistical analyses of customer information, evaluates customer behavior, and the profitability of

the customer portfolio, generating actionable insights to support critical business decisions. This

person will provide the technical and thought leadership for extracting customer/client and

or related field.

packaged goods, and/or marketing services companies.

About MeetElise

MeetElise is on a mission to revolutionize the housing industry, with the ultimate goal of making good housing more accessible.

Access to affordable housing isn't just a problem - it's a global crisis. An estimated seven million affordable and available rental homes are needed in just the US alone, and no amount of government spending or policy have proven to be effective solutions.

MeetElise uses machine learning to address the underlying cause preventing significant advancements in affordable housing: operational costs. By automating the leasing and management of apartment homes, we're creating a new, low cost operating model that allows for the development of new housing at scale.

Our first product is an AI leasing agent named Elise that converts 65% more prospective renters to residents than a human leasing agent. She answers questions and schedules tours 24/7 and is so human-like that renters say they're "here to meet Elise" when they show up for a tour.

MeetElise is well-funded by VCs, strategic real estate investors, and customers and was started by technical cofounders from MIT and the University of Cambridge.

Our small, courageous team is building the future we want to live in. A future where housing is affordable, powered by technology, and accessible to all.

About the role

Drive the business and product strategy for MeetElise. You'll use data to answer difficult questions and come up with interesting insights into our users, products and market position. As a Product Analyst you get to use your quantitative skill set, obsession, empathy towards customers and collaborative spirit to work closely with Product, Sales, Engineering, and Data Science to provide data driven insights that unlock new opportunities to take our products to the next level.

Responsibilities
Refine ambiguous questions into ones that can be clearly answered using the right data
Generate new hypotheses about our products through a deep understanding of the data, our customers, and our business
Define how our teams measure success, by developing Key Performance Indicators and other user/business metrics, in close partnership with Product and other subject areas such as engineering, operations and marketing
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to build and improve on the availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability of data logging and data pipelines.
Develop data-driven business insights and work with cross-functional partners to identify opportunities and recommend prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiatives.
Requirements
Advanced degrees in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Operation Research, Machine Learning or other quantitative field
3+ years industry experience in an analytics focused role
Advanced SQL expertise
Strong storytelling: distill interesting and hard-to-find insights into a compelling, concise data story
Ability to communicate effectively and manage relationships with partners coming from both technical and non-technical backgrounds
Ability and experience in extracting insights from data, and summarizing learnings / takeaways
Meaningful experience with Google Sheets and dashboarding/data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar)
Basic understanding of experimental design (such as A/B experiments) and statistical methods
Personal Characteristics
Entrepreneurial; gritty, 'roll-up-your sleeves' attitude
Hardworking
Organized
Action-orientated with the ability to influence others
Self-starter mentality, yet a team player with a collaborative approach
Ego free
Direct and clear communicator
Why join

Growth and impact.

You'll be learning by constantly shipping product, measuring its impact and refining through data.

You'll work with top data scientists to help hone and grow your analytical skills.

You'll be significantly changing how the housing industry works today with the ultimate goal of creating more housing opportunities.

It's not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded startup that's scaling.

Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You'll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn't when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you. Collectively, we'll be figuring out the path to serving millions of apartments.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you'll have at MeetElise, we also want to make sure that you're set up for success and financially compensated for your contributions.

Top market salary and stock options
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
401k benefits
Unlimited vacation
Monthly fitness stipend
Flexible working hours - we look at output, not hours.

We'll cover relocation packages from outside of the Greater NYC metro area - we'll make the move exciting, not painful.

At Argo Group, you can be part of an organization where we are small enough to be agile and big enough to make a difference. You can make a direct impact while working in a high-performing, innovative and inclusive team.

Argo Group International Holdings, Ltd. (NYSE: ARGO) is a global multiline underwriter of specialty insurance and reinsurance products in the property and casualty market. We help power the businesses that drive the world economy, offering a comprehensive line of high-quality products and services designed to meet the unique coverage and claims-handling needs of our clients. We foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity and design thinking, relies on innovation and agility, promotes collaborative service delivery, frequent, integrated communication, and authentic recognition of excellence. View the latest Investor Presentation to learn more about Argo.
We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Data Analyst to deliver impactful insights to teams across the business. This individual will have the opportunity to inspire and mentor additional members of the team in all things data-related. A successful candidate will be technically strong, proficient in communicating results to a range of audiences, and excited to share their knowledge with other team members. This Senior Data Analyst will ideally be based in our any of our US offices or remote.

Responsibilities

Serve as expert in data analytics, including data mining, data preparation and report generation.
Perform gap analysis to compare as-is and to-be state.
Provide guidance to other analysts on the team.
Transform data into readable, goal driven actionable items for continued innovation and growth.
Work as a primary contact with the business to understand their analytical needs and deliver actionable insights.
Design the framework in following best practices in data querying and manipulation to ensure data integrity.
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.
Acquire data from different sources with the help of data engineers and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible and scalable.
Select appropriate combination of methods and tools with defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution.
Design and work alongside with development team to create visualizations and widgets for real-time insights.
Work cross functionally on business solutions to develop and deliver sophisticated analytic solutions that support strategic business initiatives.
Effectively communicate information across the team.

Qualifications

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Actuarial Science.
5-7 years' experience in a similar role.
Ability to write scripts within SQL and or Python.
Experience with data mappings, data transformation and building data views.
Experience in data mining and modeling using large datasets.
Experience in technical writing in relevant areas, including queries and reports.
Experience working with data warehouses.
Familiarity with concepts of data visualizations.
Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation and analysis.
Ability to translate data into insights that will allow business to be make data-driven decisions.
Passionate about problem solving.
Familiar with working on large datasets and manipulating data to extract desired information.
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.

Position Purpose:
The Data Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis and reporting of client/customer data using complex analysis of datasets in areas of research, development, product enhancement or other targeted business objectives. This position will use advanced mathematical methods to analyze and interpret data from various sources with an outcome to solve critical business needs for internal or external clients. This position will ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices, gathering and entering missing data, and resolving any anomalies and use established statistical methods to determine data sources, sample sizes and appropriate methods to create and interpret reports.
Essential Job Responsibilities:
Performs analysis activities of current data to provide critical information to our internal and/or external clients. This data will help the business become more efficient, more targeted, and more responsive to our clients and/or customers. Success will be measured by successful implementation of recommendations and client satisfaction scores.
Collaborates with stakeholders (internal/external clients) and team members at all levels to clarify, detail, and manage reporting needs and activities.
Work independently on small, medium or large analytics with little supervision.
Understand where data comes from, able to utilize data to resolve business issues in the most effective manner providing best reporting through dashboards and other means of communication through data.
Generates client facing and operational performance reports, including Critical to Quality KPI’s
Proactively identifies performance metrics and recommends to business line
Six Sigma Green Belt (or ability to become on within 6 months)
Identify, recommend, and assist operation in automating manual operational processes to be measured by a minimum of 10% decrease in manual operations year over year
Proactively recommend operational efficiency and performance enhancements based upon data analysis to be measured by a minimum of 10% increase if efficiencies year over year
Participates in post-project and “Lessons Learned” for project wrap meeting and document for review and process consideration to recommending best course of action for continual improvement.
Will confirm project scoping for internal and external client solutions; communicate effectively to identify options, explain issues, recommend solutions, manage risks, and reduce escalations during project design and delivery
Design and develop structured and ad-hoc reports for operations analysis using the SSRS reporting environment and SQL
Analyze business requirements to design, model, and implement centralized data warehouses utilizing Visual Studio and SQL-T to develop in-depth cost savings analytics
Will provide solutions that improve business efficiency and enable access to data and total collaboration at the organization level in various formats including MS Office, SharePoint, and Robot Process Automation (RPA)
The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.
Required Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, computer science and/or related field required or equivalent experience
Job Related Experience:
Three the five years as a Reporting Analysis or equivalent work experience in a similar role
One plus years of experience working for a Financial Institution or Software vendor
One plus years of experience working with robot process automation preferred
Additional Skills/Knowledge:
Proficiency with MS Office Suite & Power Apps
Proficiency with database administration, preferably within Azure Cloud/SQL
Altair Monarch experience a plus
Analytical skills to assess client business need, identify solutions, and manage needs across multiple projects.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation abilities to facilitate participation in requirements gathering and training sessions.
Active listening skills to understand what people say and detect what they might be hesitant to say.
Strong consultative skills to deal with internal and external clients and facilitate collaboration.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Creative problem solving.
Strong self-motivation with excellent time management skills, including ability to work on time sensitive projects.
Must be proficient in understanding and writing complex SQL queries to deliver business intelligence for internal and external clients

We're redefining what's possible in public education. We set out to tackle this education crisis with a groundbreaking school design that delivers a rigorous, whole-child education to students from all backgrounds. Today, as the fastest growing, highest-performing charter school network in New York, our network of 47 K-12 schools outperforms every district in the state, proving irrefutably that all children are capable of excellence.
Job Description
The Technology Division at Success Academy is the chief provider of technology infrastructure, application services, security, and support. The Division partners with teams across the organization to equip students, teachers, leaders, and staff with the innovative technology tools and know-how necessary to achieve academic and operational excellence.
The Enterprise Data and Analytics department’s purpose is to build a healthy data and technology culture. By focusing on the concrete educational outcomes we are trying to accomplish in our schools, the team develops technical and organizational systems that are user-friendly, scalable, and flexible. The department is responsible for all reporting, analytics, data infrastructure, training, and evangelization.
This new Senior Data Analyst role will be a key contributor to our mission of driving innovation and democratizing data across the organization. Reporting to the Leader of Enterprise Data & Analytics, this role will be responsible for building dashboards in data visualization tools, querying an AWS data warehouse to build insights to support stakeholders, and code SQL data models in dbt.
Key responsibilities include:
Deliver and communicate data-driven insights and reports to stakeholders by querying an Amazon Redshift data warehouse using SQL.
Develop and maintain dashboards that are viewed by senior leadership and operation groups across the school network.
Work closely with school operations and management teams across the network to help capture business requirements and translate those requirements into SQL code.
Collaborate with data engineers to build transformed data sets for reporting needs.
A successful applicant will have the following experiences and education:
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field like Math, Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology and/or experience in data analytics.
Ability to easily code complex SQL queries from scratch, having done so for at least 4 years.
Hands-on experience within reporting and data visualization tools such as Looker, Domo, PowerBI or other BI tools.
Strong communication skills, capable of explaining complex data models and dashboards in a concise and digestible manner.
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
SQL coding experience in dbt is a plus.

Who we are:
automotiveMastermind currently provides U.S. automotive dealers with AI/behavior prediction analytics software and marketing solutions that improve the vehicle purchase process and results. Our cloud-based technology helps dealers precisely predict automobile-buying behavior and automates the creation of microtargeted customer communications, leading to proven higher sales and more consistent customer retention. In 2017 we were acquired by IHS Markit.
IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. They help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk.
What we do:
Our proprietary software-as-a-service helps automotive dealerships and sales teams better understand and predict exactly which customers are ready to buy, the reasons why, and the key offers and incentives most likely to close the sale. Its micro-marketing engine then delivers the right message at the right time to those customers, ensuring higher conversion rates and a stronger ROI.
What you will do as a Data Analyst
A critical function of the Data Strategy team is to ingest third-party data and deliver high-quality inputs to our data science and consumer marketing processes. These processes use information derived from inputs such as OEM incentives data to predict consumer behavior and present meaningful and compelling offers to our dealer partners’ customers.
As a Data Analyst, you will become a subject-matter expert in automotive industry incentives data and analysis. You will develop a working understanding of the incentives data flow from ingestion to application, directly impacting automotiveMastermind data quality and customer experience. You will identify errant data inputs by applying and creating analytical frameworks to streamline quality check processes. You will support troubleshooting of data flow issues in collaboration with our vendor, product teams, and engineering partners. You will regularly work with large sets of data in the production environment, combining analytical thinking and knowledge of the data flow to confirm data accuracy and integrity. You are expected to take ownership of your work, respond to varying levels of urgency, contribute on multiple projects in parallel, and escalate according to SLAs on an ad-hoc basis.
Resolve complex data-related issues under time pressure, providing excellent communication to internal and external stakeholders
Develop a deep and broad understanding of automotive incentives and their application
Learn and improve upon aM’s current extraction, ingestion, transformation, and quality control processes for incentives data
Continuously enhance analytical processes to ensure high quality of transformed data
Take ownership of the monthly incentives process including analysis of OEM programs, input validation, error tracking, and anticipation of potential problems
Resolve data-related customer support tickets, developing an instinct for data vs. system issues
Query and extract data using common computer languages (SQL, C#, Python)
Analyze data to support data-driven decision making
Analyze data to determine the scope of issues and support containment efforts
Work towards the company’s vision/mission/goals by spearheading independent projects
Who you are:
Bachelors’ degree in mathematics, engineering, economics, statistics, computer science, information management or related quantitative field
1-2 years of relevant professional experience in a fast-moving company or in the auto industry
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to think quickly on your feet and handle ambiguity
Comfortable with technology and an understanding of process-based tools
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Excel (vlookups, index/match, pivot tables, etc.)
Intermediate SQL knowledge
Prior automotive experience a plus
SalesForce experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to execute against multiple projects as part of a team or independently, while managing competing deadlines
Regularly assess your own performance and adapt your work to achieve better results
Continually look to improve your professional career, as well as strive for personal growth

positionName: Business Analyst (Entry Level) Rotation Program - New York, NY
description:
First Year Associate Program for Business Analysts
This program is an onboarding of 6 candidates into 6 business units. Our recruitment of candidates is rigorous and thorough. These six individuals will have a full year of dedicated onboarding which will involve a rotation to the various selected business units. While each candidate may be prequalified for a specific business unit, the rotation will allow not only for more comprehensive understanding of Net at Work solutions, but also a decision early on for a best match. The group will operate as a team for much of the initial training, sponsored by our People and Learning Department. They will also work independently on the assigned business units. There will be three rotations in all. Each rotation assignment will be five weeks where the first week of each rotation is attendance of Net at Work Academy (a part of Net at Work University). At the completion of the rotation cycles, candidates will be assigned a specific independent project and then finally to a specific business unit.
For the first four months, candidates will be assigned a group mentor from People and Learning team who they will meet with twice a week, once as a group and once in a one on one session. They will be closely monitored for any open issues or concerns. Assessments from training will be reviewed as will feedback from respective consulting managers. Periodic team events will be held such as lunches and visits (virtual for now) to client sites. At least one meeting will be arranged with all six consulting managers, practice directors and candidates. At the end of this phase, First Years will be assigned their permanent placement.
This role is currently designed as a hybrid work model, that is, both in office and remote.
Role Summary
As a First Year Associate Business Analyst’s role is to plan, design, develop, and launch efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. Using both business and technical skills, the Business Analyst works directly with customers to identify business requirements with enough detail and clarity to proposals for solutions. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.
Responsibilities
 Strategy & Planning
Assist in the planning, design and development of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.
Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end-users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business systems issues.
Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.
Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
 Acquisition & Deployment
Assist in the deployment of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.
Create system design proposals.
Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers.
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.
Provide orientation and training to end-users for all modified and new systems.
Other duties as assigned.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Management or related field
0-2 years of related experience
3.4 GPA required
Competencies:
Communication Skills: Communicates well one-on-one, in small groups and public speaking. Keeps people informed. Writes clear, precise, well-organized documents using appropriate vocabulary, grammar and word usage.
Analysis: Identifies significant problems and opportunities. Analyzes problems and people in depth. Determines root causes and offers appropriate solutions.
Customer Focused: Monitors client satisfaction, establishes partner relationship with clients. Visible and accessible to clients.
Pragmatism: Generates sensible, realistic and practical solutions to projects.
About Net at Work
Net at Work is a full-service IT and business consultancy with unparalleled expertise in the development of business technology solutions. From needs assessment and design, to training and support, our energy and talent is devoted to optimizing your business systems. With client service as our highest priority, our goal is to be considered an integral part of your business; utilizing promising new technologies and methods to attribute to your success.
Our nationwide presence, and strong partnerships with proven technology leaders (including NetSuite, Sage Software, Microsoft, Salesforce, Abila, Magento, Dell, HP, VMware, Citrix & Cisco), allows Net at Work to deliver a range of unbiased, integrated solutions that bring our clients every competitive advantage possible.

RSG Media helps the world's leading TV Networks, Studios, VOD & OTT Providers, MVPDs, and Brand Licensors manage their rights, grow their audience, and optimize advertising revenue. RSG is now part of Naviga Inc.


Position Overview:

As a Business Analyst, you will work with the worlds’ largest media & entertainment companies, helping implement our industry-leading RightsLogic® strategic rights management software. You will work with executives to help them improve their processes to discover and unlock hidden value.
