Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from ViacomCBS, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream ViacomCBS Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage. Brand/Division Overview:
Data plays a central role at ViacomCBS, and as part of the Data & Insights Group (DIG), our Business Intelligence team is a crucial part of our success. It drives business, content, product, and operational decisions by providing rich data, strategic insights and analytical products. Are you We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about data and entertainment and who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment!
The position is anchored around our growing SVOD service Paramount+, which includes a wealth of established library content across CBS, MTV Entertainment Group, Nickelodeon, BET and more, together with its growing Originals’ slate, such as iCarly, Star Trek: Picard; RuPaul's Drag Race All Stars, PAW Patrol: The Movie; Queenpins, The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge On The Run and Why Women Kill and many more. Role Details:
Our team primarily focuses on social media for Paramount+ and developing and generating reports, insights, & analysis across multiple sources and solutions - covering account, content and competitor analysis, social listening and more. With a strong understanding of social trends, platform tracking nuances and also having a deep understanding of SQL, this analyst will work closely with the insights and social analytics group to ensure all needed APIs are ingested and appropriate dashboards are built for Paramount+ partners. You will be tasked to identify business, content strategy and social programming opportunities, challenges, and trends and be able to communicate your findings effectively to various partners in the marketing and content vertical. This role will be primarily focused on social data analysis work related to Paramount+. Your Day-to-Day:
Define and deliver social focused KPIs and reporting, that will inform social and content strategy
Write SQL to query a data warehouse (BigQuery) for data in order to answer questions from a variety of stakeholders in the content and social vertical
Support content, social and marketing teams with needed campaign reporting and analyses
Present insights and recommendations to the business in a confident and understandable manner
Develop and maintain statistical and spreadsheet models for social forecasting, scenario planning, and other predictive work
Use reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau, Data Studio, Sprinklr, DOMO, Talkwalker Analytics to build social-focused dashboards that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Research industry trends and communicate how these could potentially impact the business from a social perspective Key Projects (examples):
Work with the data management team to ensure appropriate APIs are ingested and tables are set up appropriately
Design and develop comprehensive reporting tools/solutions for Paramount+’s associated social accounts
Measure social performance around original shows and tentpole events and their respective advertising campaigns
Collaborate with key partners and teams to develop appropriate social goals and forecasting solutions
Conduct downstream reporting and analysis for Subscriber Households who were acquired through social media
Identify social media opportunities for Paramount+, through competitor intelligence analysis and reporting Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience
2-3 years experience in digital marketing/entertainment sector
Can provide accurate information in a usable form and on a timely basis.
Demonstrated experience in translating data into insights in a clear and succinct manner, adjusting to a variety of styles and audiences
Expert in social native reporting
Experience in social analytics tools such as Sprinklr, Talkwalker, ListenFirst
Knowledgeable in SQL; Tableau; Data Studio
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel; Powerpoint)
Phenomenal presentation and communication skills, with the ability to articulate concepts to partners at all levels
Ability to work in a fluid environment, against tight deadlines
Interest in television, entertainment and pop culture You might also have:
Strong mathematics, statistics background
Experience using project management tools like those from Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience using Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
A background in SVOD or other subscription-based digital services

positionName: Senior Data Analyst (Clinical Business Analyst Level III), Data & Analytics *3 Positions*
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Sr. Data Analyst manages data analysis and usage requirements and focuses on data and integration intensive initiatives working with all teams within Data and Analytics. Primary responsibilities include working with understanding data analysis and integration requirements and guiding solution design and architecture to meet these needs. The Sr. Data Analyst will work closely with the Analytics Centers of Excellence Core leaders, members of the Enterprise Information Management teams, and Applications teams to build and support the strategic approaches and methods to a variety of analyses.
General tasks and responsibilities will include:
Work within Service Delivery teams to understand requirements for data use, analysis, and quality.
Identify and aggregate data from internal and external sources.
Guide solution design to meet data and integration requirements and envision future use cases for big data and roadmap solutions to fulfill those use cases.
Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value.
Coordinate with data owners to ensure data accessibility and quality and contribute to management of central data stores and metadata.
Preparing forecasts and analyzes data trends, identify data anomalies and conduct deep dive data analysis.
Carefully analyze the data and draw conclusions, communicating the results in a clear, concise and actionable manner.
Collate, Cleanse and Organize data from several sources and work with cross‐functional project teams that include ETL, Programing & Architecture, Data Quality Assurance, and Data visualization.
Communicate directly with team members/support team to diagnose and resolve issues.
Work with other team members to continually improve our delivery and processes.
Actively participate on project team meetings to achieve team goals.
Compliance with business policies and industry standard best practices with regard to data security.
Create and maintain documentation of data procedures, policies, and adaptation.
Off‐hours and on‐call production support may be required.
Minimum Qualifications

1. A Masters Degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and two years of experience serving as a lead in soliciting, defining, and managing requirements for internally and externally developed software in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
2. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university and five years of experience as described above; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one year.

Department Preferences

EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:
Bachelor’s degree required.
KNOWLEDGEABLE IN:
Knowledge of data analysis and usage requirements
Strong understanding of data and integration architecture
Ability to guide solution design and architecture to meet business needs.
Proficiency in technology documentation.
Deep understanding of data analysis.
Analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to adapt and respond to change.
Understanding of business context and objectives
Ability to communicate technical concepts in plain language.
Ability to quantify resource requirements and measure and communicate proposed project benefits.
Influencing skills and demonstrated ability to engage both developers and business partners to achieve target outcomes.
Verbal and written communication skills.
YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:
7+ years of work experience in data analysis and visualization
Preference 4 years of experience working with healthcare data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions.
PREFERRED SKILLS:
Use analytic tools such as Tableau and SAS for through data analysis and visualization.
Experience with Business Analysis
Experience in other IT roles or functions such as quality assurance/testing, development, enterprise architecture, or project management.
Experience working on a project using Agile or iterative methods.


How To Apply

Please be advised that proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required prior to hire.
If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

positionName: Senior Data Analyst - HR Workforce Analytics
description:
Strength Through Diversity
Ground breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.
Job Title: Senior Data Analyst - HR Workforce Analytics
 The Senior Data Analyst oversees activities related to data integrity, security and enhancement of the value of data including data cleaning, query tracking, and developing and implementing policies and procedures. The Senior Data Analyst may direct the movement of data across multiple systems; oversee its validation and organization and make sure that data is available to appropriate people and systems within an organization.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Uses modeling techniques and tools in analyzing and specifying data structure in large and/or complex data sets.
Use SQL queries to pull data from internal data warehouse and Oracle Cloud.
Create advanced data models for data marts and Tableau
Generate advanced dashboards in Tableau and excel to provide analytics for client groups.
Work directly with the NYS staffing committee and provide reporting, analytic, and automation support for the various initiatives they are implementing.
Implements best practices in data management to ensure the integrity of the data, the quality of data processes and delivers analyzable or analyzed data to a variety of internal and external clients of the Medical Center.
Recommends best practices for data transformations to support the data movement. Defines data migration requirements, gathering, validating and documenting data requirements.
Translates, merges, cleans up and/or maps data into conceptual, logical and physical data models.
Oversees all activities related to data cleansing, data quality and data consolidation using industry standards and processes.
Identifies, develops, and documents data standardization, data enrichment operations, data validations, data security requirements, and data exception handling processes.
Documents, implements, maintains or recommends operating methods to improve processing, distribution, data flow, collection, database editing procedures.
Designs and writes custom applications needed to ensure the database meets requirements for the entry, management and reporting of data.
Recognizes recurring issues and analyzes causes in order to reach a solution. Generates plans and provides tools/techniques for improvement and to measure success.
Trains staff with varying degrees of knowledge to effectively use the database system.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics and/or related field.
Master’s degree in relevant field of study preferred.
5-6 years database application/management experience, preferably in a large medical center or healthcare environment.
Strength Through Diversity

The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity, equity, and inclusion are key drivers for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education, and advancement as we revolutionize medicine together. We invite you to participate actively as a part of the Mount Sinai Health System team by:

We work hard to acquire and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you can develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, can make an impact on quality patient care.

Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our history!

Who We Are

Over 42,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.

Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai St. Luke’s, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.

The Mount Sinai Health System (MSHS) provides equal employment opportunity to all its employees and applicants for employment without unlawful discrimination on the basis of their actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, gender identity, age, disability, marital or parental status, sexual orientation, veteran, immigration, citizenship, or other protected status.

EOE including Veterans and Disabled

To strengthen our international team in New York, we are offering a full-time position as


Be a Pioneer. Make An Impact. Join Crealytics.

Looking to make a change? Come join our SoHo, NY-based digital marketing team as a

Paid Media Marketing Analyst
Crealytics is a boutique digital advertising agency serving the needs of some of the hottest ecommerce brands in the business, including Staples, Lands' End, Urban Outfitters, and 60+ others. We work on the bleeding edge of performance advertising - we lead through strategy, build our own tech, and continually set the pace for the industry and our clients.

Due to some truly exciting new business growth, we have openings throughout the business for talented and passionate people who want to contribute to our diverse, global, people-first culture. If you fit the qualifications below, we want to hear your story.

// Your responsibilities

The Paid Media Marketing Analyst is an analytics-driven, client facing role at Crealytics. You support the Management Team in the creation and execution of our global clients' strategies. Broadly, you'll be responsible for campaign optimization, quality control, and customer support. Some of your responsibilities will include:

Campaign optimization across biddable media systems. Google and Bing primarily, but also across a global footprint of secondary search engines and social media platforms
Rock-solid analytics intelligence. You are data literate and know how to transform complex datasets into compelling narratives
Daily collaboration on clients' success. You'll be the voice of the customer within our organization, keeping us focused on client success and driving our business to achieve customer goals

// Your profile

The most important skill will be your ability to analyze data and convincingly support your conclusions during presentations. We want people who are passionate about their work and take pride in their ability to drive the business forward. Some specific skills that our candidates need include:

Familiarity with search engine marketing management. You've had some experience in basic campaign optimization across Google Ads and Microsoft Advertising
You have excellent Excel skills. You understand how to tell stories with data, and make your analysis come to life
You thrive on collaboration. You can support your team across multiple projects and thrive in an inclusive, "all-in" culture
You are an expert communicator, whether it's in person, virtually, or across emails/IMs/etc
You are a critical thinker. You like to take ownership of your projects, advocate for your clients, and challenge the status quo
// What we offer

We know the number one reason people love their jobs is because of the people they work with. Which is why we try to create an open, collaborative, inclusive environment where people can challenge themselves, create together, and do amazing things. Our benefits include:

Flexible working situations. Want to work from an office full time? OK. Only want to work from an office occasionally? That's OK too. Digital Nomad? Still OK.
Educational opportunities. Anyone on staff can take advantage of the Crealytics' Academy, providing growth opportunities in including language instruction, certification training, and professional development, among dozens of others skill-based courses.
Socializing. Our get-togethers are always a mix of business and pleasure. We do both with equal gusto.
International exposure. With offices in both NYC and Berlin, we give our staff to access to the best thinking on two continents, and learning opportunities that come from working on global accounts.

We also offer all the standard packages – full health and dental benefits, 401K, flex time, fully stocked snacks and drinks (plus world class coffee!), gym discounts, and tons more.

Bottom Line
This role is for someone who values learning, collaborating, and pioneering. Crealytics has been successful for over 11 years due to the passion and creativity of its people. If you see yourself continuing that tradition, we can't wait to meet you.

Salary commensurate with experience. An equal opportunity employer.

positionName: Senior Analyst - Environmental Sustainability Data & Analytics
description:
Description
Ingram Micro touches 80% of the technology you use every day with our focus on Technology Solutions, Cloud, and Commerce and Lifecycle Solutions. With $46 billion in revenue, we have become the world’s largest technology distributor with operations in 56 countries and more than 30,000 associates. We continue to strategically expand our global reach with 32 acquisitions since 2012.


The successful candidate will play a key role in Ingram Micro’s Environment-People-Governance strategy and programs by managing and continuously improving environmental sustainability data collection, analysis, and reporting processes for Ingram Micro’s worldwide operations. The Senior Analyst - Environmental Sustainability Data & Analytics will report to Ingram Micro’s Director of ESG and will work with stakeholders across the Ingram Micro organization to track Ingram Micro’s environmental performance, identify environmental footprint reduction projects, and monitor and report on Ingram Micro’s progress towards its environmental goals to internal and external stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Serve as lead systems administrator for Ingram Micro’s environmental sustainability data collection, management, analysis, and reporting program, including but not limited to data on utility usage, GHG emissions, waste generation, materials usage, and water consumption.
Select, design, and/or continuously improve the communications, process, management, and software tools used for environmental sustainability data collection, management, analysis, and reporting.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve and automate data collection processes and connect to data sources to assure timely, consistent, and accurate data collection.
Prepare documentation of Ingram Micro’s environmental sustainability data collection, management, analysis, and reporting processes and tools.
Train new users and recruit and support internal data customers to promote culture of data-driven performance improvement.
Establish quality assurance processes to ensure accurate analyses and reporting, alignment with reporting standards, and coordination with third party validation activities.
Support Ingram Micro’s ESG programs and initiatives by preparing reports and analyses responsive to external reporting requirements, including regulatory programs, certifications, and customer inquiries.
Analyze environmental sustainability data and work cross-functionally to identify and evaluate compelling opportunities to reduce Ingram Micro’s environmental footprint, support project implementation, and monitor and report on results.
Collaborate with ESG teammates to act as an ambassador for environmental sustainability and other ESG topics and initiatives. Support various ESG team projects and activities as needed.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a field related to Environmental Management, Data Science, or a similarly technical and engineering-minded field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ related experience managing large data sets and data-gathering processes, preferably with environmental sustainability data and utility data.
Experience contributing to corporate ESG reports, regulatory reports, third-party certifications, and/or customer ESG data requests.
Experience developing environmental data collection systems, tools, databases, and/or software.
Strong organizational, planning, and project management skills.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to analyze data, leveraging information to provide clear, concise and supported recommendations for action.
Interest and experience in common and best practices covering environmental sustainability and ESG programs and initiatives.
Capacity to work independently and simultaneously handle a variety of complex matters under deadline pressure.
Strong skills in Microsoft Office suite, including Excel.
Experience with utility bill management, environmental sustainability management, and/or ESG program management softwareThis is not a complete listing of the job duties. It’s a representation of the things you will be doing, and you may not perform all of these duties. Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

The Child Mind Institute is seeking an Imaging Data Analyst to join the NKI-Rockland Sample II (NKI-RS II) initiative research team. The NKI-RS II is the next-generation initiative focused on the collection of high-dimensional, multimodal data from 600 individuals across the lifespan (ages 9-75). All participants who complete the study receive a free, no-cost mental health and learning evaluation that also includes speech and language screening assessments. The Imaging Data Analyst will be integral in reviewing, analyzing, processing, and reporting on incoming imaging data to ensure data quality. This includes, but is not limited to, MRI, EEG, actigraphy, and eye-tracking data. The Imaging Data Analyst will assist with creating scripts to check for data integrity and completeness and aid in preparing data for open data sharing initiatives.
Reporting to the Neuroimaging Data Analyst, this is an exempt, full-time position based in Midtown Manhattan.
The Child Mind Institute is proud to be named a Great Place to Work-Certified company! Our competitive compensation and benefits include medical insurance, 401(k) with match, flexible work schedules, paid parental leave, dependent care and discounted tickets and entertainment perks program.
Responsibilities:
Perform weekly neuroimaging data quality reports
Check incoming imaging data for completeness and accuracy
Queries databases to create reports and determine accuracy of the data entered
Manages and improves neuroimaging pipelines
Assist with basic statistical analysis of imaging data
Process incoming data from several neuroimaging sites
Assists in preparing data to be shared with research collaborators
Assist with data analysis for research projects and publications
Respond to queries from users of the openly shared neuroimaging dataset
Qualifications:
B.S. / B.A. in Computer Science, Information Systems, Neuroscience, Statistics, Engineering, or other related scientific fields. M.S. a plus.
Programming experience (examples include: Python, R, Bash Script, SQL, Matlab)
Experience in Linux environment and virtual containers, and cloud computing
Prior knowledge of MRI or EEG is required
Good understanding of information technology-oriented methods and approaches
Strong interpersonal skills, as well as strong written and oral communication
Ability to work in a fast-paced and multidisciplinary environment
Ability to work as a member of a team as well as independently
Passion for the CMI mission
Please upload your resume and cover letter during the application process. Only applications with a cover letter will be considered.

Who we are
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.
Overview
As part of Global Operations organization, the Business Escalation team aims at limiting financial and reputational impact to Criteo from both internal and external technical/operational issues.
With team members in Paris, New York and Tokyo, the team is the global point of contact for critical business incidents management. Business Escalation orchestrates global investigations and response plan partnering with several stakeholders from R&D, Product, Sales & Operations and Legal teams. The team leverage analytical and business insights to efficiently scope issues, qualify impacts, identify required resources, and drive action plans. Upon resolution, the team uses insights from past issues to identify weaknesses in our infrastructure, monitoring, processes, and organization, and drives impactful initiatives to limit Criteo’s exposure to both internal and external risks.
Based in New York, we are looking for an Analyst, Business Escalation – Global Operations, to join a global team of 5 members. This role will report directly to the Head of Business Escalation – Global Operations sitting in Paris. In this role, you will focus on detecting, scoping, troubleshooting, and getting critical and large-scale incidents resolved on a day-to-day basis. You will drive initiatives to prevent issue reoccurrences, and improve the company’s ability to detect and resolve critical issues swiftly.
What You'll Do
Identify critical issues with a material revenue or reputation impact for Criteo:
Analyze suspicious business trends and deep dive on metrics to qualify and scope issues through the manipulation of large data sets
Partner with Sales, Operations, Product, and R&D teams across the organization, to ensure fast escalation and correct qualification of critical issues using dedicated escalation processes Manage critical issues through cross-functional team coordination and facilitate communication:
Leverage business and analytical insights during investigations to qualify issues, determine impacted scopes and timelines, and quantify business impacts.
Drive, challenge and support several teams towards an appropriate resolution.
Write and send out clear, real-time communications to Sales & Operations teams on ongoing and resolved incidents.
Partner with other team members to ensure a 24/7 & global coverage while follow-ups on issue investigations during the Americas time zone. Prevent issue reoccurrence, and improve the team’s efficiency when facing incidents
Drive issue post mortems, and leverage learning from past issues to propose, create and/or adapt internal processes and tools in order to further protect Criteo revenue and reputation.
Document and automate internal processes and recurrent tasks, in order to increase the team’s efficiency when managing issues.
Who You Are
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Technology, Business or related field
Proven experience as a Business or Data Analyst (1-2 years)
Strong analytical skills. Proficient in SQL. Python, Tableau skills are a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication in English
Ability to adopt a systematic approach towards identifying, synthetizing and then solving a problem, with strong hands-on attitude
Strong aptitude to coordinate cross-functional teams and own an action plan
Ability to communicate clearly to various stakeholders, and convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Curious with a great attention to details and able to turn observations into recommendations or improvement initiatives
Extremely organized and able to effectively prioritize and execute missions
Experience in driving small to medium-scale projects autonomously
At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.
Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Dandy is a business-in-a-box for dentists. Our vision is to become the operating system for every dental office in America by leading the transition to digital dentistry for the $200 billion industry. Headquartered in New York City, Dandy is backed by the world's leading venture capital investors.

Job Description

Dandy is hiring a Growth Operations Analyst to build the fundamental architecture that powers our sales team. As our company grows, this person will build databases and infrastructure that will empower our world class go-to-market function as we scale (we expect GTM to grow from 5 to 75 headcount in the next six months).

What You'll Do

Build, clean, and maintain our revenue and sales data to help power strategic decisions and provide actionable insights
Manage incoming data requests and prioritize the highest value projects in an organized fashion
Use your master SQL skills to craft cutting edge data solutions
Develop a comprehensive database covering the entire dental industry that will empower our growing sales team to prospect and close new deals
Punch through ambiguity and a growing level of complexity when it comes to our organization's sales and revenue data
Communicate data-backed findings to a diverse constituency of internal and external stakeholders
Build additional processes for our growing Sales and Revenue Operations team

What We're Looking For

0-2+ years in an sales or operations-oriented data analyst role (high-growth startup environments highly preferred)
Track record of success in building data processes and an ability to work through ambiguity
Demonstrated ability to work across disparate teams to achieve consensus on key business decisions
Experience with or a desire to learn the following tools: Salesforce, Gong, SQL, Excel, Google Sheets, Looker
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and fix problems in a hands-on manner
Intellectual curiosity and research abilities
With the above stated, we are open to candidates of all backgrounds and encourage you to apply if interested! Dandy is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive team and none of the above points are 100% required.

Bonus Points For:

Outstanding professional references to share
Exposure to healthcare environments or stakeholders
Part of a startup acquisition or IPO
Relentlessly positive attitude, strong sense of humor, and the ability to have fun at work

Benefits

Best in class healthcare including medical, dental, and vision
Competitive salary and equity packages
Fully stocked kitchen with snacks and coffee

Job Title: Business Analyst
Department: CSD
Location: Remote, work from home anywhere in the continental US
Percent Travel: Travel for short/medium period to customer locations - estimated at less than 10%
Who are Hansen Technologies?
We are a global provider of software and services to the energy, water, and communications industries. With our award-winning software suite, we help more than 600 customers in over 80 countries to create and deliver new products and services, engage with customers, and control and manage critical revenue management and customer support processes.
We are a culture of persistent problem-solvers, together on a journey with our customers striking the right balance between the legacy and future advancements.
Every day, we at Hansen inspire and challenge today’s utilities and telecoms to be tomorrow’s next experience companies. From North America to Australia and everywhere in between, you’ll be part of a global team of technology professionals who work to enable our clients to innovate more freely and engage at a new level with their customers.
Job Summary:
A Business Analyst works in a multi-vendor and multi-systems environment for large system integration or transformation programs/projects. The Business Analyst will gather and manage detailed requirements through our online incident system. These requirements will be one of the main drivers to continuously improve and enhance our products and services. Close interaction with our clients, Product Management, QA, and Engineering is required to gather high-level requirements and assist with refinement and analysis of requirements, implementation, and business scenarios. Some of the deliverables, in form of functional requirements, will be used by Engineering to design and implement these requirements.
Duties/Responsibilities:
Creating and revising Business and Technical requirements documents
Documenting business processes, identifying risks, and conducting an impact analysis
Identifies and documents business rules, functional capabilities, and business events; relates business rules to the process model and develops an appropriate software configuration for the client
Ensure completeness and accuracy of information captured in our internal incident system
Conducts gap analysis between current and to-be states; identifies gaps and defines and documents requirements to close gaps
Participates in the design of the application’s functional model and system architecture
Identifies and reports risks throughout the life of the project and provides mitigation strategies for those risks
Reviews quality assurance deliverables during the acceptance phase to ensure all requirements have been tested
Prepares business proposals and presents Hansen development/product capabilities to prospects and clients
Acts as the team subject matter expert and coordinates with business partners when more outside information is needed
Trains clients in the use of software particular to the clients’ operation
Support our clients utilizing our standard support tools and applications
Note: This is not an exhaustive list of duties and responsibilities, but a summary of work you can expect to complete as a Business Analyst.
Required Skills/Abilities:
Capability to efficiently interact with clients to ascertain the requirements to carry out analysis and design
Proven ability to lead, motivate and work with teams in cross-functional environments
Strong business acumen and excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Hands-on Experience and Good exposure with Cloudsense/Apptus/Sigma CPQ, Catalog, OM is ideal
Ability to lead and resolve the requirements/modeling issues, understand the customer documentation to spec out requirements and interface definitions efficiently
Helping Project Manager and Leads in the feasibility study, solution chunking, and estimation of Projects/Change requests.
Ability to prepare gap analysis based on the customer requirements and product
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, similar field, or equivalent work experience
3-4 years on Telecom BSS in BSA/Solution Designer capacity
Direct experience working at or with Communication/Telecommunication providers in a similar capacity to Business Analyst
5 years experience in gathering Business, Technical, and Data requirements
2 years experience working in an Agile environment as a Business Analyst or Product Owner.
Certified Product Owner and/or Scrum Master
Extensive experience in Unified Modeling Language (UML) methodologies to design Communication Diagram, Use Case Diagrams, Sequence Diagram, and class diagrams

We are an equal opportunity employer. Must be authorized to work in the US without restriction – sponsorship will not be offered for this role.

NYU Langone Health is a world-class, patient-centered, integrated academic medical center, known for its excellence in clinical care, research, and education. It comprises more than 200 locations throughout the New York area, including five inpatient locations, a children's hospital, three emergency rooms and a level 1 trauma center. Also part of NYU Langone Health is the Laura and Isaac Perlmutter Cancer Center, a National Cancer Institute designated comprehensive cancer center, and NYU Grossman School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. For more information, go to nyulangone.org, and interact with us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Indeed, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Instagram.

Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Epic Cupid Analyst.


In this role, the successful candidate is responsible for in-depth knowledge of assigned Epic System software. He/she conducts regular day-to-day communication, reviews the software, demonstrates a deeper understanding of business operations, and works with Epic, the Project Team(s), NYULMC Business Representatives/Subject Matter Experts, and end users to tailor the system to fit the organization's needs. The Epic Cupid Analyst routinely performs in-depth analysis of workflows, data collection, report details, and other technical issues associated with the use of Epic software; is responsible for developing and documenting the internal procedures that will be used in conjunction with Epic applications; and will design, build, test, install and maintain those solutions. The Epic Cupid Analyst is expected to use critical thinking skills and work independently to provide system solutions to meet business needs.
Job Responsibilities:
Participate in disaster recovery measures.
Works with the Application Manager/Director in the assessment of projects for scoping and timelines.
Actively participate and contribute in meetings. The Senior Systems Analyst 1 is capable of leading and facilitating meetings.
Ensures all quality assurance processes are followed, including change management and testing efforts.
Provide assigned on-site support during go-lives and system upgrades.
Understands interface requirements and considerations to ensure appropriate testing is done to validate workflow from end to end.
Analyze new functionality in new releases to identify impact.
Communicate effectively across all impacted teams associated with task assignments.
Support the training team by keeping trainers abreast of new functionality and system changes.
Analyze data conversion needs.
Ensure the test scripts have been created, reviewed, and updated to reflect proposed workflow solutions.
Make recommendations, review and test changes, enhancements, and each new release as assigned.
Troubleshoot problems and address questions from users, and provide on-call support on a rotating basis.
Collaborate effectively with colleagues and across teams to achieve the completion of tasks.
Collaborate effectively with Epic using Sherlock or other appropriate tools.
Complete all tasks in a timely manner with accurate documentation.
Work with Application Managers/Directors/etc. and the entire Project Team, to collect, analyze and document business operations and workflow.
Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a Effective oral, written communication and follow-up skills. Strong interpersonal relationship skills. Strong desktop tool usage including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Good process design experience. Basic project management skills (ability to lead meetings, prioritize, resolve conflicts, maintain issues list, manage project plan). Self-motivated, detail-oriented , problem solver. Requires 4 years of experience and BA/BS degree. Certified in 1 or more Epic Applications. Multiple Epic implementation experiences.
Preferred Qualifications:
Healthcare experience required.
Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

description:
Description
At First Republic, we care about our people. We offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking, and private wealth management. Founded in 1985, we believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued at First Republic.

Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day.

Within the Lending Strategy, Products & Sales Department of First Republic, you will be part of a team that is integral to the Bank's mortgage origination and balance sheet management activities through its contributions to our Secondary Marketing area. We monitor the mortgage market and recommend strategy, provide the Bank's daily mortgage loan pricing, create new loan products, sell all loan assets for the Bank, manage pricing and products in multiple systems, and work collaboratively with Loan Teams and Executive Loan Committee to facilitate loan originations and successful secondary market transactions.

Responsibilities
The Analyst will work directly with the Head of Operations in the NY Region as well as the Bank Operations leadership team and NY region leaders and will be responsible for reporting, communications, analysis, and insights that enable the team to understand and effectively convey current operating performance, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement actions and changes. This colleague will create materials for both formal presentations and internal discussions related to operations. Qualified candidates will have experience in facilitation and partnering with a wide variety of cross-functional stakeholders. Key to success in this role will be the ability to analyze data, develop insights, and effectively share those insights along with recommendations for action.

What you'll do as a Business & Reporting Analyst:
Design and develop management reporting for operations and for sharing operational performance and related objectives with key stakeholdersAnalyze operational data, develop actionable insights, and frame those into prioritized actions and initiativesServe as an expert user of analysis and presentation tools, including Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioFacilitate information gathering across cross functional teams and compile into standardized and summarized reporting formatsDevelop and design routine and ad hoc analyses and related reporting in response to changing business needsParticipate in streamlining and simplifying management routines and reporting in operationsManage operations projects from inception to completionPerform other duties & responsibilities as required or assigned

Qualifications
You could be a great fit if you have:
A bachelor's degree in business, communications, analytics, or a related field3+ years of recent experience working in a business environment and in interacting with business leaders at multiple levelsProficiency in analysis and presentation tools, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio. Working knowledge of Tableau reporting is a plus.Exceptional verbal and written communication skillsStrong qualitative and quantitative analysis skills, including the ability to readily analyze data and develop key insightsProven ability to translate high level business discussions into concise, visually appealing and easily digestible communications materialsStrong eye for crafting messaging and formal presentations appropriate to all levels in an organization and to varying audiencesAbility to operate effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrixed organizationHighly developed collaboration and facilitation skills, coupled with ability to iterate ideas among teams with interdependent functions and varying perspectivesAdvanced interpersonal skills, coupled with ability to communicate clearly, concisely and with impact. Strong listening and interpretation skillsAbility to gain followership and create influence for change across a highly matrixed organizationStrong orientation to both internal and external clients, including demonstrated ability to understand and anticipate needs and apply this knowledge to operational prioritiesHighly independent and self-managed, including ability to rapidly respond to changing prioritiesResponsibilities also include the following: 1) adheringto and complying with the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, includingthose related to Anti-money laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US PATRIOT Act, etc.) 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completingrequired training, 4) identifying and reporting suspicious activity to the AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank.
Job Demands
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.
Physical Requirements

The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quicklyVision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screensHearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in personSpeech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directionsPosition involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for periods of time

Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!

positionName: Professional, Customer Care Reporting Analyst - Virtual
description:
Over 35 years strong and fueled by 1,700 smart, passionate employees across New York state and Vermont, MVP is full of opportunities to grow. We are a nationally recognized, award-winning leader for a reason. The beating heart of our company is a wide range of employees from a diverse set of backgrounds—tech people, numbers people, even people people—working together to make health insurance better. If you are ready to join a thriving, mission-driven company where you can create your own opportunities and make a positive difference—it’s time to make a healthy career move to MVP!
This role is a virtual position.
This position is responsible for reporting and data analytics support for Customer Care & Support Services, including the Customer Care Centers and Member Advocacy & Appeals. The candidate will support ongoing business activities and process improvement efforts through data collection and analysis, report development, and metric identification and tracking, all performed with a strong focus on member experience and MVP’s core values – be the difference for the customer, be curious, and be humble. A key part of this role is leading the evolution of reporting from legacy technologies to supported MVP systems and new technologies.

Position duties and responsibilities include:Coordinates, designs, and develops routine and ad-hoc reporting and data extracts for Customer Care & Support Services using latest technology and MVP toolsAnalyzes data to identify trends and variances and presents findings and related recommendations to leadership
Prepares regulatory reports and filings as well as performance reporting (e.g., departmental service levels and key performance indicators) accurately and timelyElicits and documents user reporting and data requirements
Prepares presentations in support of multiple ongoing and ad-hoc committees, projects, quality improvement activities, and auditsServes as a resource to internal and external customers regarding departmental dataPerforms other duties as assigned
The candidate must be extremely detail-oriented, have the ability to handle multiple tasks and work items simultaneously, and be able to prioritize work to most effectively meet needs as the business evolves.

This position can be worked onsite or as a hybrid position - a combination of working remotely (virtually) from within New York with the ability to work from one of our New York office locations with some regularity (1-2 days per week). Location near one of MVPs New York office locations is strongly preferred (Schenectady, Rochester, Tarrytown).

Position Qualifications
Minimum Education:
AS in business administration, computer science, information systems, business management or equivalent level of experience.

Required Skills:Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively with superior attention to detail and time management skillsStrong technical skills including MS Suite (e.g., Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint)Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret, evaluate and act on data and problem solve independentlyIntermediate data processing skills for use in data warehouse applications, including ability to identify appropriate data fields and write queries to obtain accurate informationProven ability to pull, analyze, report, and provide insight on large sets of dataExceptional organizational and strong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to maintain confidentiality and adhere to regulatory compliance issues as they exist and change from time to timeAbility to sit at a workstation for long periods of time in front of a computerAble to tolerate stress in a fast-paced environment
Desirable Experience:Health insurance experience preferredExperience working within Agile Scrum methodology beneficialIntermediate level experience with writing SQL commandsCertifications in SQL, Access, and/or ExcelExperience using data analysis and visualization tools such as Power BI or TableauExperience with Microsoft Dynamics 365Experience with Genesys PureCloud

MVP Health Care is a nationally recognized, not-for-profit health insurer caring for more than 700,000 members in New York and Vermont. positionName: Senior Data Analyst - Financial Services Group
company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems. It is a challenge that demands the skills of a financial service professional and the intelligence of an academic—all combined with a passion for public service.


This position will offer workplace flexibility e.g. working remotely or on site as needed/ desired during the week. Employees can expect to be in the office weekly as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance. The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person a couple days a week.
What We Do:
The Wholesale Product Office (WPO) within the Financial Services Group manages the Fedwire Funds Service, the Fedwire Securities Service, and the National Settlement Service on behalf of the Federal Reserve System. Collectively, these services clear and settle financial transactions exceeding $4 trillion per day and are a foundational underpinning of the United States financial system. Thousands of banks, credit unions, other depository institutions, and a variety of U.S. government entities are direct users of the WPO’s services and critically depend on them to safely and efficiently conduct their operations and serve their customers. The WPO is committed to leading projects that promote strategies to improve the safety, speed, and efficiency of the payment systems in the United States. The team is looking for a data analyst to support a variety of business initiatives related to the Fedwire Funds Service and the National Settlement Service, with primary responsibility for analytics, data modeling, and tracking trends across products.
Your role as a Senior Data Analyst:
Support businesses by downloading and assembling data sets; building Tableau dashboards applying modern business intelligence tools, preparing charts, tables and presentations;
Use statistical, econometric, and other software packages to perform analyses, model estimation and simulations; and summarize findings,
Analyze volume, value, market, and industry trends and other data;
Provide data analytics to enhance and create new models to help discuss pricing strategies for the Fedwire Funds Service and the National Settlement Service to ensure full cost recovery while maintaining price competitiveness;
Use data analytics to draw conclusions and build expertise about the Fedwire Funds Service and the National Settlement Service businesses;
Participate in or lead workgroups and meetings on pricing or other data projects and provide support to industry meetings;
Provide concise written communications to explain data analysis methodologies and conclusions to update colleagues, senior management, and industry groups;
What we are looking for:
Approximately five to seven years of related experience working with and analyzing complex data sets to draw conclusions and working on projects to improve a product or service;
Bachelor degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, r related field;
Experience with the use of data visualization software (e.g.Tableau);
Experience in using complex databases and statistical packages (e.g. Stata, Matlab, SAS, R, Gauss, TSP, RATS, PROCSQL), or other computer programming experience (Python, Java, C++, Mathematica, etc.);
Experience business and data analysis and an ability to analyze large amounts of information and data to draw conclusions; create management summaries, and present to executive audiences
Capabilities in the areas of enhancing data analysis that deepens the understanding of business drivers, trends, and market developments.
Benefits:
Our organization offers benefits that are the best fit for you at every stage of your career:
Fully paid Pension plan and 401k with Generous Match
Comprehensive Insurance Plans (Medical, Dental and Vision including Flexible Spending Accounts and HSA)
Subsidized Public Transportation Program
Tuition Assistance Program
Onsite Fitness & Wellness Center
And more which you can find here
The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is committed to a diverse workforce and to providing equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, or military service.
Candidates must undergo an enhanced background check and will be tested for all controlled substances prohibited by federal law, to include marijuana.
Incumbent must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless the Bank grants an exemption based on a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief.

While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change.

Full time

Regular

Yes

Analytical

First (United States of America)

Overview
Ketchum is looking for a Data, Analytics & Research Consultant!
Ketchum has the largest research and analytics team in the industry, fluent in the various streams of communications measurement. From traditional media analysis, social analytics, running surveys, SEO, to predictive and digital analytics, we are meeting the needs of clients focused on big data. Ketchum is set apart by our ability to understand that it’s not about being data-rich, but instead being data-smart.

About the Job
This position will provide strategic, analytical and intellectually curious analytics managers the opportunity to learn and manage all aspects of data, analytics and research for the public relations and communications industry. The position reports to the local DC leadership and supports junior staff in managing projects from inception to the presentation of results. You’ll work closely with account teams across the globe, and clients across many different industries such as Food, Tech, Health, Wellness, Home, Retail and Travel to provide guidance in the creation of data-driven strategies and tactics.
Your day-to-day:
Analyzing full communications programming in channels such as paid media, social, media coverage, influencer, website, and consumer conversations to direct and evaluate marketing and communication programs
Support multiple primary research projects (quantitative and qualitative) and secondary research with support from senior staff and junior staff
Support all phases of complex and varied market research projects from scoping, budgeting, to staffing, review and client presentation
Support the development of research and measurement proposals for various projects such as audience research, media measurement, website auditing, competitive analysis, conversation analysis, survey research, social influencer measurement, or ROI analysis
Analyze multi-channel data sets such as Twitter analytics, Facebook analytics and LinkedIn analytics to draw conclusions that help improve content strategy
Tracking a customer or stakeholder journey from awareness to conversion through data
Mapping and measuring a client’s reputational journey
The value you bring:
Providing strategic consumer and business insights – not “data dumps” – to communications account teams and new business teams
Developing deep relationships with client and account teams
Understanding clients’ objectives and ensure research and insights deliverables meet those needs
Flex your creativity working with large data sets to pull out the underlying stories and narrative to provide thoughtful insights into challenging communications questions.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in related field; Master’s degree helpful or evidence of certifications/courses in the data analytics fields
Minimum of 1-2 years of related data, analytics and research experience; media measurement experience helpful
A team mentality and desire to collaborate with co-workers across multiple geographies
Ability to work with minimal supervision and guidance, able to multi-task, prioritize, meet deadlines and keep manager updated on progress
Excellent project management skills and experience managing others
Varied experience designing and conducting primary and secondary research projects and interest in learning new research tools and methods
Interest or expertise in the following a plus:
Website analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Social media measurement and social media monitoring tools, such as Brandwatch, Sysomos, Talkwalker, etc.
Search engine optimization or search engine marketing
Link building/tracking such as UTMs
Data visualization such as Tableau or Google Data Studio
Understanding website tagging or pixel tracking
Writing and building questionnaires for publicity or research purposes
Advanced excel skills such as pivot tables, vlookups or formulas
Secondary databases, such as YouGov, Resonate, Canvas8, comScore, Quid
Social media analytics - such as Facebook Business Manager and Twitter Analytics
Influencer Identification tools such as Onalytica, Tagger, TapInfluence or Traackr
HTML, Java, R, Python, SQL or similar language coding
Python, SPSS, Stata, SAS, R or similar statistical package capabilities
About Ketchum
As a global communications consultancy with 90 plus years of experience, Ketchum is a trusted partner who is equal parts creative and analytical. Ketchum is a place where all perspectives and points of view are welcome and encouraged. We are a collection of communications specialists, content creators, creatives, researchers, data analysts, media pros, digital strategists, issues and crisis counselors, and tech nerds. And we love when those worlds collide to create the very best teams and solutions for our clients. We work with the world’s leading brands, emerging start-ups, and everything in between. We are beyond proud to have created some of the most celebrated and award-winning campaigns in our industry. We’re just crazy enough to think we can impact the world – and how it responds to ideas – through communication.
We encourage our employees to be curious, brave, inspiring, and a force for good. Let’s talk. Come belong at Ketchum!
What we offer
Robust benefits program
Generous time off policies
Retirement program with company match
Workplace flexibility
Business casual dress code
Workplace and off-site social gatherings
Yoga @ work
Professional learning and development opportunities
Tuition reimbursement
Paid maternity/paternity leave
Transit benefits
Interested? We’ve got an opportunity for you.

The Child Mind Institute is seeking a postdoctoral level Neuroimaging Data Analyst to support large-scale, multimodal brain imaging data resource generation initiatives, including the Child Mind Institute Healthy Brain Network (HBN) and NKI-Rockland Sample II (NKI-RS II) initiatives. The Healthy Brain Network is an ongoing research initiative aimed at collecting imaging, genetic, and phenotypic data from 10,000 children and adolescents throughout NYC. The NKI-RS II is the next-generation initiative focused on the collection of high-dimensional, multimodal data from 600 individuals across the lifespan (ages 9-75). The Neuroimaging Data Analyst will be integral in reviewing, analyzing, and reporting on incoming imaging data to ensure data quality. This includes, but is not limited to, MRI, EEG, eye-tracking data, and actigraphy. The Imaging Data Analyst will support the development and maintenance of data organization, quality assessment, preprocessing and analysis protocols as part of a collaborative team. The Neuroimaging Data Analyst will also help to manage junior analysts and assistants in their efforts.
Reporting to the Vice President of Research, this is an exempt, full-time position based in Midtown Manhattan.
The Child Mind Institute is proud to be named a Great Place to Work-Certified company! Our competitive compensation and benefits include medical insurance, 401(k) with match, flexible work schedules, paid parental leave, dependent care and discounted tickets and entertainment perks program.
Responsibilities:
Perform weekly neuroimaging data quality reports
Check incoming imaging data for completeness and accuracy
Queries databases to create reports and determine accuracy of the data entered
Manages and improves neuroimaging pipelines
Assist with basic and advanced statistical analysis of imaging data
Organize and process incoming data from several neuroimaging sites
Assists in preparing data to be shared with research collaborators
Assist with data analysis for research projects and publications
Qualifications:
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Information Systems, Neuroscience, Psychology, Statistics, Engineering, or other related scientific fields.
Substantial programming experience (examples include: Python, R, Bash Script, SQL, Matlab)
Experience in Linux environment and virtual containers, and cloud computing
Extensive experience with MRI and/or EEG
Strong focus on data quality assessment and reporting
Application of advanced data exploration techniques
Good understanding of information technology-oriented methods and approaches
Strong interpersonal skills, as well as strong written and oral communication
Ability to work in a fast-paced and multidisciplinary environment
Ability to work as a member of a team as well as independently
Passion for the CMI mission
Please upload your resume and cover letter during the application process. Only applications with a cover letter will be considered.
