Posted
20-Sep-2021
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Digital & Technology / Information Technology
Location(s)
Airmont - New York - United States of America, Atlanta - Georgia - United States of America, Chicago - Illinois - United States of America, Dallas - Texas - United States of America, New York City - New York - United States of America, North Chicago - Illinois - United States of America, Richardson - Texas - United States of America, San Francisco - California - United States of America
RESPONSIBILITIES


Responsible for ensuring the business makes better decisions through collection and usage of data. Ensures business data and analysis requirements are met by properly applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting. Ability to collect, analyze, manipulate, and report on CBRE data.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Performs ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, reflecting global real estate markets and the operations of real estate assets.


Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and addresses reporting needs.


Defines data requirements and gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.


Utilizes programming and analytical tools, including open source programs including Python, R and SAS, SQL, Oracle, or similar relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights. Well versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.


Identifies and troubleshoots data integration and integrity issues in cooperation with the appropriate CBRE business units; Designs work flows and procedures.


Identifies opportunities to maximize data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.


Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, utilizing a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau).


Exhibits analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to present a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple levels of the organization.


Other Duties as Assigned


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES


No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.

QUALIFICATIONS


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE


Bachelor's degree from top tier school in computer science, math, engineering or related field with a minimum of 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, and SQL, SAS and/or SPSS including 2-3 years technical experience in software development, machine learning or statistical analysis, data engineering and data visualization related work.
Tableau reporting exp a must

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES


None


COMMUNICATION SKILLS


Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.


FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE


Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.


REASONING ABILITY


Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.


OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES


Experience with Microsoft BI stack (e.g., SSRS) a bonus.


Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.


Strong analytical skills.


SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY


Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

CBRE is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
NOTE: An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.

positionName: Digital Product Analyst, Product Analytics & Growth
description:
Position Summary:
The NBA's Digital Direct to Consumer team's mission is to bring the world courtside by providing the NBA experience for everyone, everywhere. The group creates and manages digital products that extend the league's global reach, from mobile applications to virtual reality experiences. Globally, the group also delivers live games and exclusive content through NBA League Pass directly to fans on web, mobile and connected devices, and develops strategies for distributing content with our global regional offices and partners. In this role, you will help drive the next phase of growth for the NBA's digital product portfolio. Your focus will be on enabling better data-driven decision-making through analytics for the group of product and strategy teams focused on increasing engagement, retention and revenue across our web and mobile properties. You will work directly with product managers to identify KPIs for launches and help build measurement strategies to properly collect data with solution architects and front-end engineers. You will also analyze product performance based on established KPIs, conduct funnel and user pathing analysis to understand user behavior, and build dashboards and reports to help product owners and other stakeholders monitor changes. Additionally, you will convey insights in actionable ways that can influence strategic decision-making and prioritization for our management team. In joining this team, you will help to contribute to continuous learning, insightful analysis and experimentation with an unrelenting fan focus.
Major Responsibility:
Contribute data-driven strategies to drive the growth of NBA users and subscribers through innovative product features, content initiatives, and marketing/communication efforts
Conduct analysis of product performance to draw insights that drive critical decision-making and to uncover user/subscriber patterns of engagement
Design, build and maintain visual dashboards to track key initiatives and enable self-service data discovery and help communicate findings across the company
Provide strategic recommendations to product managers, designers, business strategy, and marketing leads based on analysis of our products
Help to lead measurement and data collection efforts across our digital products, which may include working with external partners to resolve questions, inconsistencies, and/or obtain missing data
Required Skills/Knowledge:
2+ years of experience in an analytical role focused on digital experiences (mobile, web, video, commerce/subscription)
Demonstrated ability to conduct data analysis, deliver actionable insights, and work directly with stakeholders to implement and measure recommended actions
Working knowledge of SQL and/or Python or R
Practical expertise with leading product/marketing analysis software tools (preferably Adobe Analytics) and a willingness and ability to combine internal and external methods to gather and analyze data
Strong working knowledge of best in class data visualization tools like Tableau or Microsoft Power BI Understanding of digital data architecture and workflows
Experience working with subscription products preferred Technology-savvy with an understanding of evolving media and content landscape and trends
Excellent presentation and written communication skills
Knowledge of basketball and a passion for the NBA and sports is helpful and welcome
Education:
Bachelor's Degree

Company Description:

Quartet is a platform that makes it easier for people to get the best mental health care for them. Our technology and services reach people who need care, connect them to the right care, track the quality of their care, and support their care journeys. Backed by $160.5MM in venture funding from top investors like Oak HC/FT, GV (formerly Google Ventures), F-Prime Capital Partners, Polaris Partners, Deerfield Management, Centene Corporation, and Echo Health Ventures, Quartet partners with health insurance plans and health systems in 32 states across the country to help people get the care they need.

We are deeply committed to growing a diverse team and an equitable and inclusive culture where all Quartetians are empowered to be themselves and do their best work. We know this is vital in realizing our mission to improve the lives of people with mental health conditions. As part of our commitment to building a diverse team, we have signed the Parity Pledge and actively encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply.

About the team & Opportunity:

Quartet is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to specialize in reporting to build out customer facing reports and scale our analytics function. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of healthcare data, and robust experience in presenting it to industry stakeholders effectively.

The Senior Data Analyst will have ownership of Quartet's customer reporting from end to end. This includes working with internal and external stakeholders to define requirements and shaping abstract requirements into valuable, coherent data products. You will utilize SQL and our BI tool, Looker, to provide quality assurance and analysis including independent analysis work. You will be responsible for digging into the data to drive insights and continuous improvement in our reporting products and presenting these reports back to the customer as well as to Quartet's senior leadership.

This position requires outstanding analytic, communication, and data product design skills, the ability to collaborate with a wide variety of colleagues, as the Senior Data Analyst will be working cross-functionally with Quartet teams such as Product, Data Engineering, Data Science, and Customer Success.

The Senior Data Analyst will work alongside other Analysts and Analytics Engineers and Data Analysts, and report to the Manager of Business Intelligence.

Accountabilities:

Designing and building new, high quality reports for customers
Improve data quality of reporting though tests, refactoring, and reviews
Create documentation for technical and not technical teams on reporting definitions and how to use the reports
Present reports and analytics to customers and internal stakeholders, and improve upon it by collecting feedback from multiple stakeholders

Minimum Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in SQL (preferably in a daily capacity)
3+ years generating customer-facing reports (specifically, using Looker)
Experience with data visualization tools (preferably Looker)
Experience with healthcare data (preferably working with Health Insurance Plans)
Experience working with customers to understand business problems and map abstract problems to data that can be used to solve them

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with dbt
Experience in R or Python
Experience with medical and pharmacy claims data
Experience with healthcare quality measurement, especially HEDIS measures
Experience with value-based care programs
Experience with AWS, particularly Redshift

Employee Benefits for Quartet include:

Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, catered lunches, snacks, team events and outings, full medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental leave, commuter benefits, 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements for mental healthcare, 401K, ESPP, gym benefits.

Quartet is committed to building a diverse team and fostering an inclusive culture, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in race, religion, color, national origin, gender, family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, medical conditions, and other characteristics. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Quartet does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Quartet will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Quartet.

Not ready to apply, but have someone to refer? Talent@quartethealth.com to submit their details to us.

Want to know what Quartet life is like? Click here to meet our team.

Job Title

Business Analyst - Virtual

Job Description Summary

The Business Analyst is responsible for providing business process and system analysis, as well as scope definition for the Cushman & Wakefield Deal Management initiatives. Responsibilities include helping ensure the project team can efficiently deliver solutions to our internal clients that meet or exceed expectations.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities:
The Business Analyst will have the primary responsibility of helping to define and ensure that the Deal Management solutions support the stated objectives as defined in the program. As such, this individual will collaborate closely with the project team, respective stakeholders, and business subject matter experts to understand current business processes and translate new requirements into actionable solutions to achieve defined business unit business objectives, KPIs/success metrics.

The successful candidate will be collaborating with the business, program teams, and build team to define innovative technology solutions & process improvements to support business objectives, by clearly documenting business requirements, user stories, and/or use cases on paper and proof-of-concept configuration. A key focus of this role will be the deployment of new tools and processes into the business, and has such should be experienced in communicating with users to understand needs and convey requirements, constraints, benefits, etc. Specific responsibilities will include:

Work with the technology and operations teams to understand project objectives, priorities, timelines
Work with service lines and end-users to understand their business and champion solutions to meet their needs
Escalate risks, issues and roadblocks to the project team
Clearly document business and functional requirements
Define ‘as-is’ state for complex enterprise solutions, model ‘to be’ state, identify and assess gaps and propose improvements
Work with the business requesters to develop change, training and adoption strategies and tactics
Direct and participate in the creation of content (training materials, user communications, etc.)
Support internal reporting needs from the platform, and help identify data anomalies and deficiencies
Partner closely with program leadership to create executive briefings on key topics
Responsible for system control documentation.

Qualifications:
In light of the important role the Business Analyst will play at Cushman & Wakefield, we seek an outstanding talent who will bring strong analytical, communication and leadership experience along with the personal qualities well suited for the challenge. Specifically, the successful candidate should possess:

Functional Skills

Good technical or business foundation to include an undergraduate degree in a Business, Information Systems or a related field.
Critical thinker/problem solver with logical thought process
Strong communication skills, including presentation development and delivery
Strong cross-team collaboration skills
Strong attention to detail
Stakeholder communication and expectation management

Business Experience

The successful candidate must be comfortable juggling multiple assignments and possess the agility and tenacity to collaborate and deliver on tight timelines with aggressive growth objectives.
Past experience working in a customer-centric company is strongly preferred. With a commitment to putting the customer first and providing world-class solutions, the successful candidate would benefit from having exposure to a similar culture and business model.
10 years’ experience implementing and deploying outstanding end to end solutions, with strong bias to Salesforce Cloud

Personal Characteristics

Given the pace of change at the company, the successful candidate must be comfortable in a dynamic and fast-paced culture.
A strong service and delivery mentality is required. Candidate must actively seek to understand internal and external customers’ needs, perceptions, and show a “can do” attitude to make IT an enabling partner.
The successful candidate must have strong business acumen and intellectual curiosity. A passion for truly understanding the business and keeping it simple will be required to effectively integrate into the culture. An ability to translate client needs into the IT roadmap and strategy is critical.
Good collaboration skills are important. The successful candidate must be able to offer new ideas and help build support for making significant changes. Fostering an environment for open exchange, asking good questions, and listening to gain input and insight is expected.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are integral for success. Candidate must be a clear and concise communicator and must effectively communicate at Managerial levels and cross-functionally.
Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

At the NBA, we’re passionate about growing and celebrating the game of basketball. Through the intensity of the game and the amazing athletic skill of our players, we deliver excitement to hundreds of millions of fans around the world.
As a global sports and media business, the NBA is so much more. While Basketball Operations runs the league’s on-court activities, other departments manage relationships with television and digital media partners, develop marketing partnerships with some of the world’s most recognizable companies, oversee the licensing of NBA merchandise, and handle a wide range of responsibilities that drive the NBA’s success.
The NBA is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace. To safeguard our employees and their families, our visitors, and the broader community from COVID-19, and in consideration of recommendations from health authorities and the NBA’s own advisors, any individual working onsite in our New York and New Jersey offices must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. The NBA will discuss accommodations for individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to a medical reason or sincerely held religious belief, practice, or observance.
Position Summary
The Team Marketing & Business Operations (TMBO) Department is a unique in-house consulting group within the NBA league office that strives to drive best practices and innovation across all 94 NBA, WNBA, NBA G League, and NBA2K teams. The primary focus for this fast-paced and collaborative department is on all aspects of business operations. TMBO seeks dynamic, intellectually curious, and organized leaders who believe and live TMBO’s core values: Add Value, Build Trusted Relationships, and Root for Each Other.
The Business Analyst, Ticketing & Game Experience will work directly with team and league resources, owning projects and supporting initiatives across the Ticketing & Game Experience areas of business:
Ticket Sales: Sales and growth of all ticket types – full, partial, individual, flex, and groups.Membership: Retention, servicing and growth of full and partial season members.Premium: Sales strategy, service, and activation of suite holders, club members, and other premium-priced clients.Game Experience: Gameday experience for all arena guests.
The Business Analyst will work across all areas of the Ticketing and Game Experience vertical; however, will also have a focus on growing team ticket sales through the creating and sharing of best practices, identifying and understanding vendors and technology to support sales, gathering data and information to support ticketing strategy development, and developing and sharing training content with TMBO and teams. To be successful in this role, candidates need a strong understanding of team ticket sales, the ticketing industry, and the process today, as well as a passion for innovating ticketing – looking at how teams, the league, and the sports industry can become better.
Major Responsibilities:
Own projects supporting all verticals within the Ticketing & Game Experience group, including project planning, timeline management, and quality execution.
Evaluate vendors and help formulate Ticketing Technology / Sales Enablement tool strategy more broadly.
Support development of in-market and virtual training modules and materials by working with ticketing leads at TMBO and the team to create professional, engaging slides and materials.
Help drive business by identifying potential innovations in process, product, and technology and investigate the process for implementation with teams, facilitating pilots when necessary.
Act as group leader for the strategy for and communication with team Ticket Operations groups, including associated projects and planning.
Develop and manage processes for gathering real-time information from teams for ad hoc requests.
Liaise with TMBO strategy & analytics on the development, refining, and execution of tools and reports that support key vertical areas, and actively promote their use with teams.
Use analytical skills to identify areas of opportunity in the Ticketing and Game Experience business areas, research causes, and create recommendations on potential solutions.
Lead monthly calls for various areas as required including developing agenda, presenting content, and facilitating the conversation.
Proactively engage teams on a regular basis to best understand needs and provide appropriate best practices, and efficiently respond to questions and requests from teams, making referrals when necessary to the appropriate department for assistance.
Focus on identifying best practices across the NBA, WNBA, and NBA G League:
Proactively collect best practice information and develop slides, toolkits, case studies, and white papers, that are polished and professional in appearance and content
Share content with TMBO and team content leaders
Develop and manage a process of identifying relevant outside industry ideas to integrate into team best practices
Update past white papers, case studies, and key tracking documents, ensuring that TMBO always house the most current information
Support league workshops through assistance with presentation development, as well as developing and delivering presentations at select workshops and roundtables.
3+ years related team ticket sales, revenue-generating experience
Prior experience working with a ticketing system (e.g. Ticketmaster/Archtics)
A successful track record of developing and maintaining strong working relationships with both internal and external clients
Proven experience handling multiple projects and tasks and exercising flexibility as needed, while displaying strong time management and organization skills
Written and verbal communication within multiple levels of an organization
Creating compelling PowerPoint presentations that create a story and strong writing and PowerPoint skills to produce content and documents that are clear and concise
Required Skills/Knowledge
Ability to communicate effectively and confidently with senior team executives
Understanding of back-end ticket operations and system complexities and limitations
A creative, adaptive personality that can interface with multiple levels across various organizations
Desire to work in a fast-paced, high-energy, dynamic, and challenging environment
Ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines, good time management and organization skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Ability to see the “big picture” and think innovatively when developing solutions
Analytical skills
Strong presentation skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong sense of urgency
Attention to detail is a must
Strong work ethic, self-starter
Strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills
Ability to travel approximately 10% of the time
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred or relevant experience
We Consider Applicants For All Positions On The Basis Of Merit, Qualifications And Business Needs, And Without Regard To Race, Color, National Origin, Religion, Sex, Gender Identity, Age, Disability, Alienage Or Citizenship Status, Ancestry, Marital Status, Creed, Genetic Predisposition Or Carrier Status, Sexual Orientation, Veteran Status, Familial Status, Status As A Victim Of Domestic Violence Or Any Other Status Or Characteristic Protected By Applicable Federal, State, Or Local Law.

Please Note: AdhereTech requires that all employees provide either proof of vaccination for COVID-19 or evidence of a valid medical or religious exemption.

AdhereTech is seeking a Business Analyst to act as the analytical engine of the company to provide insights into business performance and empower senior management to make sound decisions. The Business Analyst will play an integral role in providing timely business intelligence via real-time dashboards and ad-hoc analyses, working cross-functionally to identify relevant KPIs, define reporting requirements, and drive performance improvements. This position will be a multi-faceted role, cutting across all areas of the business, including finance, sales, support, and logistics.

The ideal candidate will be an extremely analytical self-starter with a strategic mindset and solid business acumen. The right individual will be resourceful, with the ability to tackle multiple projects and efficiently execute deliverables. Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial, as well as ability to effectively problem-solve and prioritize. The Business Analyst will be a cross-functional role reporting up to Finance.

Responsibilities

Assist with financial forecasting and scenario planning
Support annual budget process and associated reporting, including investigating key drivers of variances
Work with department heads and senior management to identify KPIs for ongoing monitoring, and develop and maintain dashboards to provide real-time visibility
Analyze current and past trends in key business metrics to support and influence strategic, product, and operational decisions
Serve as the analytical resource across the organization for reporting and dashboard needs, as well as ad-hoc analyses
Liaise with the Data and Product teams to define requirements to support the reporting framework and ensure data integrity
Support Sales and Client Relations teams on developing program forecasts, as well as external-facing dashboards for customers and partners, as needed
Provide finance and accounting support, including assisting with the month-end close, day-to-day finance needs (A/R, A/P, cash forecasting), board reporting, etc.
Maintain inventory forecast and planning process to inform near- and medium-term production decisions

Required Experience and Skills

2-5 years in a similar analytical role, FP&A, consulting or banking; healthcare experience a plus
Bachelor's degree required
Experience with analytical modeling and/or financial forecasting
Experience designing reports, tracking against metrics, and using/creating dashboards for reporting to senior management
Experience using database querying tools, writing queries and joining data using SQL, as well as business intelligence tools such as Tableau
Advanced Excel modeling skills and SQL proficiency
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills
Ability to think creatively, highly-driven and self-motivated
Highest standards of accuracy and precision, and highly organized
Demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and work with team members
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong ability to distill key insights and communicate clearly & succinctly

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our team at CEX.IO.
We are considered an OG exchange as we were one of the first platforms to allow you to purchase crypto with a credit card. With over 4 million registered users globally, we have a variety of products for beginners who want access to crypto to more professional traders. We are a regulated cryptocurrency exchange that’s operational globally and in 48 states across the US.

Most of our team is remote and consists of folks with amazing skills including professional athletes, chefs, world travellers, and much more. We pride ourselves on our diversity, our team player mantra, and for changing the lives of millions of people by being their first entry point into crypto!
Responsibilities:

You’ll be assisting our Analytics Lead on setting up product events across our Customer Data Platform, Product Analytics tool, and Email Marketing Platform.
Assist our analytics lead on creating funnels and performing cohort analysis on various products.
Synthesizing data into easy to understand visualizations to be able to make quick decisions.
Perform ad hoc reporting for marketing + product teams across Google Analytics, our BI tools, internal databases, our product analytics tools, etc.
You’ll also be responsible to setup + collect data from our data warehouse (on the front + back-end) and send that over to our CDP and other tools.
Work on reporting automation.
Requirements:

Experience working with a Customer Data Platform (i.e. segment, freshpaint, rudderstack, etc).
Experience working with product analytics tools (having mixpanel or amplitude is a major plus).
Experience working with marketing attribution tools (appsflyer, adjust, etc) is a major plus.
Experience with advanced analytics and statistical software languages (R or Python).
Strong knowledge of SQL (PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, BigQuery)
Significant experience building & maintaining dashboards with modern BI tools. Having experience with Apache Superset and Google Data Studio is critical
Must have closely collaborated with Product Managers on data analysis and reporting.
Strong familiarity with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
Must have experience with AWS or Digital Ocean.
Other important skills include HTML, JV, and RegExp.
Having experience with Jira or other project management tools is essential.
Nice to haves:

Having experience in crypto or FinTech is a major plus (not a hard requirement)
Being able to speak Russian is also major plus (not a hard requirement)

Description:

Student Leadership Network (SL Network) supports three life-changing programs that empower students to disrupt the cycle of poverty through education: The Young Women’s Leadership Schools (TYWLS), a network of high-performing all-girls public secondary schools; CollegeBound Initiative (CBI), a school-based college access program for young women and men; and the Young Women’s Leadership Network (YWLN), a nationwide network of single-sex affiliate and partner schools. SL Network programs promote a college-going culture in schools and make the dream of college a reality for students from underserved communities. To learn more, visit www.studentleadershipnetwork.org.
The Research and Evaluation team is tasked with evolving the organization’s data management, reporting, and evaluation practices for its current student population as well as the nearly 13,000 alumni in college across the country. Student Leadership Network is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to join the research and evaluation team primarily to support, improve, and expand our current use of Salesforce and to assist with analytics and reporting capacity within SL Network more generally, The Data Analyst will be responsible for handling day-to-day CRM administration and configuration, training users on current and future features, and supporting the Director of Research and Evaluation in leading the product management. The Analyst will also help to problem-solve, identify trends, report outcomes, and inform decisions related to the overall work of the team and the organization. This work requires strong independent project management, attention to detail, and adherence to deadlines. Individuals applying should have demonstrated passion and experiences driven by data, data systems, analytics, and actionable insight. The Data Analyst will report directly to the Director of Research and Evaluation.
. Requirements:

Primary Roles and Responsibilities: Salesforce Administration and General Administration
Proactively monitor data for completeness and accuracy and communicate with impacted stakeholders when issues are identified. Manage efforts to assure data validity, hygiene, currency, retention, and the maintenance of data dictionaries.
Manage the configuration and use of data within the platform by managing fields, permissions, security, workflows, profiles, and interfaces. Responsibilities will include creating fields, objects, validation rules, page layouts, workflow processes, and more to address and improve new and existing organizational needs.
Set up, configure, maintain, and distribute standard and customized features of the Salesforce platform to support the organization’s various programs, initiatives, and departments in their search for insight and impact. Salesforce features may include but not be limited to objects, reports, dashboards, etc.
Perform data cleanup and migration when required.
Stay current of Salesforce releases. Integrate and update the organization’s instance as necessary. Apply Salesforce and industry-standard best practices to the Salesforce platform.
Development and Expansion
Assist with scoping and planning of various CRM-related projects and initiatives.
Support the Director of Research and Evaluation in product management by helping to understand needs, tasks, goals, and challenges across the organization, documenting use cases and requirements, and suggesting/implementing improvements or articulating these to consultants.
Support the product development process and roadmap for Salesforce across the organization to deliver updates and enhancements.
Incorporate new integrations and optimize efficiency and performance of existing integrations and processes.
Support and Training
Coordinate day-to-day ticket management, troubleshooting and support for users in collaboration with the IT Support & Data Systems Associate .
Ensure clear and effective business processes and relationships with teams across the organization, proactively monitoring and supporting user adoption.
In collaboration with the IT Support & Data Systems Associate develop and deliver training and materials relevant to supporting and enhancing user experience in Salesforce.
Data Analysis & Reporting
Compile, clean, and audit data from internal and external sources.
Build and maintain data integration, where possible using automated ETL (extract, transform, load) processes or scripts in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Create, edit, and maintain organization-wide reports, as well as reports for external audiences, such as schools and other partners.
Research and gather key datasets, metrics, and benchmarks (e.g. city, region, and nation) in the areas of postsecondary outcomes, college access and success, single sex education, and other relevant topics.
Support funder reporting needs and deadlines with the Development team.
Support internal analysis employing both statistical and data science methods, as well as the creation of data products for external use.
Other related duties as assigned.
Key Qualifications:
Must be willing to share COVID 19 Vaccination status
At least 2 years of experience in the Salesforce.com platform as admin or power user. Back-end Salesforce development experience (e.g. Apex coding and admin experience) as well as familiarity with the NonProfit Success Pack (NPSP) highly preferred.
Experience in manipulating large data sets for analysis and interpretation.
Microsoft Office proficiency with Intermediate to Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel.
Intermediate familiarity with Python, R, and/or SQL for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization preferred.
Experience with data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau and Google Data Studio preferred).
Familiarity with common educational datasets and data systems preferred (e.g National Student Clearinghouse).
Tech savvy and eager to stay up to date on new applications and best practices in the use of Salesforce and other technologies. Be a hybrid techy! Love people and systems and know how to navigate and optimize both!
Detail-oriented, with the ability to prioritize and independently manage multiple tasks under short and changing deadlines, while ensuring timely and accurate execution. Project management experience is a plus.
Ability to exercise discretion and judgment with the handling of highly sensitive and confidential information.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop productive working relationships with multiple stakeholders across the organization
Passion for and a demonstrated commitment to educational access and equity for traditionally marginalized students.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on the ability to present data in a clear, concise, and accessible manner.
Master’s degree preferred.
Compensation: Competitive/commensurate with experience. FLSA Status: Exempt. SL Network is an equal opportunity employer. Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid time off and 401K matching
Application instructions: Please submit cover letter and resume via url or website career page

About the role

This role supports an existing reporting workstream, whose objective is to ensure that one of our most important global portfolios has access to the right data and insights in order to inform and make important business decisions.

The role's primary responsibility is to drive solutions oriented approaches and maintain a global Google Cloud based reporting solution, which automates the collection and transformation of disparate marketing data into a single source of truth. Not only does that mean running and maintaining the solution that already exists, but also continually improving it to incorporate new data sources, and to derive new insights, to support ever-evolving business demands.

As a Q Analyst your primary responsibility will be to own the reporting process by reviewing data loaded from media platforms into a central platform for accuracy, comparing media platform reports with analytics platform reports, recommend process improvements to improve data accuracy, and review and define quality audit processes. This role is ideal for curious and autonomous individuals who love numbers, problem solving, and seeking to enter digital advertising and gain a hands-on understanding of campaign data. In doing so you will gain a foundational understanding of cloud technology and key data engineering skills and knowledge to help you build a career in this fast evolving, and in demand, industry.

Some of the things we'd like you to do:

Collect and collate weekly media delivery and performance data from media platforms and providers (paid search, biddable display, paid social, programmatic)
Conduct data analysis in a rigorous and repeatable manner and communicate data quality, gaps and timeliness effectively to both technical/non-technical team members and stakeholders
Manage report schemas that capture necessary grains across sources and deliver them to clients in a structured and timely manner
Experience working Google Analytics UTM reports and resolving discrepancies between Google Analytics and media buying platforms
Develop reports in Google Data Studio for a variety of media campaign types with custom criteria and variable report inputs
Work with team across offices to identify common issues and provide recommendations on data acquisition process to improve central data accuracy
Maintain and improve existing data analysis tools and reports

A bit about yourself:

Previous experience working with data and technology
Experience with data hygiene
Experience with programming and/or statistical languages (e.g. SQL, Python)
Proficiency with MS Excel
Strong ability to build and maintain Google Data Studio reports
Ability to work to multiple, often conflicting, deadlines
Strong organizational, problem solving, troubleshooting skills as well as attention to detail, including the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fairly autonomous way
Strong spoken and written communication skills, ensuring your thoughts and needs are heard and understood
Delivers best results when working in a team environment, and an ability to partner effectively with people of varying degrees of technical capability

positionName: Population Health Data Analyst, Bureau of Equitable Health Systems
description:
Be a change agent and join the Practice Transformation Unit at the Bureau of Equitable Health Systems (BEHS), a bureau in the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) devoted to improving health by promoting and supporting primary care with a focus on increasing the delivery of clinical preventive services through health information technology and population health management in underserved neighborhoods. The bureau works with over 1,300 health care organizations on increasing clinical prevention opportunities, reducing health disparities, managing/preventing chronic disease, and creating community linkages to support health promotion. The Population Health Data Analyst will be responsible for producing and analyzing a variety of data sources to meet bureau program evaluation goals, including clinical data derived from electronic health records, Medicaid claims data and survey data. BEHS leverages clinical data from the Hub Population Health System (â€œHubâ€), a unique, real-time query system which gathers aggregate data from EHRs at more than 700 doctor's offices, community health centers, and hospital clinics covering about 2 million patients in NYC. As part of the mixed method approach to program evaluation, the bureau also relies heavily on Medicaid claims data and primary data collected through surveys developed in-house. BEHS maintains a large data warehouse that receives multiple data streams that include summarized measures on the quality of ambulatory health care, processes in care delivery, and population health indicators.


Health professionals assess these data to respond to public health needs, and to conduct program evaluation and research. The Population Health Data Analyst is being recruited to produce and analyze public health data from a variety of sources in the area of health services utilization for the purposes of program evaluation, creating dashboards for meeting program objectives, including providing feedback to clinicians in the ambulatory care setting on patient quality of care. The Analyst will also be responsible for preparing data summaries to inform leadership at the bureau and divisional level making decisions on resource allocation, program evaluation and planning. The Analyst will work with a dynamic, cross-disciplinary team to help the bureau meet program evaluation objectives, and to prepare manuscripts for publication. The Data Analyst will be in the Evaluation, Research and Analysis team and will report to the Director of Evaluation, Research, and Analysis. In the event of a public health emergency as deemed by the agency (public health outbreak, natural disaster, etc.), employees may be mandated to assume an emergency response role. In these rare instances and when notified, staff will be re-assigned from their regular day-to-day duties as noted in this job description to take on another role considered necessary by the agency. When this occurs, all staff are required to comply with the change in assignment and must be prepared to be called upon promptly.


DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:
-Conducting program evaluation and analyses in the area of health services utilization to prepare data summaries to develop manuscripts and meet program evaluation goals.
-Collecting, cleaning, analyzing and reporting on clinical quality measures data derived from the Hub Population Health System to produce reports, presentations, papers and other tabular and graphical summaries of findings for dissemination internally and externally to support the evaluation of BEHS's programs, and to explore topics relevant to BEHS and DOH priorities, such as chronic disease prevention.
-Designing queries and analyses plans utilizing New York State Medicaid medical and prescription claims data to meet program evaluation objectives.
-Managing claims-related projects, including deadlines and creating queries based on technical specifications gathered from BEHS staff and other stakeholders in the agency to meet bureau, divisional and agency evaluation goals.
-Assisting with developing, implementing and analyzing survey data for the purposes of program evaluation and addressing research/evaluation questions posed in grant applications, and to help meet bureau, divisional and agency research and evaluation goals.
-Partnering with bureau, divisional and other DOHMH bureaus to develop joint projects that analyze Hub data, Medicaid claims or survey data to support and promote primary care among underserved populations.
-Preparing documentation required for NYS DOH validation and approval of analyses involving Medicaid claims data.
-Managing data, integrating and analyzing different data sources, and conducting diagnostics and quality assurance on multiple data sources using SAS, SQL and R.
-Developing data visualization and dashboards to assist BEHS staff in utilizing existing data to shape program interventions.
-Presenting findings within the bureau and across the agency, as necessary.
Minimum Qual Requirements

1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.

To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:

1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or

2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or

3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.


NOTE:

Probationary Period

Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.
Preferred Skills

PHD in statistics, public health or related field with at least one year working experience or Master's degree in above mentioned fields with 2 or more years of working experience
Strong analytic and statistical skills with experience in manipulating and analyzing data using SAS, R, Tableau, and SQL preferred
Experience with analyzing and querying EHR data with a working knowledge of clinical workflows
Experience using the Salient tool to extract New York State Medicaid medical and prescription claims data
Familiarity with NYSDOH protocols for validating and approving analyses using NYS Medicaid claims
Experience designing and deploying surveys using Survey Gizmo or similar application
Familiarity with medical billing procedures
Competency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
Expertise in epidemiological data analysis, research, and program evaluation methodologies
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-disciplinary team environment.
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Willingness to adapt to new data structures and tackle novel problems creatively.
Working knowledge of or interest in a range of public health topics
Comfortable with shifting deadlines and priorities.
Additional Information

Develop and maintain clear and accurate data visualizations and dashboards under the direction of a senior analyst.

Run ad hoc queries of surveillance data as requested by both internal and external requesters.

Develop and carry out epidemiologic investigations under supervision. Summarize and present findings as appropriate.

Participate in the Incident Command System surveillance and epidemiology data unit to support emergency response data needs as requested.

Contribute to DOHMH efforts to promote health equity and racial justice.

About Us:

New datasets are being created every day and investors need to incorporate them to remain competitive.

YipitData is the go-to, 200+ person data team for hundreds of the largest institutional investors and corporations in the world. We identify, screen, license, clean, and analyze alternative data to help clients answer their key questions.

We have amazing reviews (and a 5-star rating!) on Glassdoor and are one of Inc's Best Workplaces - a fast-growing technology company based in NYC, backed by Norwest Venture Partners and with a strong culture focused on mastery, ownership, and purpose.

About The Role:

We are expanding our data team by hiring Data Analysts (official title: Data Specialist) who will be the key producers of our data products received by our institutional investor clients. Our Data Specialist role is a fantastic opportunity for analytical individuals with 1-4 years of experience to build the core skills required to succeed in the tech, data, and investment worlds that YipitData intersects. Recent grads with strong analytical skills are also encouraged to apply. This is a remote-friendly opportunity that can sit in NYC (where our headquarter is located), or anywhere in the US.

For this job, we believe people of all experience levels can be successful, so we aim to have a career ladder that starts everyone off in the same range regardless of experience. We reward strong performance with frequent compensation increases and promotions. Strong performers are nearly doubling their starting salary within about 2 years of joining!

In this role, you'll gain experience in:

Programming: Learn Python and SQL or sharpen your existing skills by running our growing portfolio of data products.
Data: Work with massive amounts of data on the performance of important companies, using proprietary methods. You'll learn vital techniques on ensuring data accuracy and deriving key insights across a number of types of data.
Investing: Create and write data reports that are consumed by the top investors in the world. You'll gain insight into how investors think about companies and the most important questions they need to answer to make stock portfolio decisions

You are likely to succeed, If:

You have strong attention to detail
You are a methodical problem solver
You want to learn to code or hone your existing coding skills
You can clearly communicate complex concepts, both orally and written
You strive to make tasks as efficient as possible
You have an ability to manage competing priorities

What We Offer :

Our compensation package includes equity and highly competitive salary
We care about your personal life and we actually mean it. We offer flexible work hours, unlimited vacation, a generous 401K match, parental leave, team events, a wellness budget, learning reimbursement, and more!
Your growth at YipitData is determined by the impact that you are making, not by tenure, unnecessary facetime, or office politics. Everyone at YipitData is empowered to learn, self-improve, and master their skills in an environment focused on ownership, respect, and trust.
To learn more about our culture and values, check out our Glassdoor page!

Two Sigma is a financial sciences company, combining data analysis, invention, and rigorous inquiry to help solve the toughest challenges in investment management, insurance technology, securities, private equity, and venture capital.
Our team of scientists, technologists, and academics looks beyond the traditional to develop creative solutions to some of the world’s most complex economic problems.
In this role, you will join our close-knit team of quantitative researchers, data scientists, engineers, and business colleagues to translate data into actionable insights and to accelerate our vibrant research pipeline.
You will take on the following responsibilities:
Analyzing and enriching a wide range of structured and unstructured big data into datasets for analysis;
Communicating data-driven analysis and insights in the form of “data studies” that enable a nuanced understanding of our data and inform our investment research process;
Acting as data integrity managers by amplifying, measuring, and exposing data quality and completeness through automation and a process-driven approach;
Operating and extending our data platform to deliver production-grade data curation and analysis capabilities;
Researching new companies, industries, and economic phenomena, and determining how best to use our data to track key performance indicators.
You should possess the following qualifications:
2-5 years of relevant working experience
BA/BS with a strong academic track record
Applied data analysis experience with messy data
Strong Python skills; experience with SQL and relational databases
Deep intellectual curiosity and passion for data
Excellent problem solving, communication, and analytical skills
Eagerness to contribute in a fast-paced, outcome-oriented environment
While financial industry or alternative data experience is a plus, we are open-minded in our search for critical thinkers who are passionate about technology and data
You will enjoy the following benefits:
Core Benefits: Fully paid medical and dental insurance premiums for employees and dependents, competitive 401k match, employer-paid life & disability insurance
Perks: Onsite gyms with laundry service, wellness activities, casual dress, snacks, game rooms
Learning: Tuition reimbursement, conference and training sponsorship
Time Off: Generous vacation and unlimited sick days, competitive paid caregiver leaves

Under the supervision of the Senior Manager of the Privacy Program and the Chief Privacy Officer, this position supports the Privacy Program across Rochester Regional Health and its Affiliates in furtherance of our mission and to provide an effective Privacy program. The Privacy Program Coordinator will assist in the investigation of reported privacy related incidents and complaints related to state and federal privacy laws and policies. He/she will use highly specialized skills in conducting Electronic Medical Record (EMR) audits to verify appropriate access and/or identify instances of non-compliance. He/she must demonstrate a high level of integrity, maturity and responsibility due to the confidential nature of the information handled.
STATUS: Full Time
LOCATION: Riedman Campus
DEPARTMENT: Privacy Program Office
SCHEDULE: Monday-Friday
ATTRIBUTES
Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare Administration, Health Information or other related field required.
Two to five years of Health Information and healthcare experience required.
Previous management and leadership experience preferred.
DESIRED ATTRIBUTES
Advanced knowledge of state and federal laws and regulations including but not limited to: HIPAA, HITECH, New York State PHL, etc.
Demonstrated history of leadership, organization, facilitation, communication and presentation skills.
Ability to analyze risk based on investigative and research results, and understanding of the broader internal/external environment in order to develop and negotiate practical and creative solutions with stakeholders.
Ability to plan and execute using critical thinking and analytical skills to problem solve.
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office suite applications.
Ability to work independently, applying regulatory interpretation and consistency in decision making.
Experience in auditing, data analysis, performance improvement, and/or other quality management systems.
Exhibit an awareness and understanding of positive ethical and moral principles consistent with the mission and values of RRH.
RESPONSIBILITIES
 Investigates questionable or inappropriate access to protected health information (PHI) utilizing data in the EMR, and other related tools.
 Performs assigned investigations and privacy projects following Rochester Regional Health standards with minimal supervision while keeping management well apprised of status and results and determines if access was appropriate for questionable accesses according to state and federal privacy laws and RRH policy
Provides data of questionable or inappropriate access to protected health information (PHI) to Privacy Liaison(s), Human Resource Business Partners and/or Privacy leadership for RRH
Answers questions, analyzes data, conducts research, conducts interviews and makes recommendations to address privacy matters
Collaborates with Human Resources Operations Managers as needed during employee investigations to provide information in determining level of sanction against an employee.
Designs and generates reports, including program dashboard from privacy database to various groups when requested by manager.
 Monitors and closes assigned privacy cases, working closely with management to assure action plans are completed and risk is mitigated in a timely manner.
Provides education and training to health system departments in collaboration with the Privacy Program Senior Manager regarding Privacy laws and system privacy and confidentiality policies.
Performs activities associated with completing the required breach determination and notification processes under HIPAA and applicable State breach rules and requirements. Ensures all risk assessments and all other supporting documents are completed and retained in event reporting system.
EDUCATION LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS Rochester Regional Health is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
Job Description
SS&C acquired GlobeOp in 2012. SS&C GlobeOp is the leading independent provider of cloud-based fund administration services and software for the alternative investment industry, including hedge funds, fund of funds, private equity funds and managed accounts.
With a base of fund strategies that include fixed income, volatility and active trading, we offer:
Middle office, accounting and management products
Tax services for hedge funds, fund of funds and private equity funds
Derivatives processing, valuations agent, syndicated bank loans processing
Regulatory and analytics services
Managed services IT/data center and business process outsourcing
All available on a stand-alone basis to institutional clients
Position Overview
The position is a full time role working in SS&C’s New York Office at 4 Times Square. SS&C Regulatory & Analytics Solutions is a dynamic team that specialises in designing and delivering data management and analytical reporting products for clients. The team’s model is to apply technical analytical expertise to data, existing as an input or output for other line of business areas or external data providers, to efficiently meet client requirements.
This role is in SS&C’s CORE – Sightline team which specialises in providing data management and Business Intelligence solutions to a broad client base. CORE is an enterprise data management platform built to embed a user-defined ETL process bespoke to the client. Sightline is a next-generation analytics platform that sits on the CORE data warehouse providing our clients the ability to build detailed business insights, reports and control the distribution of output.
This offers a candidate a unique opportunity to join a team that runs this rapidly growing and exciting business line. The successful candidate will require either a background in data structure design and/or a strong understanding of data analytics. A large amount of this role will be client/prospect facing and will therefore require compelling communication skills.
The nature of building new products requires a close working relationship with development teams and a significant part of the team’s function is to provide specifications that can make sense from a technical and business perspective. Further, such products need to be explained clearly and comprehensively in meetings with clients, prospects and other teams within the company.
Responsibilities
Ownership of complex implementations of our platform; this will include leading the coordination of work across a number of internal and external teams, scope out of client requirements, driving the project plan to successful completion and leading the design of optimal data models to cater for bespoke reporting requirements.

Position Overview:
The primary role of the Patient Experience (PX) Analyst is to provide data management and analytic support for our valued-based care Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (CAHPS) patient experience survey performance. The Patient Experience Data Analyst position requires strong analytic and organizational skills, and the ability to develop a robust Patient and Customer Experience measurement and data reporting infrastructure. This individual will report Chief Experience Officer for Optum Tri-State and will design, produce, validate, and distribute patient experience data reports, journey maps, and other reporting needs based on CMS CAHPS criteria and Customer Experience Net Promoter Score measure specifications.
In this vital role, the analyst is responsible for continuous monitoring and measurement of patient feedback data and aggregating data into understanding and actionable reports for all key stakeholders. positionName: Research Analyst, Global Research & Insights Team
description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others. Condé Nast Entertainment was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming.
Job Description
Conde Nast is seeking a Research Analyst to join the Consumer Research & Insights team to support quantitative and qualitative primary market research studies which lead to strategic insights and ultimately recommendations against business objectives. As part of a centralized Global Consumer Marketing Department you will work across the Conde Nast portfolio of brands which includes Vogue, GQ, The New Yorker, Allure, Bon Appetit, Conde Nast Traveler, Vanity Fair, and more.
This role, with a focus on executing research studies, data analysis and report creation, will help guide strategic decisions impacting brand, editorial, and consumer marketing and revenue generating offerings across print and digital subscriptions, paid memberships, events/experiences, ecommerce and video.
Primary Responsibilities:
Program quantitative surveys in the CN research community platform
Check and clean survey data, and analyze data to uncover insights, find trends, patterns and differences in opinion among different audience groups
Review, interpret and synthesize open-ended feedback
Create PowerPoint / Google slides presentations and develop ways to visualize data in engaging and easy to understand charts and graphs
Assist in writing RFPs, screeners and discussion guides, and questionnaires
Aid Community Manager with community member engagement projects
Collaborate closely with other custom insights colleagues and research teams (digital analytics, audience development, syndicated research, etc.) to incorporate insights to provide well-rounded reporting
Effectively work with external research vendors throughout research process: data collection, data processing and results reporting; QA vendor deliverables throughout all phases of project
Respond to ad-hoc research requests
The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in consumer behavior possess the following skills & qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of relevant data analysis/market research experience
Working knowledge of a broad range of qualitative and quantitative methodologies; familiarity with market sizing and tracking studies, a plus
Experience with survey programming and data analysis software
Advanced skills in Excel / Google sheets
Ability to integrate information from a variety of sources to form actionable insights
Strong presentation design skills and abilities, including the ability to communicate quantitative data into a visually engaging story and organize/ integrate large amounts of information into concise presentations
Strong problem-solving orientation; curiosity-driven approach to research
Must be detail-oriented and highly organized
Ability to handle and prioritize multiple projects including flexibility on assignments and deadlines
Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.
Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Manager, Data Research & Analytics
Location: Midtown
Org Unit: Budget and Financial Strategy
Work Days: Monday-Friday
Exemption Status: Exempt
Position Summary

The Office of Institutional Reporting supports key decision makers in furthering the strategic mission of Weill Cornell Medicine through data governance, data management, reporting and analytics. The Data Research and Analytics Manager is in charge of operational and strategic aspects of the above domains, overseeing staff analysts in their implementation. Additionally, the Data Research and Analytics Manager will foster relationships with other organizational units in promoting institutional reporting and analytics throughout the Weill Cornell Medicine community.

Job Responsibilities
Manages staff in the implementation of data governance, data management, reporting and analytics. Supports key business stakeholders through the timely and accurate dissemination of institutional statistics.
Builds, maintains, and disseminates institutional metrics across various subject areas including administration, clinical productivity, research activity, and educational statistics.
Uses quantitative analysis, data mining, and data visualization to support decision making of key institutional stakeholders; provide insights, identify trends and opportunities for planning initiatives and strategic projects.
Responsible for the evaluation, modeling and implementation of data pipelines to streamline the reporting and analytics processes in partnership with Business Intelligence.
Supports data governance through maintenance of the institutional data glossary, data dictionaries, and reporting catalogs. Responsible for evangelization of these items across the institution, in supporting institutional policy and understanding of data.
Responsible for managing the data collection and reporting of key institutional surveys that impact accreditation, U.S. News & World Report Rankings and other highly visible public statistics.
Responsible for hiring, management and training of staff, working with leadership to develop growth opportunities for the office and its contributors.
Education
Bachelor's Degree in related field
Experience

Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in math, statistics, computer science or related field. Master’s or higher professional degrees or related certifications highly desired.

Proven coding experience in SQL & Python for data transformations, modeling and analytics.

Extensive experience using visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Qlik.

Background in statistics, with proven experience in conducting hypothesis testing, and working through parametric/non-parametric models.

Fundamental understanding and applications of data engineering principals; knowledge in datawarehouse concepts and technologies.

Experience using Microsoft suite of products including Excel, PowerPoint & OneDrive.

Six Sigma certification a plus.

Experience in higher education, academic medical centers and healthcare fields preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Demonstrated attention to detail
Demonstrated strong analytical skills
Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines
Flexible and collaborative approach
Excellent oral and written communication and inter-personal skills.
Licenses and Certifications
Working Conditions/Physical Demands

Weill Cornell Medicine is a comprehensive academic medical center that's committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery, and the education of future physicians in New York City and around the world. Our doctors and scientists-faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and the Weill Cornell Physician Organization-are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Our medical practices serve communities throughout New York City, and our faculty provide comprehensive care at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. At Weill Cornell Medicine, we work together to treat each individual, not just their conditions or illnesses, as we strive to deliver the finest possible care for our patients - the center of everything we do. Macy's is the largest NYC based digital retailer and has driven more than ten consecutive years of double-digit growth. We’re building a new type of customer-centric shopping experience - at the intersection of content, commerce, and technology - to help customers find and buy products they love.
Do you want to collaborate with a smart and talented team in a fun work environment? This is a unique opportunity to join an established company that is investing in development and growing digital business at scale. Gain first-hand experience defining the future of online and physical commerce. With a constant influx of exciting and challenging problems to solve - you'll never have a boring day at the office. We also offer many roles with the freedom to build and lead a team. Join Macy’s Digital to grow your career and help shape the future of an iconic brand.

You are a great fit if you have experience working with cross-functional teams, consulting to internal business stakeholders, creating a data-driven culture, and you’re passionate about digital retail. Strong collaborator who can influence partners and represent the Digital Analytics function in key stakeholder meetings.

Develop deep-dive analytical frameworks to uncover insights and presentations to share key insights with the enterprise.
Consistently demonstrate regular, dependable attendance and punctuality.

company: Fund For Public Health In New York Inc
description:
The Fund for Public Health in New York City (FPHNYC) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that is dedicated to the advancement of the health and well-being of all New Yorkers. To this end, in partnership with the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH), FPHNYC incubates innovative public health initiatives implemented by DOHMH to advance community health throughout the city. It facilitates partnerships, often new and unconventional, between government and the private sector to develop, test, and launch new initiatives. These collaborations speed the execution of demonstration projects, effect expansion of successful pilot programs, and support rapid implementation to meet the public health needs of individuals, families, and communities across New York City.
PROGRAM OVERVIEW
The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene’s (DOHMH) Bureau of Early Intervention (BEI) is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to help implement and support its EHR-Based Referral Project (EHR-EI) at each individual project location. This project started as a collaboration with Health and Hospitals (H+H) and, with support from Robin Hood Foundation, is expanding to include additional H+H sites as well as sites at 3 other Health Care Systems. The goals of EHR-EI are to facilitate and increase direct referrals to the Early Intervention Program (EI) from pediatric practices, improve family retention during the enrollment and evaluation period, and provide participating providers with timely feedback on the status of children they have referred.
The position will be housed within the Bureau of Early Intervention, a comprehensive interagency program that supports infants and children with developmental delays in their efforts to realize their full potential. The Early Intervention Program assists and empowers families to meet their child's and their own needs and provides eligible children, regardless of race, ethnicity, or income, with services through the program. The Bureau sits in the Division of Family and Child Health.
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Analyst will report directly to the Bureau of Early Intervention’s Director of Research and Analysis. The Data Analyst’s primary responsibilities will include developing and running data reports for senior leadership, project staff and partner sites; assisting partner institutions related to building the EHR referral form; designing and carrying out an evaluation of the EHR-based referral process including identifying appropriate comparison groups, gathering comparison data, conducting analyses, and interpreting, writing up and disseminating the results; conducting surveys of project staff, regional office staff, and families to gather feedback about the referral system; drafting data and evaluation-related sections of the project report; and collaborating with the Site Liaison to investigate and trouble-shoot barriers to care. This is a grant-funded position through August 31, 2023.
RESPONSIBILITIES
 Designs, develops and runs reports off both the NYEIS and EI HUB data systems
Summary reports for project leadership
Line lists for site monitoring
Specialized reports to investigate barriers to care
Participates in the conceptualization and design of the project evaluation including the selection of comparison groups, the data collection mechanisms, the analytic plan, and final products.
Executes all administrative and technical aspects of the evaluation, including
Assisting partner institutions related to building the referral form into the EHR.
Working with partner institutions around data sharing
