Strong analytical skills with the ability to solve business problems by analyzing large datasets
Excellent communication skills and strong attention to detail
Experience summarizing key findings in a succinct manner for senior management
Highly motivated with independent initiative and comfort working in a fast paced environment
Team oriented and collaborative approach; outstanding listening skills
Enjoys challenges and coming up with innovative solutions
Ability to assess an issue from multiple angles, resulting in deeper insights

Job Title: Marketing Data Insights Analyst

Location: Flexible

About InMarket

ISince 2010, InMarket has been the leader in 360-degree consumer intelligence, real-time marketing for thousands of major brands. Through InMarket's data-driven marketing platform, brands can build targeted audiences, activate real-time, and measure success in driving sales. InMarket's proprietary Moments offering outperforms traditional mobile advertising by 6.5x.*

About You

You are a good peep who has a blast going above and beyond to tackle daring challenges. Despite adversity, you somehow find a way to make stuff happen and are agile in a world of accelerating changes. You creatively brainstorm yet are analytical and data-driven in your decision making. You are an excellent communicator of technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders. You have a learning mindset and are passionate about bringing large datasets together to answer questions and provide recommendations based on data and metrics.

 Job Description

InMarket is seeking a talented and motivated Marketing Data Insights Analyst to join a fast-growing Marketing team! Our Marketing Data Insights Analyst will have direct access to the world's most advanced 1st and 3rd party data sets including intent, location and transactional data signals. They will use statistical tools and direct SQL queries to mine anonymous consumer behavior data to understand who, how, and why people make decisions. They will work with the data science and marketing and PR teams to identify and understand changes in consumer behaviors and provide a deeper explanation of those changes based on shifts in consumer behaviors and trends.

In this role, you will partner with Marketing and PR teams, Client Strategy, Sales, AdOps and Data Insights team to deliver market and consumer insights to drive interest, press coverage and leads. You will construct useful frameworks and analyze brand and item level intent data, visit data, purchase history to drive these recommendations. You will interpret data and translate complex concepts to external-facing stories in a clear and concise manner for reporters. You will provide custom analysis and data visualization builds for internal and external stakeholders including the PR agency and press as needed. You will collaborate with Data Science, Product and Tech to deliver novel solutions for large, open-ended requests. You will set the bar for unique, actionable and insightful data.


Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree preferably in Statistics or related quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Physics, STEM, etc.)
Advanced proficiency in Excel
SQL expert
Experience with data visualization tools including Kepler, Looker, Tableau
Experience with databases such as MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSql, BigQuery
Ability to answer business questions from our vast existing data sets
Strong data analysis, communication and presentation skills
Ability to work efficiently and effectively with quick deadlines and turn around times.


Desired Qualifications

Experience with digital marketing, advertising technology and location-based analytics
Python experience
Experience with cloud provider such as AWS Cloud, Google Cloud
Sleuthing and detective ability to find drivers behind the data
Statistical or data modeling background a strong plus
Ability to translate complex business requirements into technical specifications and develop executable code

Benefits Summary

Competitive salary, stock options, flexible vacation
Medical, dental and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Company Matched 401(k)
Unlimited PTO (Within reason)
Talented co-workers and management
Agile Development Program (For continued learning/professional development)
Paid Paternity & Maternity Leave

InMarket is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

At Nova Credit, we’re on a mission to make financial access easier, no matter where you’re from or where you go. We’ve built a platform that enables lenders to access a single, predictive cross-border credit database to help underwrite immigrants and other global citizens. In effect, we are the first global infrastructure for financial identity to seamlessly move around the world. We’re passionate about financial inclusion, and committed to building a diverse and fulfilling work culture.
The Strategic Insights Analyst will be at the heart of client engagements, spanning pre-sales through post-sales, pairing quantitative skills with business acumen to articulate and measure client outcomes of a Nova Credit partnership. This role will be a part of the Client Engagement team focusing on launching our enterprise clients and informing the business of new ways to optimize future engagements. We are looking for someone that has a passion for understanding problems, creative problem solving, and aligning teams to lay the foundation for a new function at Nova Credit.


WITHIN THE FIRST MONTH, YOU'LL
Get familiar with internal business performance datasets and tools, as well as those for a priority set of customers
Engage with internal and external customers to develop a Business Analysis roadmap to prioritize areas for custom analyses
Establish a repeatable framework to understand, analyze, and quantify key business insights that continuously optimize Nova Credit’s products


WITHIN THE FIRST QUARTER, YOU'LL
Drive strategic insights to deliver business value to clients
Coordinate across functions of the business to extract insights from our client engagements and drive the product development feedback loop
Own the reporting/quantitative analysis and forecasting of the commercial business, with focus on sales, customer engagement & success
Inform and create standard and value based pricing structures


WITHIN THE FIRST YEAR, YOU'LL
Develop and maintain a monthly and quarterly business review that delivers automated insights or triggers engagement
Own the business performance analysis process through the funnel
Inform and participate in the strategic direction and scale of Nova Credit’s products


YOUR SKILLSET
Bachelor’s Degree in analytical/quantitative field (Economics, CS, Engineering, Math)
2+ years of experience in complex, data-driven problem solving to drive business decisions
2+ years of experience in tactical problem solving, including implementing large scale projects/processes with multiple stakeholders
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, especially across cross functional teams
Familiarity with SQL and data visualization/business analytics tools such as Tableau or Mixpanel is required
Everyone is welcome at Nova Credit. We are an equal opportunity employer where our diversity and inclusion are central pillars to our company strategy. We look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural and increasingly globalized world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Sales Business Operations, Field Growth Analyst


SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Airbnb, Walmart, HSBC, eBay and adidas to create the strategies necessary to win market share. The company has raised over $112M and has nearly 400 employees across eight global offices.


SimilarWeb has been named one of INC.COM 15 ISRAELI STARTUPS TO WATCH IN 2017 and one of BUSINESS INSIDER’S TOP 50 ENTERPRISE STARTUPS TO BET YOUR CAREER ON.


As a main function of the Business Operations department, the Field Growth Analyst is the owner of a regional funnel and is responsible for analyzing, tracking targets and optimizing the sales funnel, to drive revenue growth.


The Field Growth Analyst will collaborate with the Sales and Account Management Directors and their teams to drive business insights, flag areas of risk and opportunity, enforce workflows and track KPIs.


If you’re passionate about working with data, eager to create processes and solutions based on insights, a leader and teamwork player, this is the right position for you.


As a Field Growth Analyst at SimilarWeb you will:

Conduct periodic analyses of quantitative and qualitative data, to drive business insights and flag areas of risk and opportunity in our funnel;
Lead weekly meetings with Sales and Account Management Directors, to support data-driven business decisions and track performance of reps;
Own and lead end to end regional optimization initiatives related to the performance of the revenue motion and its KPIs;
Build dashboards for the teams, track daily and weekly KPIs, and optimize operational day to day processes (Such as allocation of accounts between reps);
Work the the teams to drive adoption and enforcement of operational tools and workflows;


What will I bring to the team?


7 years of experience in analytical and/or consulting and/or operations roles
Strong analytical & operational skills – Must
Excel & Salesforce proficiency - Must, SQL & Tableau - Advantage
Ability to extract business insights from data
Exceptional attention to details
Experience working in SaaS companies - Advantage
Experience in Project Management
Strong presentation Skills


Why choose SimilarWeb?

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by the most talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.


Our Values:

Data Driven: We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
Passionate: We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
Excellence: It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
Winning Together: We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

positionName: Business Analyst - Strategic Execution Project Management
description:
Who We Are:
For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.

BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers
What We Do

In order to strengthen an Enterprise-wide approach to Program Delivery and establish a scalable resilient operating model that builds delivery capabilities across Technology, Operations, the LOBs and support functions, BNY Mellon has evolved how we deliver programs of change across the Bank. As part of this strategy, a new Enterprise Change Office (ECO) has been created to provide central oversight, governance, and strategic execution. ECO establishes policy and performs a governance function with select enterprise program delivery accountability founded on a federated model that partners with the program delivery teams from Technology, Operations, the LOBs and other functional areas across the Bank.

Job Responsibilities
Consults with stakeholders to analyze, define, and prioritize business requirements and functional and operational specifications for a functional work stream.
Formulates and defines program scope and objectives for the work stream with thorough understanding of business processes in a specific business domain.
Represents the business to all areas of IT in resolving issues and developing technology solutions.
Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes business requirements.
Translates into functional design and use case models.
Develops project scope and identifies objectives, constraints, issues, risks and assumptions for large programs.
Is accountable for overall delivery of assigned functional work stream on a large-scale program.
Aligns resources, seeks input from key constituents, and manages others to achieve desired results.
Provides guidance on development of the functional requirements and user documentation. Assists in developing implementation/conversion strategy and implementation plan.
Manages scope and change throughout the initiative utilizing formal change control and requirements traceability.
Gathers and analyzes information and develops recommendations to address major business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Works with business and technology teams to develop technology roadmap strategy.
Trains users on new or enhanced applications and/or systems of higher complexity. Serves as point of contact or subject matter expert for the business on specific systems.
Provides technical consultation concerning business implications of complex application development projects.
Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems and provides guidance to junior team members on complex testing tasks including case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution.
Uses deep expertise and broad knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Six to eight (6-8) years of total work experience is preferred.
Business Analysis and technical experience within a complex eco-system including multiple system applications is preferred, as well as, some experience managing enterprise wide programs is highly desired.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Transformation/Process Change experience is preferred.
Experience supporting clients within multiple lines of business is preferred.

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

positionName: Business Analyst - Strategy & Transformation for GBS
description:

Job Description
Main Purpose:
Global Business Services (GBS) organization has been established to provide efficient and effective services to PepsiCo businesses globally, for all sectors, with a great user experience. To enable this purpose, GBS is standing up the Strategy, Transformation, and PMO team and requires a PMO with oversight of the project management and implementation approach. This role will be responsible for the project management and integration of the broader GBS transformation vision, implementation through process and technology, and go lives on time and within budget across multiple functions. This role will work closely with other workstreams and areas including monitoring of work with functions (e.g., HR, Finance Planning, Sales, Marketing, Insights, IT, Control, Procurement), sectors, hubs, change management, consulting partners, and several key enabler workstreams (e.g., enabling HR, Finance).

The role will perform program management responsibilities for GBS, including: executive status reporting, project plan, risk management, key decision documentation, and management of interdependencies across business functions, sectors, and enabling workstreams.

Accountabilities:
General project management:

positionName: Performance Improvement Specialist /Data Analyst - Part Time
description:
POSITION: Performance Improvement Specialist /Data Analyst
Part Time - 20 hours per week
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The Performance Improvement Specialist/Data Analyst will work under the leadership of the Director of Performance Improvement to monitor Agency performance on key indicators. The Performance Improvement Specialist/Data Analyst is responsible for assisting with the collection and analysis of data across the organization related to quality of care and performance improvement measures, creating and maintaining reports and performance improvement dashboards. This position’s specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the subsequent items, and are characterized in the following five standards of performance, defined as below:
I. JOB KNOWLEDGE
Collect data across departments on key performance indicators
Conduct Satisfaction Surveys/lead focus groups for key stakeholders
Complete data analysis and maintain statistical information related to Performance Improvement
Compile reports for internal and external stakeholders, create and maintain agency dashboards
Assist the Agency in preparation for transition to value-based payment methodology and/or Managed Care
Act as role model to individuals and staff
Any additional duties as assigned

II. TEAMWORK
Encourage and maintain a positive working relationship with all departments in the agency, parents, staff, individuals served and community partners.
Communicate all health, safety, individual and/or program concerns, sensitive situations and incidents to supervisor
Attend and participate in all required and/or requested departmental or agency meetings

III. DOCUMENTATION
Complete required documentation in conformance with rules, regulations, policies and procedures and billing practices
Perform documentation reviews to ensure records are maintained in conformance with rules, regulations, policies, procedures and billing practices

IV. COMPLIANCE & ACCOUNTABILITY
Identify and report any untoward incidents
Identify, report and/or correct all safety hazards that include physical plant and/or work practices concerns and assist with investigating all work-related accidents as requested
Participate in any investigations as required
Comply with all State and Federal regulations along with agency policies and practices

V. TRAINING & DEVELOPMENT
Attend all required training, staff development programs and committees and/or meetings as required by the agency and/or State and Federal regulations

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Demonstrate knowledge of OPWDD regulations as they relate to service provision to individuals served.
Experience and/or education in the field of statistics, psychology, social work
Experience in the field of value based payments and/or managed care preferred
Possess good interpersonal, written, oral, and communication abilities and effective time management/organizational skills
Be computer literate with knowledge in agency operating systems and applicable software required for department needs, specifically Microsoft Office with proficiency in MS Excel.
Able to generate and present comprehensive written reports/dashboards and respond to questions about the report
Possess a valid driver’s license acceptable to the agency’s insurance carrier
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field plus 3-5 years of relevant experience
-Or-
A combination of education and experience that in the opinion of the reviewing agency that meets or exceeds the above standards of the program

Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
Get to know the business
General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.
About the role
A driven Data Analyst who will be able to partner with several internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver cutting edge client risk analyses. This position will address the needs of specific clients as well as all industry groups – manufacturing, financial services, energy, construction, healthcare, transportation, etc. as they relate to all lines of commercial business across AIG.
Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Manage and maintain the Data ETL Process for the Online RiskInsights Tool
Deliver customized analyses leveraging internal and external, structured and unstructured data. Utilize modeling/statistical techniques to parse out adverse experience drivers. Manipulate large data sets to synthesize insights.
Help with the process of curating, cleaning and manipulating data to enable scalability of analyses.
Leverage several internal databases (CDW, ADM etc.) as well as external data sources (NCCI, ISO etc.).
Help with advancing Data Visualization capabilities
Put together state of the art presentations to effectively communicate findings to internal and external clients
Help with external trend analyses for various industries to gather insights that will help our clients better manage risk.
Collaborate with other analytical teams to leverage tools and techniques developed across AIG.
Always strive to automate analyses where possible.
Position Requirements:
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills.
Excellent data visualization skills
Excellent presentation skills
Expertise in one or more programming languages as such as R, SAS, and Python
Advanced skills in SQL
Advanced skills in Excel and VBA
Excellent communication skills – ability to communicate with clarity across the organization.
Proven project management skills – ability to coordinate on large and complex projects across the organization.
Familiarity with Classical Statistical Analysis, Classification methods, Regression Methods, Clustering Methods, Machine Learning
Master's Degree in a technical field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering) with 4+ years of experience.
Dashboarding Skills a plus (PowerBI, Tableau)

Ascend Learning is a national leader in data driven, online educational solutions for learners, educators and employers in high-growth, licensure-driven professions spanning healthcare, fitness and wellness, skilled trades, insurance and financial services. We are passionate about accelerating learning while impacting job readiness, employment success and employee retention with the belief that our work changes lives.

Our culture is intentionally results-driven and selfless with a relentless focus on our customers. We believe in trust, transparency, freedom and responsibility with a commitment to meritocracy, inclusion and diversity of thought. Continual investment in our over 1400 employees is also a core principal realized through ongoing professional development and providing opportunities to grow, develop and lead. Ascend Learning is headquartered in Burlington, MA with additional office locations and remote workers in cities across the U.S. and in the U.K.


Job Overview

Ascend Learning is seeking an experienced Marketing and Business Data Analyst to help lead performance marketing efforts for the Healthcare division

This person will be accountable to:

Define and shape the definitive set of marketing KPI’s and insights that will create the data driven truth and goals for our growing set of businesses
Be a partner for all business marketing leads in analyzing business performance and opportunities overall and at the campaign, channel, and initiative level
Work with a cross-functional team to create standard reporting that reflects the single source of truth for marketing performance

Responsibilities

Data analysis and development of reporting methods using Tableau, Oracle, SQL, Excel, and Web Analytics for Finance and Marketing,
Help create data standards for enterprise marketing initiatives
Help establish performance goals and track marketing KPI progress
Design develop and maintain access queries, databases and excel spreadsheets to develop statistical reports for all marketing channel performance
Tracking
Analyze website and clickstream data to identify user trends and to measure the value of new site features and functionality based on site conversion and other KPI’s and provide recommendations for change
Continue collecting and analyzing monthly data in order to be able to develop a more in-depth forecasting model
Reporting
Develop on-going ad hoc reports and provided data analysis in response to requests from marketing, senior management and other functional areas to make critical business decisions based on the clickstream data obtained from our web analytics data set
Develop Reports for Marketing Team - Coordinated reporting between the sales and marketing organization, ensuring consistency and accuracy
Research, analyze and manage the needs of stakeholders, while capturing business requirements to establish business goals and determine implementation strategies with the process owners
Analysis
Perform ad hoc analysis on traffic, conversion rates, pricing, campaign performance, and other relevant data to identify upside opportunities and to diagnose drivers of volume strength and/or weakness
Help design learning agenda and plan via tactics that include: A/B Testing; Sampling; Data sourcing; Partnerships


Required Education & Experience

Minimum 3-5 years of experience in business analytics or business intelligence, ideally with experience analyzing marketing effectiveness and contributing to the optimization of marketing campaigns and initiatives
Working knowledge of BI and data warehouse concepts and terminology
Experience building complex reports in Tableau or similar platforms
Bachelor's degree in statistics, computer science or related field
Master’s degree preferred

Required Skills & Abilities

Demonstrated ability to lead including in an influence model without authority and to succeed in a dynamic and sometimes fluid work environment
Team player who is flexible to work on projects across businesses and with both internal and external stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects to ensure their quality and on-time delivery
Superior communication (written/verbal), presentation, and facilitation skills
Superior conceptual, analytical and functional modeling skills, with ability to succinctly interpret data and strategic frameworks for executives
Ability to work across both B2C and B2B business models
Excellent presentation and analytical skills including PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Microsoft Teams

Summary of Role
Our Compensation teams are the global leaders in effectively aligning executive, broad-based and sales employee pay and other rewards with the interests of our clients’ stakeholders. Our team consults to a broad array of clients on matters related to compensation benchmarking and plan design/calibration, corporate governance, legislative and regulatory trends, performance analysis and risk management, among others.

Explore an opportunity. Our business is heavily interrelated with Willis Towers Watson’s various consulting practices. As a member of our Compensation team, you will have the opportunity to work with industry-leading consultants in areas such as research, talent management, benefits, communications, and global databases.

You will have immediate exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. These experiences will help build your technical knowledge and overall industry expertise while you benefit from more structured learning interventions that are tailored to our business.
The Role
Partner with consultants and clients to design philosophies and strategies to attract, reward and retain talent
Help our clients ensure that their reward programs are competitive by performing competitive benchmarking analyses
Perform industry and financial research
Keep abreast of legal, regulatory and legislative trends that relate to corporate governance and executive compensation
Develop, analyze and calibrate incentive plan designs that help support companies’ business strategies
Draft documents presenting the team’s analytical work to client audiences
Value equity awards through the application of financial formulas
Increase efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processes

The Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in economics, finance, mathematics, statistics or any other major with significant quantitative course work, and minimum GPA of 3.0
Work experience that demonstrates strong technical and/or client service skills (analyst type of internship preferred)
Passion for solving problems and sharing solutions to exceed the standards of the client
Interest in the field of human capital as demonstrated through work experience, coursework, research assignments etc.
Ability to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills and a demonstrated ability to interact with colleagues at all levels
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel

EEO Policy

Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from ViacomCBS, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream ViacomCBS Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.

Overview & Responsibilities:
Data plays a central role at ViacomCBS Streaming, and as part of the Data & Insights Group (DIG), Business Intelligence Analysts are key to delivering actionable insights for our leadership teams to act upon. The BI Analyst is responsible for developing and generating reports, insights, & analysis across multiple systems. You will be expected to identify business, marketing, and product opportunities, challenges, and trends and be able to communicate your findings effectively to a variety of stakeholders. This role will be primarily focused on data analysis work related to Paramount+ and other streaming initiatives.

Build and manage reports showing the health of key performance metrics
Write SQL to query a data warehouse (BigQuery) for data in order to answer questions from a variety of stakeholders
Present insights and analysis to different teams and stakeholders
Develop and maintain statistical and spreadsheet models for forecasting, scenario planning, and other predictive work
Work closely with product, finance, and marketing teams to represent and capture business goals and initiatives
Develop automated dashboards and reports that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Make recommendations to the product, finance, and marketing teams on tactical adjustments to improve performance
Support A|B testing tasks with exploratory analysis, sample size calculations, and test analysis

Key Projects:
Building dashboards (using Tableau and other BI tools) that illustrate how key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics are changing over time
Refining reports, dashboards, and insights based on the needs of a rapidly changing business
Live Sports and Premiere Event reporting focused on content performance and audience acquisition
Supporting monthly and quarterly reporting initiatives
Developing our standard reporting for product KPIs and questions
Owning the forecasting model for the portfolio of properties
Perform Ad Hoc analysis on specific business problems and summarize findings in an accurate, concise, easy-to-understand manner

Basic Qualifications:
BA/BS. 2 years of relevant work experience in a digital and analytical field
At least 1 year of experience with AB testing tools like Optimizely and/ or Adobe Target * Knowledge and experience of different testing approaches (A|B, multi-variant, etc.)
Strong experience in web analytics and video analytics tools (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)
Adept with common statistical analysis and techniques
Understanding of web, native app, video measurement technology and standards
Proficient with analytical tools and languages supporting data analysis, reporting, and visualization - Excel, Microsoft Office, Google Collaborative Apps (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Data Studio), Tableau, R, Python!
Experience extracting data from databases using SQL
Strong detail-orientation with a penchant for data accuracy and good grammar
Able to effectively tell stories with data and present findings to a non-technical audience

Additional Qualifications:
Strong mathematics, statistics background
Experience using project management tools like those from Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience using Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
Experience with GitHub or BitBucket

Our Story
Xandr is a technology platform powering one of the largest global Advanced TV and Video advertising marketplaces in the industry. We scale our business as WarnerMedia people who independently build the Xandr platform and brand. For more than a decade, our data insights, premium content, powerful technology, and scaled direct-to-consumer distribution have given us a competitive edge — leading us to improving advertising for all brands, publishers, and consumers.
How do we do this? With talented, passionate people like you! We bring together people from diverse backgrounds and give them an opportunity to bring their ideas to life. Join our community to Make Advertising Better!
The Job
Become an expert in Advertising Technology, from Real-Time-Bidding to Linear Television. Use your expertise and knowledge to support data-driven-decisions from Finance, Sales, Product and Strategy to continue the success of Xandr!
You Will
Work closely with internal teammates and our largest clients to provide Return on Investment (ROI)-focused insights and recommendations

positionName: Wealth Management Global Investment Office - COO Team Business Strategy Analyst
description:
Wealth Management Global Investment Office - COO Team Business Strategy Analyst

Job Number: 3184886
POSTING DATE: Aug 20, 2021
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Analyst

DESCRIPTION
Department Overview:
The Global Investment Office (GIO) is a 170-person team of investment and research professionals dedicated to helping Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Financial Advisors with all manners of investment advice and implementation. Within GIO, investment strategists in our Market Research & Strategy (MRS) and Portfolio Construction & Investment Tools (PCIT) groups focus on delivering our Global Investment Committee’s (GIC) house views and asset allocation advice through written reports, audiocasts, conference calls and meetings. Global Investment Manager Analysis (GIMA), a group of ~70 subject matter experts and specialists, provides due diligence and analysis as well as high-conviction lists for all asset classes across every investment vehicle type for both traditional and alternative investments. Three groups—Pathway, Global Portfolios (formerly known as Firm Discretionary) and OCIO—are dedicated to implementation and offer both turn-key and customized model portfolio solutions across every client segment, from direct access to Ultra High Net Worth (UHNW) and Institutional. Clients are increasingly seeking to align investments with values while meeting their financial goals and our Investing with Impact Platform is available as an integrated offering at every point in our investment guidance. In total, the GIO team serves as a committed resource to help our Financial Advisors through all market environments in every step of the client relationship.
The COO team within the Global Investment Office coordinates publishing, technology, operations, marketing and special strategic projects. Given the increased focus on providing our various customers with highly curated, world class, timely thought leadership, the team has helped to commercialize and scale GIO which is the advice engine of Morgan Stanley Wealth Management.
Job Description:
Business Strategy Analyst will be a part of the COO team and will provide support for the data & analytics, special projects, content delivery, and culture initiatives. The analyst will gain an understanding of the GIO business areas, publications and delivery mechanisms and would learn to analyze metrics and produce senior management reporting. The analyst will have opportunities to develop ideas to improve effectiveness of the group, support employee engagement and create new culture initiatives as well as partner with key stakeholders.
Key responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:
Work on strategic projects and assist with creating audiocastsAnalyze metrics and develop ideas to enhance the effectiveness of the group and identify new opportunitiesAssist with performing analyses and presentations for the senior management to drive business strategy and developmentInvolvement in various culture initiatives to build connectivity across the departmentOpportunity to learn from other teams within GIO and gain a better understanding of the group

QUALIFICATIONS
Skills Required:
1-2 years of relevant work experienceMarket knowledge, strong presentation skills, strong written and verbal communication skills, creative.Ability to collect, organize and analyze data to inform business strategyProficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Word; ability to create polished PowerPoint presentations for various audiencesStrong interpersonal skills, technical skills, analytical and problem-solving skillsCollaborative, team player who is also able to project manage and multi-taskInterest in global financial marketsBachelor’s degree required

Pricing/Data/Deal Modeling and Analytics - IC3 Implement and build product and services pricing models. Provide costs and revenue control analysis and support. Develop pricing matrices/rate cards. Partner with other areas of the business to generate best practices and generate revenue. For deals that have been approved, ensure fee schedules are drafted and reviewed prior to sharing with the client. Work with internal teams, such as technology, finance, and client service delivery teams, to produce financial analysis and propose financial arrangements for new business or clients. Develop presentations that clearly articulate findings of unit cost analyses and how products/services will be priced. Work with business development and relationship managers to structure pricing to be more attractive and profitable and help determine margins. Work closely with revenue billing services partners and ensure invoices and fee schedules have the right components captured to avoid revenue leakage. Build complex financial models, where required. May respond to ad-hoc data requests made to the Pricing Team, including liaising with other areas of the business, as needed. No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced colleagues. Responsible for more complex products and clients that require greater product expertise. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives.
Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in financial accounting, economics preferred. Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative analyses in a business setting is preferred.
BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

NYU Grossman School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Sr. Data Sci Analyst/Engineer.

The Predictive Analytics Unit is a data science team that is a part of Medical Center IT (MCIT) and the Center for Healthcare Innovation and Delivery Science (CHIDS). Our mission is to apply the latest advances in machine learning and predictive analytics toward solving prediction and classification problems across the medical center. We are both an operational and academic group that is interested in applying machine learning in healthcare settings and pushing the boundaries of academic research.

We are seeking a qualified Senior Data Scientist/Engineer to work within the Predictive Analytics Unit at NYU Langone Health. The individual will be positioned to contribute to analytics efforts at NYU. By teaming up with clinicians, operations and administrative teams, the individual will develop innovative and impactful data-driven healthcare solutions. The Senior Data Scientist/Engineer will report to Dr. Aphinyanaphongs, while working closely with other members of the unit and NYU healthcare community at large. The position will be responsible for the following:


Job Responsibilities:


Lead specific data oriented projects of high importance, including development, deployment, and evaluation
Design and build data solutions using state of the art machine learning and informatics methods; deploy and integrate these products within the larger ecosystem of healthcare infrastructure at NYULMC
Work with large, complex and noisy clinical datasets for solving challenging problems in the healthcare domain
Build and engineer work flows to collect, store, clean and process structured as well as unstructured data, verify their integrity and appropriateness for specific business processes and analytics systems
Manage associate data scientists, engineers, and clinically trained professionals for testing novel approaches, implementation, maintenance, and improvement of predictive models.
Collaborate with the overall NYULMC healthcare community and contribute to ongoing predictive modeling / analytics efforts
Prepare and present results, reports, both oral and written, to a variety of audiences, concerning processes, models, evaluation, and impact (ROI)

Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a Masters degree in a quantitative discipline (Biomedical Informatics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Mathematics or similar) and 3 years of experience in machine learning/ data science.
Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, R) and machine learning tools (scikitlearn, R)
Knowledge of predictive modeling and machine learning concepts, including design, development, evaluation, deployment and scaling to large datasets
Familiarity with computing models for big data Hadoop / MapReduce, Spark etc.
Knowledge of databases (Relational / SQL, NOSQL MongoDB etc.)
Good grasp of software engineering principles. Experience in integrating modern software architectures.
Knowledge and some experience in operational aspects of software development and deployment, including automation, testing, virtualization and container technology
Knowledge of clinical and operational aspects of healthcare delivery.
Excellent written and oral communication skills for a variety of audiences


Preferred Qualifications:
PhD degree in a (Biomedical Informatics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Mathematics or similar eld) + 2 years experience.
Demonstrated skills in design and implementation of complex machine learning models.
Demonstrated knowledge of software engineering and operational skills through prior projects.


Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

The Company

Intersection is an experience-driven Out of Home media and technology company that delivers programming, consumer amenities, and advertising to cities. Intersection elevates the experience in cities, with a passion for enriching daily life for all the people that live in them.

What is the role?

The Sales Strategy & Enablement team at Intersection is looking for a talented Senior Sales Data Analyst to join their team! This role will be responsible for revenue reporting & analysis, as well as proactively sharing insights in an effort to support revenue growth. The Senior Sales Data Analyst will own the development and maintenance of dashboards in Tableau and Excel/Google Sheets and work closely with Revenue Leadership, Finance, Operations and Engineering.

Review and understand Intersection's data structure and reporting tools
Become familiar with and take ownership of existing reports & dashboards created in Tableau and Excel/Google Sheets
Study the competitive landscape within OOH and other traditional media formats to identify potential opportunities for revenue growth
Work with all levels of the sales organization to gather feedback on existing reports in an effort to develop and implement improvements.

Within your first year, you will:

Take inventory of all revenue reports and dashboards and implement a system for new requests in an effort to prevent duplicative reporting
Own the automation of reporting using Tableau
Proactively create new reporting and analysis based on anticipated needs of the sales organization
Identify and implement ways to help the team continuously improve and optimize our existing reporting structure, processes, use of technology, and other aspects of our business
Proactively offer insights and suggest strategic initiatives based on analysis to revenue leadership and the sales team


You are great for this role because:

You have 3+ years of experience in Sales Analysis with advanced Excel skills
You have 2+ years of experience with Tableau development
You have 1+ years of experience writing SQL queries (preferred)
You have the ability to identify trends, provide insights and suggest solutions based on analysis
You have strong analytical skills and have experience with BI tools
You demonstrate the ability to work independently and drive exceptional results
You have strong written and verbal communication skills
You can multitask, prioritize, meet deadlines and quickly pivot when necessary
You have at least a bachelor's degree in a quantitative field

About the role?

In this role, you will also be instrumental in creating forecasts for business cases, using statistical and analytical techniques to understand the key drivers towards achieving our key objectives and results. You will have a mentality of continuous improvement and strong analytical and interpersonal skills. You will enjoy working in a delivery focused, agile startup environment.

The ideal candidate for this role has a combination of Online industry knowledge, curiosity, out of the box thinking, analytic, real passion to conduct root cause analyses using data-driven insights and a strong background in quantitative analyses using large data sets.

Performance Reporting and Analysis

Optimize our KPI dashboard
Synthesis performance trends and business performance
Identify and highlight opportunities for performance improvement

Building a performance focused culture

Work with delivery teams throughout the lifecycle of programs to ensure that the right KPIs and targets have been set.
Making sure that a focus on outcomes and performance are integrated into everything we do.

Expert level in SQL

SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
Job Description
SS&C acquired GlobeOp in 2012. SS&C GlobeOp is the leading independent provider of cloud-based fund administration services and software for the alternative investment industry, including hedge funds, fund of funds, private equity funds and managed accounts.
With a base of fund strategies that include fixed income, volatility and active trading, we offer:
Middle office, accounting and management products
Tax services for hedge funds, fund of funds and private equity funds
Derivatives processing, valuations agent, syndicated bank loans processing
Regulatory and analytics services

All available on a stand-alone basis to institutional clients
Position Overview
The position is a full time role working in SS&C’s New York Office at 4 Times Square. SS&C Regulatory & Analytics Solutions is a dynamic team that specialises in designing and delivering data management and analytical reporting products for clients. The team’s model is to apply technical analytical expertise to data, existing as an input or output for other line of business areas or external data providers, to efficiently meet client requirements.
This role is in SS&C’s CORE – Sightline team which specialises in providing data management and Business Intelligence solutions to a broad client base. CORE is an enterprise data management platform built to embed a user-defined ETL process bespoke to the client. Sightline is a next-generation analytics platform that sits on the CORE data warehouse providing our clients the ability to build detailed business insights, reports and control the distribution of output.
This offers a candidate an excellent opportunity to join a team that runs this rapidly growing business line. The successful candidate will require a background in data structure design and/or analytics. A large amount of this role will be client/prospect facing and will therefore require compelling communication skills.
The nature of building new products requires a close working relationship with development teams and a significant part of the team’s function is to provide specifications that can make sense from a technical and business perspective. Further, such products need to be explained clearly and comprehensively in meetings with clients, prospects and other teams within the company.

Find solutions to analytical problems independently.
Communicate product information and reporting progress clearly and confidently to team members, management, peers, prospects and clients.
Contribute to the ideas-based culture of the team, by suggesting new projects, or new (improved) approaches to existing projects.

The Mayor's Office of Contract Services (MOCS) is a New York City oversight and service agency that manages procurement citywide, from planning and release of agency solicitations to payment of vendors. Annually, agencies procure billions in products and services from a diverse pool of vendors that represent various industries. MOCS therefore aims to ensure that the procurement process remains fair, transparent, efficient and cost-effective.


MOCS makes it easier to do business through use of end-to-end technology tools, increases transparency by publication of enriched data and hosting public hearings, and strengthens procurement operations by providing direct assistance and resources to all stakeholders. MOCS also partners with agencies and vendors to identify areas for policy reform, resulting in ongoing process improvement to reduce administrative burdens and increase the positive impact of services on communities. The MOCS Director serves as the City Chief Procurement Officer.


MOCS team members operate in a fast-paced, collaborative, service-oriented environment, where flexibility and ability to achieve results are valued. Analysts perform a range of defined tasks assigned by supervisors. All MOCS analysts are expected to deliver timely and quality work products and services, participate in ongoing improvement activities, proactively deepen their knowledge of procurement and government operations, and will use modern technology software and hardware to complete daily duties. Analysts also collaborate with other team members to implement projects, help to maintain and/or analyze operational data, and interact with external stakeholders.

Under general direction of the Payroll and Timekeeping Manager, with some latitude for independent initiative and judgment, the Analyst’s primary responsibility will be managing the agency’s timekeeping. In addition to the HR Analyst responsibilities above, the position is expected to assist in the day-to-day management of MOCS’ accounts payables (including but not limited to vendor invoice review, entering vendor payments in the City’s Financial Management System and capturing progress via reporting out to relevant supervisors).

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Reviewing weekly timesheets processed in City Time for accuracy and ensuring compliance with Citywide Time and Leave rules and regulationsManaging employee time and leave, include receiving and reviewing documentation
Generating reports in City Time, RMDS, NYCAPS, and CHRMS to analyze data, track trendsProviding guidance to staff in courteous and timely manner
Assisting in the development and implementation of agency’s human resource policies and programsMaintaining employee files in electronic and paper formProviding City Time training to new hires at orientationTrouble-shooting time and leave issues and submitting remedy tickets for escalation
Performing general administrative duties and special projects, as requested by the division head and/or supervisorOngoing professional development to strengthen skills and increase knowledge in relevant areas of procurement, technology, government operations, public policy and people and change management.Administrative duties as assigned by division head
Minimum Qual Requirements

1. Graduation from an accredited college with a baccalaureate degree; or

2. Graduation from an accredited community college plus two years of experience with administrative, analytic, coordinative, supervisory or liaison responsibilities; or

3. A four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent plus four years of experience as described in "2" above; or

4. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.
Preferred Skills

Knowledge of City Time, CHRMS, RMDS, and PMS
Minimum of one year of timekeeping experience
Proficient in Microsoft Suite, including Office, Excel and Word
Ability to maintain a high level of discretion and confidentiality
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to interface with all levels at the agency
Ability to work independently and as part of a teamStrong organizational skills with the ability to manage deadlinesMeet deadlines and work independently while paying close attention to details;
Establish relationships quickly and maximize positive team dynamics;Distill complex material, present information and make actionable recommendations;
Accurately and consistently document data on stakeholder experience and escalate critical issues;
Analyze data and summarize research to support ongoing improvement in operations and service;
Educate stakeholders about various procurement and government operations topics and tools; andEngage and support stakeholders through all phases of procurement and change.

Traackr is a global SaaS technology company providing a data-driven influencer marketing platform that marketers use to optimize investments, streamline campaigns, and scale programs. Our Customers range from some of the world’s largest companies in the beauty and personal care space to digitally native indie brands which have all made influencer management and engagement a critical practice of their marketing and advertising programs. We have offices in San Francisco, New York, Boston, Paris, London and Singapore.
The Traackr team is a small and tight-knit team of passionate individuals coming from diverse backgrounds who share knowledge and are eager to keep learning and improving. Our people-centric approach and entrepreneurial work environment allow you to discover and cultivate your passions, learn from and work closely with talented colleagues, and shape your own professional development and career.
We have fostered a culture that empowers our team to spend every ounce of energy towards solving our Customers’ problems and lifting their businesses through influencer marketing. It’s our method that tames the madness. Come join our incredible team!

Job Description
Traackr is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Professional Services Team. Traackr has been organically developing its professional services offering to support its growth. The PS team includes a team of data analysts, who bring strong analytical and technical expertise, and consultants, who bring business expertise, both responsible for the delivery of projects to Customers. The Data Analyst reports into the Professional Services Director.
The objectives of Traackr’s Professional Services team are as follows:
Become a strategic advisor to Traackr enterprise Customers to help them optimize their influencer programs by sharing industry insights and best practices and developing advanced measurement solutions
Help Customers make the most of their Traackr subscription through specific enablement services (ranging from specific data exports to added value analysis of their performance)
Generate strategic insights and thought leadership on influencer practice/innovation that will contribute to Traackr’s innovation capabilities
Develop new methodologies and approaches to data that could be prototyped with Clients and influence our future product developments
Implement and support customized market benchmarking solutions for our global clients
The Data Analyst will be a key member of this team and will be responsible for leveraging Traackr’s extensive dataset to help our clients optimize their influencer marketing programs. Key areas of focus include performance measurement, spend optimization and return on investment.
What you will do:
Collaborate with the Customer Success team to understand client needs and develop a methodology for fulfilling project requests
Identify and map the required set of data needed
Extract and aggregate the data using Traackr’s database and data scripts
Analyze results to identify trends and insights
Document processes and identify areas to streamline workflow
Collaborate with the Data and Engineering teams to contribute to the product roadmap

Qualifications
The ideal candidate for this role:
5 -7 years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills
Mastery of excel
Experience with shell scripting (or ability to learn)
Experience with data visualization; experience with platforms like Tableau, Data Studio, a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities and tight deadlines
Experience working in an international environment within multiple time zones
Advanced degree in Math, Economics, Statistics or similar field

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

MANAGER, DATA ANALYTICS - NEW YORK

OVERVIEW
The Manager, Data Analytics is responsible for assisting all sales channels (with retail as first channel) on reporting and data analysis, sales generation , service performance as well as all aspects of business ( CRM, merchandising, trend , competition) . This role will help to increase program performance metrics through data analytics and operational support activities.

It supports also the other Executive Committee members in issuing / creating reports to support other sales channels performance (WS, CRC, ECOM) as well as products performance (supply chain) and marketing activations results (marketing).
This encompasses the data management but also an analytical part to read and exploit data to support the business as well as market intelligence

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Retail/Sales Analytics (primary channel):
Monitor sales performance vs. annual sales targets for all boutiques under our retail network
Consolidate and analyze retail performance indicators to measure productivity of our markets, boutiques, product categories, sales force; measure and quantify results on retail action plans
Pilot and implement new performance measurement tools and processes for the region to facilitate the growth of our business (i.e. Retail staff performance dashboard, streamline data extraction process)
Develop and train local retail BM to maximize efficiency on managing retail analytics (including but not limited to: ensure SAP Business Intelligence implementation is well implemented)
Preparation of presentations to support management’s business strategies and decision making (strategic plan, business review, management meeting)
Embrace holistic approach sales data

Other Channels Support (40% of time):
Accompany Montblanc North America in the development of all sales channels projects
Meet with stakeholders (Exco) regarding problems that could be solved or informed via data mining methods, discussing with business stakeholders nature and objective in order to understand the business goal, and break it down into a smaller subset of problems that could then each be individually solved using data driven methods.
Support the Supply Chain / merchandising department in analyzing the products performance in the Retail Network and in evaluating the real potential of all the categories.
Liaise with the CRM to bring a global and holistic approach
Dashboard Visualization:
Where possible convert current reporting into dashboard and visualization formats in order to better highlight key causes, outcomes, relationships and takeaways.

Market intelligence:
Understand market trend and competition to enhance data analysis
QUALIFICATIONS
BA degree;
Minimum 4-5 years of retail field and/or retail operations experience working with register systems
Retail math and Microsoft application proficiency (Word, Excel II, PowerPoint) is required
2-3 years of inventory management and/or store management experience
Working knowledge of SAP
Commitment to exemplifying the highest integrity and professional business standards
Ability to adapt to changing priorities
Creative and proactive approach to problem solving and improving tools
Goal setting and roadmap development
High level of energy and a "Get it done" sense of urgency
The ability to work as part of a team, but also on an independent basis
Ability to drive results through effective written and verbal communication
Superb organizational skills with particular attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple projects on time sensitive schedules
Master in data mining

About the role
New Classrooms is seeking a Business Analyst (BA) to help design the products vital to the success of our personalized education products and services. The BA will work with all stakeholders in order to help improve the way our products are used by teachers and students and managed by New Classrooms staff, as well as with the algorithms that drive how students progress through curriculum.
The BA will interact across departments in order to elicit and document business and functional requirements, and assist product management with translation into clearly documented technical requirements and product designs. Successful candidates for this role will be highly flexible-able to switch between intense collaboration and communication and highly analytical independent work. This role represents a tremendous opportunity to have both strategic and tactical impact on some of New Classrooms’ most important assets.
What you will do
Quickly absorb and internalize existing program and product details, including how the elements work together to achieve organizational goals
Elicit business requirements in order to establish directives for the products you are assigned
Within the guidelines of those business requirements, understand a variety of user needs and stakeholder preferences in order to translate into functional requirements.
Collaborate with product management in authoring Product Strategy Documents
Document underlying feature requirements for each user story in order to maximize usability and Instructional Design philosophies for how to best progress students and translation into technical requirements for technical design and development planning.
Achieve buy-in/signoff by all stakeholders for documentation and initial scope analysis.
What we are looking for
Share our vision for a world where personalized learning is just the way students learn — a world where every student attends a school that meets them where they are, adapts to the unique ways they learn, and develops habits for lifelong success.
Minimum of 2 years, preferred 3+ years of background in product design, requirements analysis and documentation or relevant consultative/analytical experience and competencies
Ability to comprehend and adjust very complex systems, achieving simplicity when applicable or desirable
Strong analytical skills including the ability to collect, organize, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Demonstrated ability to successfully work in a highly collaborative team environment driving and managing the documentation of cross-departmental requirements/inputs
Confidence/poise to plan and lead stakeholder meetings and group solutioning sessions, resolving challenging issues and conflicting perspectives as required
Strong time management skills- able to efficiently manage and prioritize a substantial workload during peak times
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Flexible with a willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly
High tolerance for ambiguity
Role Classification and Benefits
This role is full-time and includes benefits such as rich medical, dental, and vision insurance, 37 paid days off per year (prorated for the period in which you work), paid parental leave, a professional development budget of $375 annually and a quarterly cell phone subsidy.
Commitment to Diversity
At New Classrooms we are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We strive to create and inspire better ways to give every student an educational foundation for lifelong success. In order to fully realize this mission we are dedicated to building a diverse pool of candidates including those from underrepresented backgrounds, and resolute in building an inclusive culture that supports and celebrates the diverse voices and perspectives of our employees.
Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.

Location: New York, NY

Reports to: Chief Content Officer

About AlphaSense

AlphaSense is a market intelligence platform used by the world's leading companies and financial institutions. Since 2011, our AI-based technology has helped professionals make smarter business decisions by delivering insights from an extensive universe of public and private content—including company filings, event transcripts, news, trade journals, and equity research. Our platform is trusted by over 1,800 enterprise customers, including a majority of the S&P 500. Headquartered in New York City, AlphaSense employs over 450 people across offices in the U.S., U.K., Finland, and India. For more information, please visit www.alpha-sense.com.

About the Team:

The Content team is responsible for identifying, creating, licensing and integrating best-in-class unstructured and structured data that is both self-sourced and from third party content providers. The team reports to the Chief Content Officer and has strategy, content partner management, product management, and support responsibilities for each Content vertical. We have been experiencing a rapid growth cycle across all content verticals. We value and uphold transparency, trust and accountability in our relationships within the team and with internal and external stakeholders.

About the Role:

Play a key role in delivering a breakthrough, one-of-a-kind search experience across premium content that empowers users to make smarter decisions confidently and faster than before.

We're looking for a Product Analyst on our content team to contribute to the integration and support of a variety of structured and unstructured content and data into our AlphaSense SaaS product. Discovering the right information at the right time is our bread & butter and your job is to help incorporate more differentiated and key content sets into our product to enhance the search results and user experience. The Product Analyst we seek has a passion for various types of structured and unstructured Financial & Industry Content, while understanding the workflows of our clients: Buy-side/Sell-side, investment Banking/Private Equity/Venture Capital, Corporates, Consulting and other client types. This individual strives to deeply understand what content matters to these users, and supports all the key functions on the Content team to help ensure we are successfully creating value for our clients.

Who You Are:

The ideal candidate for this role must have: a superior ability to multi-task, set priorities, stay focused and meet deadlines, a willingness to contribute independently and in collaboration with the team, a drive to continue learning new things, and function as a key source of ideas to further improve our content offering. You will contribute to the Content roadmap across the various Content verticals, collaborating with Engineering and Operations to execute on product visions. Success in this role is dependent on being highly self-motivated, data-driven, well organized, coachable, & team oriented.

Required:

Prior experience at B2B SaaS and/or enterprise software application company
A superior ability to multi-task, set priorities, stay focused and meet deadlines
Effective communication skills in working with internal colleagues and external vendor partners
Experience working with globally-distributed teams in different time zones
Solid analytical skills and outstanding attention to detail in data analysis and presentation
Strong Excel/Word/PowerPoint/Google Sheets/Google Docs/Google Slides experience
Willingness to learn new technologies and applications

Strongly Preferred:

Prior experience within the financial services or consulting industry, with a focus on market research, data analysis, and due diligence
An in-depth understanding of our clients' data requirements and daily workflows: Buy-side/Sell-side, Investment Banking/Private Equity/Venture Capital, Corporates, Consulting
Subject-matter expertise with data feeds and their components- APIs, FTPs, metadata, assorted document and data delivery types
Established existing relationships with and knowledge of a variety of content providers
Some technical experience querying databases in SQL, maneuvering data in Excel, and visualizing charts in Data Studio/Looker

What You'll Do:

Support Content team in conducting due diligence and comparative analysis of existing and prospective content sets for coverage, timeliness, history, data fill rates, data quality, relevance, etc.
Coordinate with Product Managers, Engineering, Operations and Vendors to investigate and resolve content-related Support Tickets in Jira
Assist with formulation and presentation of business cases, defining requirements/user stories, building specs, capturing edge-cases & writing test cases, working on feature wireframes
Collaborate with Content Product Managers on internal and external communications, training, presentations, etc.
Track and manage content requests and ideas in ProductBoard, and generate related reporting for review by Content team, as well as other internal presentations
Work with BI Analytics team to analyze content usage reports for trends, opportunities & areas of concern, and generate ad-hoc analysis for review by Content team leaders and other internal presentations
Track industry trends, source new content sets, and compile competitive intelligence to better evolve AlphaSense's product vision, content strategy and competitive landscape.
Coordinate with Operations teams across the globe to ensure they are empowered with appropriate information, procedures and contacts for Content issue inquiry and resolution.
Help manage partnership initiatives with content providers.

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 624,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
In today’s business environment, growth isn’t just about building value—it's fundamental to long-term business survival. So how do organizations sustain themselves? The key is a new operating model—one that's anchored around the customer and propelled by intelligence to deliver exceptional experiences across the enterprise at speed and at scale. You will deliver breakthrough business outcomes for clients—by harnessing talent, data and intelligence to revolutionize their operating models.
Operations is one of four services that make up one Accenture –the others are Strategy and Consulting, Interactive and Technology.
Responsibilities:
This position is responsible for providing business analytics for US Life science commercial brand, marketing, and sales teams.
Work with stakeholders to understand their business problems, translate those problems into data problem, and then provide insight back to the business based on those results.
Harnesses the power of the most comprehensive longitudinal dataset in the US by linking clinical, claims, prescription, lab, and social determinants of health data across over 300 million lives
Summarize analytical results, drawing out key learning’s, making recommendations and presenting to key stakeholders.
Explore and integrate third-party and open-source public health data into an existing environment
Work with Data engineers to define data requirements for modelling projects
Generate insights through a combination of quantitative and qualitative technique
Work on SQL/R/Python platform to pull and create reports using multiple sources. Should be able to write complex queries

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 2 years of experience in life sciences customer-facing roles in consulting, healthcare technology, healthcare analytics
Minimum of 2 years of hands on working with data and predictive modelling, machine learning and data science with either Python or R
Bachelor’s degree
